Yoruba: December 1 ni ìṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́ yìí bẹ̀rẹ̀, a máa ná tó mílíọ̀nù mẹ́wàá dọ́là [$10 million].

English: The work includes rebuilding nearly 500 homes and 16 Kingdom Halls, and repairing numerous other structures affected by two earthquakes, which struck Guatemala and Mexico in September.
Yoruba: A máa tún ilé tó tó ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún [500] àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́rìndínlógún [16] ṣe, àtàwọn ilé míì tí ìjì lílé tó wáyé lẹ́ẹ̀mejì ti bà jẹ́ ní Guatemala àti Mexico lóṣù September.

English: MEXICO CITY—The Central America Branch Committee will initiate a large-scale rebuilding work in Guatemala and Mexico on December 1, 2017, as part of their ongoing relief efforts following the two earthquakes that struck in September.
Yoruba: MEXICO CITY—Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka ti Central America máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ àtúnṣe tó pọ̀ gan-an ní Guatemala àti Mexico ní December 1, 2017, láti pèsè ìrànwọ́ síwájú sí i nítorí ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ méjì tó wáyé ní oṣù September.

English: The branch organized initial relief efforts immediately following the quakes, providing water, food, medicine, and clothing to our affected brothers.
Yoruba: Gbàrà lẹ́yìn tí ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ yẹn ti wáyé ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ti ṣètò ìrànwọ́, wọ́n pèsè omi, oúnjẹ, oògùn àti aṣọ fáwọn arákùnrin wa tí àjálù yẹn dé bá.

English: The next wave of relief work will focus on reconstructing Assembly Halls, Kingdom Halls, and homes of our brothers.
Yoruba: Ohun míì tí wọ́n tún máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ báyìí ni bí wọ́n ṣe máa tún Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ, Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba àti ilé àwọn arákùnrin wa kọ́.

English: In the Mexican states of Chiapas and Oaxaca, there were 655 brothers and sisters displaced after the magnitude 8.2 earthquake that occurred on September 7.
Yoruba: Ní ìpínlẹ̀ Chiapas àti Oaxaca ní Mexico, àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin ọgọ́rùn mẹ́fà àti àádọ́ta lé ní márùn-ún [655] ni kò nílé lórí mọ́ lẹ́yìn tí ìjì líle kan wáyé ní September 7.

English: The planned relief work for the two states includes rebuilding 315 homes and 15 Kingdom Halls.
Yoruba: Ohun tí wọ́n gbèrò láti ṣe ni pé kí wọ́n tún ilé ọgọ́rùn mẹ́ta àti mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún [315] kọ́, wọ́n sì máa tún Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún [15] kọ́.

English: Additionally, damaged structures scheduled to be repaired include 1,039 homes, 108 Kingdom Halls, and 3 Assembly Halls.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ sáwọn yẹn, àwọn ilé tó bàjẹ́ tí wọ́n fẹ́ tún ṣe tó ẹgbẹ̀rún kan àti mọ́kàndínlógójì [1,039], Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tó tó ọgọ́rùn kan ó lé mẹ́jọ [108] àti Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ mẹ́ta.

English: In Mexico City and the states of Mexico, Morelos, and Puebla, the 7.1-magnitude earthquake that struck on September 19 displaced 463 brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Ní Mexico City àti ní Morelos àti Puebla, àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin ọgọ́rùn mẹ́rin ó lé ọgọ́ta àti mẹ́ta [463] ni ìjì líle tó wáyé ní September 19 ba ilé wọn jẹ́.

English: A total of 158 homes will be rebuilt, and an additional 600 homes, 39 Kingdom Halls, and one Assembly Hall will be repaired.
Yoruba: Ilé tó tó méjìdínlọ́gọ́jọ [158] ni wọ́n máa tún kọ́, wọ́n tún máa tún ilé ọgọ́rùn mẹ́fà [600] ṣe, wọ́n á sì tún ṣàtúnṣe sí Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mọ́kàndínlógójì [39] àti Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ kan.

English: In Guatemala, the September 7 earthquake displaced 36 brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle tó wáyé ní September 7 ní Guatemala sọ àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin mẹ́rìndínlógójì [36] di aláìnílé lórí.

English: In the coming months, construction servants and local volunteers will rebuild nine homes and one Kingdom Hall.
Yoruba: Láàárín oṣù díẹ̀ sí i, àwọn ìránṣẹ́ ìkọ́lé àti àwọn arákùnrin tó wà ládùúgbò máa tún ilé mẹ́sàn-án àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan kọ́.

English: They will also repair 20 homes and 4 Kingdom Halls.
Yoruba: Wọ́n máa tún ilé ogún [20] kọ́, wọ́n sì máa tún Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́rin kọ́.

English: The Branch Committee estimates that the relief work, which involves 39 disaster relief committees, will cost nearly $10 million and will span five to six months.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka sọ pé àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń bójú tó ètò ìrànwọ́ mọ́kàndínlógójì [39] ló máa bójú tó iṣẹ́ yìí, ó máa ná wọn tó mílíọ̀nù mẹ́wàá owó dọ́là [$10 million] iṣẹ́ náà sì máa gbà tó oṣù márùn-un sí mẹ́fà.

English: Some 30 construction servants have made plans to move to the affected areas, and an additional 970 have volunteered to assist with the rebuilding work.
Yoruba: Àwọn ìránṣẹ́ ìkọ́lé ọgbọ̀n [30] ló ti ń gbara di láti lọ sí àwọn ibi tí àjálù yẹn ti wáyé, àwọn ará tó tó ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ó dín ọgbọ̀n [970] ló sì ti yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti lọ́wọ́ sí iṣẹ́ àtúnṣe yìí.

English: We are confident that Jehovah will bless the work and volunteer spirit of all who “share in the relief ministry” on behalf of our brothers in the affected areas.—2 Corinthians 8:4.
Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà máa bù kún iṣẹ́ yìí àtàwọn tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti ní ìpín nínú ètò ìrànwọ́ tá a ṣe fáwọn ará wa tí àjálù yìí dé bá.—2 Kọ́ríńtì 8:4.

English: Dates: June 7-9, 2019
Yoruba: Déètì: June 7 sí 9, 2019

English: Location: BBVA Bancomer Stadium in Monterrey, Mexico
Yoruba: Ibi Tá A Ti Ṣe É: Pápá ìṣeré BBVA Bancomer Stadium ní ìlú Monterrey, Mẹ́síkò

English: Program Languages: English, Mexican Sign Language, Spanish
Yoruba: Èdè: Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Èdè Adití ti Mẹ́síkò, Sípáníìṣì

English: Number of Venues Tied In: 38 in 6 different countries (Costa Rica, Guatemala, Honduras, Mexico, Nicaragua, and Panama)
Yoruba: Àwọn Ibi Tí Wọ́n Ta Àtagbà Rẹ̀ sí: Ibi méjìdínlógójì (38) ní orílẹ́-èdè mẹ́fà (Costa Rica, Guatemala, Honduras, Mẹ́síkò, Nicaragua àti Panama)

English: Peak Attendance: 39,099
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá: 39,099

English: Total Number Baptized: 393
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Ṣèrìbọmi: 393

English: Number of International Delegates: 4,682
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá Láti Ìlẹ̀ Òkèèrè: 4,682

English: Invited Branches: Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, France, Italy, Japan, the Netherlands, Paraguay, Peru, Spain, United States
Yoruba: Áwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíísì Tó Wá: Ajẹntínà, Brazil, Kòlóńbíà, Faransé, Ítálì, Japan, Netherlands, Paraguay, Peru, Sípéènì, Amẹ́ríkà

English: Local Experience: Roberto Valero, a representative of the mayor of the city of Guadalupe, visited the convention site on Saturday. Among other things, he stated: “Our government is committed to preserving the peace and security of the people. And you, Jehovah’s Witnesses, have greatly contributed to this by being good citizens. The whole city is aware of it.”"
Yoruba: Ìrírí: Roberto Valero tó jẹ́ aṣojú ìjọba ìlú Guadalupe lọ sí ibi tá a ti ṣe àpéjọ lọ́jọ́ Sátidé. Ó sọ pé: “Ohun tó ṣe pàtàkì jù sí ìjọba ilẹ̀ wa ni bí àwọn èeyàn á ṣe wà ní àlááfíà àti ààbò. Ẹ̀yin Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ń kópa tó jọjú nínú mímú kí èyí ṣeé ṣe. Gbogbo ará ìlú yìí ló sì mọ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀.”

English: Late Thursday, September 7, a magnitude 8.2 earthquake struck off Mexico’s southern Pacific coast.
Yoruba: Ní ìrọ̀lẹ́ ọjọ́ Thursday, September 7, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó lágbára gan-an wáyé ní apá gúùsù Etí Òkun Pàsífíìkì ní orílẹ̀-èdè Mẹ́síkò.

English: The quake is the strongest to hit Mexico in a century, killing at least 45 people.
Yoruba: Ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ yẹn ló le jù nínú àwọn èyí tó ti wáyé rí ní orílẹ̀-èdè Mẹ́síkò ní ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún sẹ́yìn, èèyàn márùnlélógójì [45] ló pa.

English: Sadly, we have received confirmation that one of our brothers and two of our sisters were among those who died.
Yoruba: Ó dùn wá pé a gba ìsọfúnni pé arákùnrin wa kan àti àwọn arábìnrin wa méjì wà lára àwọn tó kú.

English: Additionally, initial reports indicate that many homes of the brothers and several Kingdom Halls have been damaged or destroyed.
Yoruba: Ní àfikún sí ìyẹn, ìsọfúnni tá a kọ́kọ́ gbà fi hàn pé ọ̀pọ̀ ilé àwọn ará wa àti àwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan ló bàjẹ́ tàbí tó bàjẹ́ pátápátá.

English: Two Assembly Halls in Chiapas State were also damaged.
Yoruba: Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ méjì ní Ìpínlẹ̀ Chiapas náà bàjẹ́.

English: Assessments are ongoing.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ wọ́n ṣì ń bá àyẹ̀wò lọ.

English: We continue to pray for our brothers and sisters, confident that Jehovah will comfort and strengthen them.—2 Thessalonians 2:16, 17.
Yoruba: A ó túbọ̀ máa gbàdúrà fún àwọn arákùnrin àti àwọn arábìnrin wa, a nígbàgbọ́ pé Jèhófà máa tù wọ́n nínú, á sì fún wọn lókun.—2 Tẹsalóníkà 2:16, 17.

English: Media Contacts: International: David A. Semonian, Office of Public Information, +1-845-524-3000 Mexico: Gamaliel Camarillo, +52-555-133-3048
Yoruba: Agbẹnusọ fún Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà: Kárí Ayé: David A. Semonian, Ọ́fíìsì Agbéròyìnjáde, +1-845-524-3000 Mexico: Gamaliel Camarillo, +52-555-133-3048

English: MEXICO CITY—On December 4, 2017, a mob in Tuxpan de Bolaños, a small town located in the mountains of Jalisco, Mexico, attacked 12 of our brothers of the indigenous Huichol community and another 36 people who associate with them, banishing them from their homes.
Yoruba: MEXICO CITY​—Ní December 4, 2017, àwọn kan kóra jọ ní àdúgbò Tuxpan de Bolaños, tó wà nítòsí àwọn àpáta ní Jalisco, Mexico, wọ́n sì lé àwọn ará wa méjìlá [12] tí wọ́n jẹ́ ọmọ Huichol kúrò nílé, papọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn mẹ́rìndínlógójì [36] míì tó máa ń wá sí ìpàdé.

English: The assailants were angered that the Witnesses would not participate in traditional Huichol religious rites.
Yoruba: Àwọn èèyàn yẹn ń bínú pé àwọn ará wa ò bá àwọn lọ́wọ́ sí àwọn àṣà ẹ̀sìn tí àwọn Huichol máa ń ṣe.

English: As victims of religious persecution, our brothers have appealed to the legal authorities for relief.
Yoruba: Torí ohun tí wọ́n ṣe yìí, àwọn ará wa ti lọ bá àwọn aláṣẹ pé kí wọ́n ran àwọn lọ́wọ́.

English: Our brothers’ possessions were either stolen or thrown outside.
Yoruba: Wọ́n jí ẹrù àwọn ará wa kó, wọ́n sì ju àwọn míì síta.

English: Mexican national authorities respect Huichol traditions and culture to the extent of granting this society a certain degree of autonomy.
Yoruba: Ìjọba Mexico ò kóyán àwọn àṣà Huichol kéré rárá, torí náà, dé ìwọ̀n àyè kan, ìjọba fún wọn lómìnira láti ṣe bó ṣe wù wọ́n.

English: At the request of the traditional Huichol government, enforcers violently removed our brothers from their homes, which they subsequently ransacked, stealing doors, windows, and roofs.
Yoruba: Ṣe làwọn tó ń rí sí àṣà àwọn Huichol ni káwọn èèyàn wá lé àwọn ará wa kúrò nílé wọn, wọ́n tún jà wọ́n lólè, wọ́n yọ ilẹ̀kùn wọn lọ, wíńdò àti òrùlé wọn.

English: Any items that were not stolen were thrown into a ditch.
Yoruba: Wọ́n tún da àwọn ẹrù wọn míì sínú omi.

English: The brothers were then taken to a forest and told that they would be killed if they attempted to return.
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn náà, wọ́n mú àwọn ará wa lọ sínú igbó kan, wọ́n sì sọ pé àwọn máa pa wọ́n tí wọ́n bá pa dà wálé.

English: Huichol Jehovah’s Witnesses outside a Kingdom Hall.
Yoruba: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí tí wọ́n jẹ́ ẹ̀yà Huichol níwájú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba.

English: A representative from the branch office in Mexico traveled to meet those displaced to give spiritual support and to arrange for housing.
Yoruba: Aṣojú kan láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Mexico rìnrìn àjò láti lọ bá àwọn tí wọ́n lé kúrò nílé, kí wọ́n lè fi Bíbélì ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́, kí wọ́n sì bá wọn ṣètò ilé tí wọ́n lè forí pamọ́ sí.

English: Legal representatives for Jehovah’s Witnesses met with the director of the Jalisco government, the human rights prosecutor, the regional prosecutor, and the director of attention for crime victims.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó ń bójú tó ọ̀rọ̀ ẹjọ́ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ti lọ rí àwọn aláṣẹ ìlú Jalisco, ẹni tó ń rí sí ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn, agbẹjọ́rò fún ìjọba lágbègbè yẹn, àti ẹni tó ń rí sí ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn tá a hùwà ìkà sí.

English: These legal authorities are now investigating these crimes.
Yoruba: Àwọn yìí ti ń ṣe ìwádìí lórí ohun tí wọ́n ṣe sáwọn ará wa yìí.

English: Brother Gamaliel Camarillo, a spokesman for Jehovah’s Witnesses in Mexico, explains: “We are truly appalled that our fellow worshippers, who live peacefully in their community and respect local customs, have been attacked simply because they will not participate in religious rites that offend their conscience.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Gamaliel Camarillo, tó jẹ́ agbẹnusọ fún àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ní Mexico sọ pé: “Ó dùn wá gan-an pé wọ́n ń gbéjà ko àwọn ará wa tó jẹ ẹni àlàáfíà tó sì ń bọ̀wọ̀ fún àṣà àwọn míì, torí pé wọn ò bá wọn lọ́wọ́ nínú àwọn àṣà ẹ̀sìn tí kò bá ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn mu.

English: It is hoped that the local authorities will swiftly address this religiously driven persecution.” We pray for our brothers who have lost their homes and belongings, and we are confident that Jehovah will continue to provide the needed assistance through his organization.—Isaiah 32:2.
Yoruba: A gbà pé àwọn aláṣẹ máa ṣe nǹkan sí ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn tó ń ṣe inúnibíni sáwọn ará wa nítorí ẹ̀sìn.” À ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn ará wa tó ti pàdánù ilé àtàwọn nǹkan ìní wọn, ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà á máa lo ètò rẹ̀ láti pèsè ìrànlọ́wọ́ táwọn ará wa nílò.​—Aísáyà 32:2.

English: Media Contacts: International: David A. Semonian, Office of Public Information, +1-845-524-3000 Mexico: Gamaliel Camarillo, +52-555-133-3048
Yoruba: Agbẹnusọ fún Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà: Kárí Ayé: David A. Semonian, Ọ́fíìsì Agbéròyìnjáde, +1-845-524-3000 Mexico: Gamaliel Camarillo, +52-555-133-3048

English: On October 23, Mexico was hit with two natural disasters, Tropical Storm Vicente and Hurricane Willa.
Yoruba: Ní October 23, àjálù méjì ṣẹlẹ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdè Mẹ́síkò, ìyẹn ni Ìjì Vicente àti Ìjì Líle Willa.

English: Vicente caused severe flooding and mudslides in southern Mexico that killed 11 people.
Yoruba: Ìjì Vicente fa omíyalé tó lágbára, ó sì mú kí ẹrẹ̀ ya ní gúúsù Mẹ́síkò débi pé ó pa èèyàn mọ́kànlá (11).

English: Willa battered the Pacific coast of Mexico with heavy rainfall and wind speeds measured at 193 kilometers per hour (120 mph), forcing 4,250 people to evacuate from areas impacted by the hurricane.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle Willa ṣọṣẹ́ gan-an ní etí Òkun Pàsífíìkì ní Mẹ́síkò, òjò àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá rọ̀, ọwọ́ atẹ́gùn ibẹ̀ sì le gan-an. Èèyàn tó tó ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rin ó lé igba àti àádọ́ta (4,250) ló sì sá kúrò nílé torí ìjì líle náà.

English: The Central America branch, which coordinates the work in Mexico, reports that no brothers or sisters lost their lives or were injured in either of these storms.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì Central America, tó ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ní Mẹ́síkò, ròyìn pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tó kú, wọn ò sì fara pa nígbà tí ìjì méjèèjì jà.

English: However, in the state of Nayarit, 118 publishers were evacuated from their homes to higher ground.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Nayarit, akéde méjìdínlọ́gọ́fà (118) ló sá kúrò nílé lọ sí agbègbè olókè.

English: In Sinaloa, one Kingdom Hall and the homes of several brothers were flooded.
Yoruba: Nílùú Sinaloa, omi ya wọ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan àti ilé ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ará.

English: The homes of five Witness families in Michoacán were also flooded.
Yoruba: Omi tún ya wọ ilé àwọn ìdílé Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà márùn-ún nílùú Michoacán.

English: Local brothers and sisters have already cleaned the flooded homes and Kingdom Hall and made necessary repairs.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ àwọn ará tó wà níbẹ̀ ṣàtúnṣe tó yẹ sí ilé wọn àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tí omi wọ̀ náà.

English: We pray that our brothers and sisters in Mexico affected by these storms continue to endure, remembering the hope we all share of a future in which natural disasters will no longer occur.—2 Corinthians 6:4.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí àwọn ará wa tí àwọn ìjì yìí ṣe ní jàǹbá ní Mẹ́síkò máa fara dà á, kí wọ́n sì máa rántí pé gbogbo wa la jọ ń retí ọjọ́ iwájú tí àjálù ò ní ṣẹlẹ̀ mọ́.—2 Kọ́ríńtì 6:4.

English: Jehovah’s Witnesses released the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures in Guarani at a regional convention that was broadcast from the Bethel auditorium located in Capiatá, Paraguay, on August 16, 2019.
Yoruba: Ní August 16 2019, àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà mú Bíbélì Mímọ́ ti Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun jáde lédè Guarani níbi àpéjọ agbègbè tí wọ́n ta àtagbà rẹ̀ látinú gbọ̀ngàn Bẹ́tẹ́lì tó wà nílùú Capiatá, lórílẹ̀-èdè Paraguay.

English: Brother Daniel González, a member of the Paraguay Branch Committee, released the Bible on the first day of the convention.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Daniel González, tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka orílẹ̀-èdè Paraguay ló mú Bíbélì yìí jáde lọ́jọ́ àkọ́kọ́ àpéjọ agbègbè náà.

English: An additional 13 venues were tied in to the program by video streaming, making the grand total attendance for the Bible release 5,631.
Yoruba: Wọ́n sì wo ìtòlẹ́sẹẹsẹ náà bó ṣe ń lọ lọ́wọ́ láwọn ibi mẹ́tàlá (13) ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ míì, àròpọ̀ gbogbo àwọn péjọ nígbà tá a mú Bíbélì náà jáde sì jẹ́ ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́fà àti mọ́kànlélọ́gbọ̀n (5,631).

English: Although Spanish is widely spoken throughout Paraguay, an estimated 90 percent of the population also speaks Guarani, an indigenous language.
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé èdè Sípáníìṣì làwọn èèyàn ń sọ lórílẹ̀-èdè Paraguay, àmọ́ ó kéré tán, èèyàn mẹ́sàn-án nínú mẹ́wàá ló ń sọ èdè Guarani tó jẹ́ èdè ìbílẹ̀ ibẹ̀.

English: This makes Paraguay the only country in Latin America where the majority speaks the same indigenous language.
Yoruba: Ìdí nìyẹn tó fi jẹ́ pé ní gbogbo Latin America, orílẹ̀-èdè Paraguay nìkan ni ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ti ń sọ èdè ìbílẹ̀ kan náà.

English: One of the individuals who assisted with the translation effort observed that, prior to this translation, many brothers and sisters would pray to Jehovah in their mother tongue of Guarani.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè tó ṣiṣẹ́ lórí ìtúmọ̀ Bíbélì yìí sọ pé kí wọ́n tó mú Bíbélì yìí jáde, ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin ló jẹ́ pé èdè Guarani tó jẹ́ èdè ìbílẹ̀ wọn ni wọ́n fi máa ń gbàdúrà sí Jèhófà..

English: He explains: “Jehovah will now speak to us in Guarani. We already feel that Jehovah loves and dignifies us. Now, I feel more than ever that Jehovah is my Father.”
Yoruba: Ó sọ pé: “Ní báyìí, Jèhófà náà á máa bá wa sọ̀rọ̀ lédè Guarani. A mọ̀ pé Jèhófà nífẹ̀ẹ́ wa, ó sì mọyì wa. Ó ti túbọ̀ dá mi lójú pé Jèhófà ni Bàbá mi.”

English: Without a doubt, the Bible in Guarani will have a positive effect on the 4,934 Guarani-speaking publishers in Paraguay, helping them strengthen their appreciation for Jehovah and his organization.
Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé Bíbélì èdè Guarani yìí máa ṣèrànwọ́ fún àwọn akéde ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rin, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́sàn-án àti mẹ́rìnlélọ́gbọ̀n (4,934) tó ń sọ èdè Guarani lórílẹ̀-èdè Paraguay, ó sì máa jẹ́ kí ìfẹ́ àti ìmọrírì tí wọ́n ní fún Jèhófà àti ètò rẹ̀ túbọ̀ lágbára sí i.

English: We are confident that this translation will help readers benefit from the precious thoughts of our God.​
Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé Bíbélì yìí máa jẹ́ káwọn tó ń kà á mọ òtítọ́ tó ṣeyebíye tó wà nínú ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run wa.

English: Since the end of April 2019, heavy rains in Paraguay have caused devastating flooding along the Paraguay River.
Yoruba: Láti ìparí oṣù April 2019 ni òjò tó rinlẹ̀ tó ń rọ̀ ní Paraguay ti ń mú kí àkúnya omi ṣẹlẹ̀ láwọn agbègbè tó wà ní etí odò Paraguay River.

English: At least six people have died in the floods.
Yoruba: Ó kéré tán, èèyàn mẹ́fà ni àkúnya omi náà pa.

English: The Paraguay branch reports that this disaster has affected 137 of our brothers in several cities.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Paraguay ròyìn pé àjálù yìí kan métàdínlógóje (137) lára àwọn ará wa lóríṣiríṣi ìlú.

English: In the capital city of Asunción, floodwaters broke through the wall of a Kingdom Hall that was being used to hold a class of the School for Kingdom Evangelizers.
Yoruba: Ní ìlú Asunción tó jẹ́ olú ìlú orílẹ̀-èdè náà, omi yìí wó ògiri Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan, ó sì ya wọlé, ibẹ̀ ni wọ́n máa ń lò fún Ilé Ẹ̀kọ́ Àwọn Ajíhìnrere.fara pa.

English: Thankfully, no one was injured.
Yoruba: Àmọ́, a dúpẹ́ pé kò sẹ́ni tó fara pa.

English: The branch has already sent provisions such as food, water, and other basic necessities to the impacted brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì kó nǹkan ránṣẹ́ sáwọn ará tọ́rọ̀ náà kàn, irú bí oúnjẹ, omi àtàwọn nǹkan míì tí wọ́n nílò.

English: Since the flooding is ongoing, the branch is actively monitoring the situation and will continue to provide needed support, both physical and spiritual.
Yoruba: Torí pé àkúnya omi náà ò tíì lọ, ẹ̀ka ófíìsì ṣì ń wo bí nǹkan ṣe ń lọ sí fáwọn ará, bákan náà wọ́n ń rí sí i pé àwọn ará rí ohun tí wọ́n nílò, wọ́n sì ń ṣèrànwọ́ nípa tara àti nípa tẹ̀mí.

English: We pray for our brothers and sisters affected by these floods in Paraguay. We know that Jehovah will be their “fortified place” during this difficult time.
Yoruba: À ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn ará wa tí àkúnya omi yìí kàn ní Paraguay. A mọ̀ pé Jèhófà máa jẹ́ “ibi olódi” fún wọn lásìkò ìṣòro yìí.​

English: From May 1 to August 31, 2019, the Peru branch organized a special preaching campaign in an effort to share the Bible’s message with Peruvians who speak Aymara, an indigenous language.
Yoruba: Láti May 1 sí August 31, 2019, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Peru ṣètò àkànṣe ìwàásù kan kí wọ́n lè wàásù ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run fún àwọn ará Peru tí wọ́n ń sọ èdè ìbílẹ̀ tó ń jẹ́ Aymara.

English: The campaign was a resounding success.
Yoruba: Àkànṣe ìwàásù náà kẹ́sẹ járí gan-an ni.

English: Participants placed 7,893 pieces of literature and showed our videos some 2,500 times.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó lọ́wọ́ nínú ẹ̀ fi ìwé ẹgbẹ̀rún méje, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́jọ àti mẹ́tàléláàádọ́rùn-ún (7,893) sóde, wọ́n sì fi fídíò wa han àwọn èèyàn ní ìgbà ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì àti ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún (2,500).

English: By the end of the campaign, our brothers had started 381 Bible studies.
Yoruba: Nígbà tí àkànṣe ìwàásù náà fi máa parí, àwọn ará wa ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì pẹ̀lú ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta àti mọ́kànlélọ́gọ́rin (381) èèyàn.

English: There are approximately 450,000 Aymara speakers in Peru, almost 300,000 of whom live in the region of Puno.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó ń sọ èdè Aymara lórílẹ̀-èdè Peru tó ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà àádọ́ta-lé-ní-irínwó (450,000), ó sì fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọ̀ọ́dúnrún (300,000) lára wọn tó ń gbé ní ìlú Puno.

English: Currently, there are 331 Aymara-speaking publishers, who meet in seven congregations and eight groups.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, iye àwọn akéde tó ń sọ èdè Aymara jẹ́ ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta àti mọ́kànlélọ́gbọ̀n (331), wọ́n wà ní ìjọ méje àti àwùjọ mẹ́jọ.

English: Since the territory is so vast compared to the number of publishers in Peru, Aymara-speaking publishers from Chile joined in the campaign effort.
Yoruba: Ìpínlẹ̀ ìwàásù tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè Peru fẹ̀ ju ohun tí àwọn akéde tó wà níbẹ̀ lè kárí lọ, torí náà àwọn akéde tó ń sọ èdè Aymara lórílẹ̀-èdè Chile wá dara pọ̀ mọ́ wọn fún àkànṣe ìwàásù náà.

English: To reach Aymara-speaking residents, at times our brothers had to climb up to 5,000 meters (16,404 feet) above sea level and preach in temperatures of zero degrees Celsius (32ºF).
Yoruba: Kí àwọn ará lè dé ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn tó ń sọ èdè Aymara, ìgbà míì wà tí wọ́n máa ń gun òkè tó fi ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-un (5,000) mítà ga ju ìtẹ́jú òkun lọ, wọ́n á sì wàásù níbi tó tutù bíi yìnyín.

English: One group traveled several hours to an area where people from a nearby town were gathered for a funeral.
Yoruba: Àwùjọ kan fi ọ̀pọ̀ wákàtí rìn lọ sí agbègbè kan tí àwọn tó ti abúlé míì wá ti wá ṣe ìsìnkú kan.

English: The brothers and sisters were able to share with them the Bible’s hope for the dead.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin fi ìlérí tí Ọlọ́run ṣe nípa àwọn tó ti kú hàn wọ́n nínú Bíbélì.

English: The local authorities and the grieving family thanked the brothers and sisters because of the effort they expended to share the Bible’s comforting message.
Yoruba: Àwọn aláṣẹ abúlé náà àti ìdílé tí ọ̀fọ̀ ṣẹ̀ dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin náà fún gbogbo ìsapá tí wọ́n ṣe kí wọ́n lè wá fi Bíbélì, Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run tù wọ́n nínú.

English: In another area, our brothers and sisters found a group of people who met together twice a week to study the Bible.
Yoruba: Ní apá ibòmíì, àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa rí àwùjọ àwọn èèyàn kan tí wọ́n ń pàdé lẹ́ẹ̀mejì lọ́sẹ̀ láti kẹ́kọ́ọ̀ Bíbélì.

English: The publishers discovered that the group was using the books The Greatest Man Who Ever Lived and My Book of Bible Stories, which they had received from a relative who lived in Bolivia.
Yoruba: Àwọn akéde náà rí i pé ìwé Ọkunrin Titobilọla Julọ Ti O Tii Gbé Ayé Rí àti Ìwé Ìtàn Bíbélì tí wọ́n gbà lọ́wọ́ ìbátan wọn kan lórílẹ̀-èdè Bòlífíà ni wọ́n ń lò.

English: Once the group found out that our organization published these books, many of them began to study the Bible with the brothers and to attend our meetings.
Yoruba: Bí àwọn èèyàn yìí ṣe rí i pé àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà la tẹ àwọn ìwé tí wọ́n ń lò yìí ni ọ̀pọ̀ lára wọn ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ síí kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì, tí wọ́n sì ń wá sí àwọn ìpàdé wa.

English: Brother Albert Condor, an elder who took the lead in one group, commented: “My wife and I feel really happy to have been able to participate in this campaign.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Albert Condor, alàgbà kan tó ṣe kòkáárí ọ̀kan lára àwọn àwùjọ náà sọ pé: “Inú èmi àti ìyàwó mi dùn gan-an pé ó ṣeé ṣe fún wa láti lọ́wọ́ nínú àkànṣe ìwàásù yìí.

English: It has strengthened our faith in Jehovah because when we started traveling to the town, we weren’t sure exactly how we would get there, since the journey was difficult.
Yoruba: Ó ti jẹ́ ká túbọ̀ nígbàgbọ́ nínú Jèhófà torí pé nígbà tá a kọ́kọ́ ń lọ sí ìlú náà, a ò mọ bá ṣe máa débẹ̀, torí pé ìrìn-àjò náà nira gan-an.

English: When we arrived, we prayed to Jehovah to help us find a place to stay. He did.
Yoruba: Nígbà tá a débẹ̀, a gbàdúrà sí Jèhófà pé kó jẹ́ ká rí ibi tá a máa sùn sí, ó sì gbọ́ àdúrà wa.

English: Those prayers have strengthened me, and seeing the trust that other brothers have in Jehovah has strengthened me as well.”
Yoruba: Àwọn àdúrà tá a gbà yẹn fún mi lókun gan-an, bí mo tún ṣe rí bí àwọn ará yòókù ṣe gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Jèhófà náà tún fún mi lókun.”

English: The brothers and sisters are happy to share life-giving waters of truth from God’s Word with the Aymara-speaking people in Puno, Peru.
Yoruba: Inú àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin dùn pé àwọn wàásù Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run tó lè mú kéèyàn jogún ìyè àìnípẹ̀kun, fún àwọn ará ìlú Puno tí wọ́n ń sọ èdè Aymara lórílẹ̀-èdè Peru.​

English: Representatives from the Thailand Embassy in Peru visited the branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses located in Lima, the capital city, on June 26, 2018.
Yoruba: Ní June 26, 2018, àwọn aṣojú Ilé Iṣẹ́ Ìjọba ilẹ̀ Thailand ní Peru wá sí ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Lima, tó jẹ́ olú ìlú ilẹ̀ Peru.

English: Their purpose was to thank our brothers for the assistance given to Thai citizens in a Peruvian prison.
Yoruba: Wọ́n dìídì wá ni láti dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn ará wa torí pé wọ́n ṣèrànwọ́ fún àwọn ọmọ ilẹ̀ Thailand tó wà lẹ́wọ̀n nílẹ̀ Peru.

English: Jehovah’s Witnesses in Peru have been visiting prisons in their Bible education work since 2007.
Yoruba: Ọdún 2007 làwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ní Peru ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í lọ wo àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n kí wọ́n lè kọ́ wọn lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì.

English: But beginning in 2013, the brothers have been visiting a prison that includes Thai inmates.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ látọdún 2013, àwọn ará bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í lọ sí ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n kan tí àwọn ọmọ ilẹ̀ Thailand wà.

English: Impressed by the displays of personal interest, the Thai consul contacted the branch office to arrange a visit.
Yoruba: Inú aṣojú ilẹ̀ Thailand yìí dùn gan-an sí ìfẹ́ táwọn ará dìídì fi hàn yìí, ló bá kàn sí ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì pé òun máa fẹ́ wá síbẹ̀.

English: Brothers and sisters leaving a prison where they helped inmates learn more about the Bible.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin ń jáde bọ̀ láti ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n kan tí wọ́n ti lọ kọ́ àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì.

English: The delegation from the embassy included Mr. Angkura Kulvanij, chargé d’affaires a.i.; Mr. Pathompong Singthong, first secretary/consul; and Ms. Pradthana Pongudom, consular assistant.
Yoruba: Àwọn tí wọ́n wá láti ọ́fíìsì ìjọba ni Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Angkura Kulvanij tó jẹ́ aṣojú mínísítà; Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Pathompong Singthong tó jẹ́ akọ̀wé àgbà àti Pradthana Pongudom tó jẹ́ olùrànlọ́wọ́ aṣojú ilé iṣẹ́.

English: As they toured the branch, accompanied by members of the Branch Committee, they were familiarized with the branch’s extensive translation efforts, which include translating our publications into nine indigenous languages.
Yoruba: Bí wọ́n ṣe ń rìn káàkiri ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì náà, àwọn arákùnrin tó wà nínú Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka jẹ́ kí wọ́n rí iṣẹ́ ribiribi tí à ń ṣe lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ ìtumọ̀, lára ẹ̀ ni bá a ṣe ń túmọ̀ àwọn ìtẹ̀jáde wa sí èdè ìbílẹ̀ mẹ́sàn-án.

English: Representatives of the Thailand Embassy watch as a brother translates our publications into Peruvian Sign Language.
Yoruba: Àwọn aṣojú Ilé Iṣẹ́ Ìjọba Thailand ń wo arákùnrin kan bó ṣe ń túmọ̀ ìtẹ̀jáde wa sí Èdè Àwọn Adití Lọ́nà ti Peru.

English: An official letter from the embassy to the branch office expressed “sincere appreciation and admiration” for our brothers’ diligence in caring for “the disadvantaged and vulnerable persons in Peru, regardless of their faith or culture.”
Yoruba: Nínú lẹ́tà tí wọ́n kọ láti ọ́fíìsì ìjọba sí ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa, wọ́n sọ pé, wọ́n “gbóríyìn àti òṣùbà” fún àwọn ará wa lórí iṣẹ́ takuntakun tí wọ́n ṣe láti ṣèrànwọ́ fún “àwọn aláìní àtàwọn tí ò léèyàn ní Peru, láìka ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́ àti àṣà wọn sí.”

English: The embassy went on to commend the “tireless efforts and contributions of the staff of the Association of Jehovah’s Witnesses, Peru branch, to help alleviate the difficulties and improve the quality of life of the detained Thai citizens.”
Yoruba: Ilé iṣẹ́ ìjọba tún sọ̀rọ̀ nípa “iṣẹ́ ribiribi àti ìtìlẹyìn táwọn òṣìṣẹ́ Association of Jehovah’s Witnesses ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì Peru ń ṣe láti ṣèrànwọ́ fún àwọn ọmọ ilẹ̀ Thailand tó wà lẹ́wọ̀n nílẹ̀ Peru.”

English: The experience of our brothers in Peru demonstrates the good results that come from continuing to share the Bible’s message to people of all sorts.
Yoruba: Ohun táwọn ará wa ní Peru ń ṣe jẹ́ ká rí àyípadà rere tó máa ń wáyé tá a bá ń kọ́ gbogbo èèyàn lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì.

English: About 3,000 of our brothers and sisters are participating in a special public witnessing initiative in connection with the Pan American Games and Parapan American Games in Lima, Peru.
Yoruba: Àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tó tó ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́ta (3,000) ló wà níbi àkànṣe iṣẹ́ ìwàásù níbi térò pọ̀ sí ní àkókò eré ìdárayá tí wọ́n ṣètò fún àwọn ará Amẹ́ríkà àtàwọn míì, ìyẹn Pan American Games and Parapan American Games, èyí tó wáyé ní ìlú Lima ní Peru.

English: The games, which started on July 26, 2019, and conclude on September 1, will include more than 8,500 athletes and draw an estimated 250,000 tourists.
Yoruba: Eré ìdárayá náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní July 26, 2019, ó sì parí ní September 1.

English: The publishers have set up 100 preaching stations in 53 different locations in order to accommodate the many visitors.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó kópa nínú àwọn eré ìdárayá náà lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́jọ àti ààbọ̀ (8,500), àwọn arìnrìn-àjò afẹ́ tó wá síbẹ̀ sì tó ọ̀kẹ́ méjìlá ààbọ̀ (250,000).

English: Literature is available in Aymara, English, French, Portuguese, Quechua (Ayacucho), and Spanish.
Yoruba: Láti lè wàásù fún ọ̀pọ̀ àlejò tó ń bọ̀, àwọn akéde gbé ọgọ́rùn-ún kan (100) àtẹ ìwé sí ibi mẹ́tàléláàádọ́ta (53) ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.

English: The public witnessing carts also feature videos in Peruvian Sign Language for deaf and hard-of-hearing visitors.
Yoruba: Àwọn ìwé tí wọn tẹ̀ lédè Aymara, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Faransé, Potogí, Quechua (tí a tún mọ̀ sí Ayacucho) àti Sípáníìṣì ni a kó sórí àwọn àtẹ ìwé náà.

English: Brother Kemps Moran Hurtado, who is helping to coordinate the campaign, stated: “This initiative will allow us to reach a large concentration of people from different backgrounds and cultures, since the events draw an international audience.
Yoruba: Àwọn fídíò tí a ṣe ní Èdè Àwọn Adití Lọ́nà ti Peru tún wà níbẹ̀ pẹ̀lú fún àǹfààní àwọn àlejò tó jẹ́ adití.

English: Our public witnessing is a valuable aspect of our Bible education work—it offers a unique visible presence of Jehovah’s Witnesses to the public.”
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Kemps Moran Hurtado, tó ń ṣe kòkáárí iṣẹ́ ìwàásù yìí sọ pé: “Ètò tí a ṣe yìí á mú ká lè wàásù fún onírúurú èèyàn tí àṣà ìbílẹ̀ wọn yàtọ̀ nítorí pé orílẹ̀-èdè ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ ni àwọn èèyàn ti máa wá.

English: We are excited to hear about this increased preaching activity.
Yoruba: Iṣẹ́ ìwàásù níbi térò pọ̀ sí jẹ́ apá pàtàkì nínú iṣẹ́ kíkọ́ni lẹ́kọ́ọ́ Bíbélì tí à ń ṣe, nítorí ó ń jẹ́ káwọn èèyàn rí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tí wọ́n ń wàásù láwọn ibi térò pọ̀ sí.”

English: We are confident that Jehovah will continue to bless the work of our brothers and sisters in Peru as they continue to preach wherever people can be found.
Yoruba: Inú wa dùn láti gbọ́ nípa ìgbòkègbodò iṣẹ́ ìwàásù tó ń gbòòrò sí i yìí. Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà á máa bá a lọ láti bù kún àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa ní Peru, bí wọ́n ṣe ń tẹ̀ síwájú láti wàásù fún àwọn èèyàn níbi gbogbo tí a ti lè rí wọn.​

English: On Wednesday, September 20, 2017, Hurricane Maria, the fifth strongest hurricane ever to hit the United States, caused massive devastation in Puerto Rico.
Yoruba: Ní Wednesday, September 20, 2017, ìjì ńlá kan tí wọ́n pè ní Hurricane Maria jà, ó sì bá nǹkan jẹ́ gan-an ní Puerto Rico.

English: As a result, the entire island is currently without power, and the government has issued a 6:00 p.m. curfew.
Yoruba: Èyí ni ìjì karùn-ún tó lágbára jù lọ nínú èyí tó tíì jà lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà.

English: No injuries or fatalities have been reported among the brothers.
Yoruba: Lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí, kò sí iná mọ̀nàmọ́ná ní gbogbo erékùṣù náà, ìjọba sì ti ṣòfin pé ẹnikẹ́ni kò gbọ́dọ̀ rìn níta láti aago mẹ́fà ìrọ̀lẹ́.

English: Relief efforts are underway.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará wa kankan kò fara pa. A sì ti ń ṣètò láti pèsè ìrànwọ́ fún wọn.

English: The brothers will use an undamaged Kingdom Hall as a shelter and distribution center.
Yoruba: Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan tí kò bà jẹ́ la máa gbé, ibẹ̀ náà làá ti máa pín àwọn ohun ìrànwọ́ fáwọn èèyàn.

English: The Bethel facility in San Juan sustained minor damage.
Yoruba: Ìjì náà ba apá kékeré kan jẹ́ ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa tó wà ní ìlú San Juan.

English: The brothers there are all safe and no injuries were reported.
Yoruba: Àwọn ìdílé Bẹ́tẹ́lì wà ní àláàfíà, kò sí ẹnì kankan tó fara pa.

English: Currently, the facility has no Internet access and a generator is providing emergency power.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ íńtánẹ́ẹ̀tì ti bà jẹ́, jẹnẹrátọ̀ ni wọ́n sì ń lò.

English: We are certain that our brothers will be comforted by the diligent efforts of Jehovah’s organization to provide relief.
Yoruba: Ó dájú pé àwọn ará wa ń rí ìtùnú gbà bí wọ́n ṣe rí iṣẹ́ ribiribi tí ètò Jèhófà ń ṣe láti pèsè ìrànwọ́ fún wọn.

English: As of September 25, 2017, information from 15 of the 19 circuit overseers in Puerto Rico has been received and only one injury has been reported among our brothers as a result of Hurricane Maria.
Yoruba: Ní September 25, 2017, ohun tá a gbọ́ látẹnu àwọn alábòójútó àyíká mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún [15] lára àwọn alábòójútó àyíká mọ́kàndínlógún [19] tó wà nílùú Puerto Rico ni pé arákùnrin wa kan ṣoṣo ló fara pa nígbà tí ìjì líle Hurricane Maria ṣọṣẹ́.

English: We have yet to receive updates from the four circuit overseers on the west side of the island, since communication has not been possible.
Yoruba: A ò tíì rí àwọn alábòójútó àyíká mẹ́rin tó kù tí wọ́n wà ní apá ìwọ̀ oorùn ìlú náà bá sọ̀rọ̀ láti mọ bí nǹkan ṣe ń lọ sí níbẹ̀.

English: Brothers from nearby circuits have been acquiring motorbikes and all-terrain vehicles in order to travel to the west side to assess the situation.
Yoruba: Àwọn arákùnrin wa tó wà láwọn àyíká tó wà nítòsí ti lọ wá àwọn ọ̀kadà àtàwọn ọkọ̀ tó rọ́kú, kí wọ́n lè fi rìnrìn-àjò lọ wo àwọn ara wa tó wà ní ìwọ̀ oòrùn ìlú náà.

English: We continue to keep our dear brothers and sisters in our prayers.
Yoruba: A ó máa bá a nìṣó láti gbàdúrà fún àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa ọ̀wọ́n yìí.

English: Update: Sadly, it has been confirmed that one elderly sister died as a result of Hurricane Harvey.
Yoruba: Àfikún ìsọfúnni: Ó dùn wá gan-an pé ìjì líle Hurricane Harvey pa arábìnrin wa kan tó jẹ́ àgbàlagbà.

English: NEW YORK—Hurricane Harvey made landfall in the coastal city of Rockport, Texas, as a Category 4 storm on Friday, August 25, 2017.
Yoruba: NEW YORK—Lọ́jọ́ Friday, August 25, 2017, ìjì runlérùnnà kan tí wọ́n ń pè ní Hurricane Harvey ṣọṣẹ́ lágbègbè Rockport, Texas, tó wà létíkun.

English: By Sunday, the hurricane had been downgraded to a tropical storm but continued to devastate southeast Texas through Wednesday, August 30.
Yoruba: Nígbà tó máa fi di ọjọ́ Sunday, ìjì náà ti rọlẹ̀ díẹ̀, àmọ́ ó ṣì ń ṣọṣẹ́ lọ láwọn ibì kan ní Texas títí di ọjọ́ Wednesday, August 30.

English: The branch office in the United States has received initial assessments of how the storm system has impacted our brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ti ṣèwádìí láti mọ bí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà ṣe nípa tó lórí àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa.

English: Approximately 84,000 Witnesses live in the areas impacted by Harvey.
Yoruba: Nǹkan bí 84,000 àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ni ìjì líle náà ṣàkóbá fún.

English: No deaths are reported among our brothers and sisters, although nine were injured and five have been hospitalized.
Yoruba: Kò sí arákùnrin tàbí arábìnrin wa kankan tó kú sínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí, àmọ́ àwọn mẹ́sàn-án ló fara pa, àwọn márùn-ún sì ń gba ìtọ́jú nílé ìwòsàn.

English: A total of 5,566 Witnesses have been displaced from their homes.
Yoruba: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tí iye wọn jẹ́ 5,566 ni ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí ti sọ di aláìnílé lórí.

English: The storm caused major damage to 475 homes of our brothers; an additional 1,182 of their homes sustained minor damage.
Yoruba: Ilé àwọn ará wa tí ó tó 475 ni ìjì yẹn bà jẹ́ gan-an; láfikún síyẹn, ilé àwọn ará wa míì tí iye rẹ̀ jẹ́ 1,182 ló tún bà jẹ́.

English: Local disaster relief efforts are being coordinated with the assistance of circuit overseers in Austin, Dallas, and San Antonio.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà ní ìlú Austin, Dallas, àti San Antonio ló ń ṣe kòkáárí bí àwọn tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí ṣàkóbá fún ṣe máa rí ìrànwọ́ gbà.

English: Hundreds of brothers in these cities have made rooms in their homes available to displaced Witnesses from Houston and the Texas Gulf Coast.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ará wa tó wà láwọn ìlú yìí ló gba àwọn ará tó wá láti Houston àti Texas Gulf Coast tí ilé wọn bà jẹ́ sílé.

English: Others have donated nearly 300 tons of food, water, and supplies to those in need.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará wa míì fi òbítíbitì oúnjẹ ránṣẹ́, wọ́n tún fi omi àtàwọn nǹkan míì tó ṣe pàtàkì ṣètìlẹ́yìn fáwọn tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà ṣàkóbá fún.

English: Circuit overseers report that all congregations are reestablishing their spiritual routines.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká jẹ́ ká mọ̀ pé gbogbo àwọn ìjọ tó wà láwọn ìlú náà ló ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í bá àwọn ìgbòkègbodò tẹ̀mí wọn nìṣó.

English: Members of the United States Branch Committee are planning to visit the affected areas to provide comfort and support.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó wà nínú Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa lóríllẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ti ń ṣètò bí wọ́n ṣe máa lọ ṣèbẹ̀wò sáwọn àgbègbè tí ìjì náà ti ṣọṣẹ́ kí wọ́n lè tù wọ́n nínú, kí wọ́n sì ṣètìlẹ́yìn tó bá yẹ fún wọn.

English: “Our hearts go out to all those suffering due to the effects of Hurricane Harvey, and we are thankful for all who volunteered to help in the wake of this disaster,” states David A. Semonian, a spokesman for Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: David A. Semonian tó jẹ́ agbẹnusọ fún àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sọ pé: “A bá àwọn tí ìjì líle Harvey ṣàkóbá fún kẹ́dùn gan-an ni, a sì tún dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ gbogbo àwọn tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti ṣèrànwọ́ lẹ́yìn tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà wáyé.

English: “We especially keep our brothers and sisters who are affected by this storm in our prayers.
Yoruba: À ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí ṣàkóbá fún.

English: We also urge them to keep trusting in Jehovah’s loving arm of support.”
Yoruba: A tún ń rọ̀ wọ́n pé kí wọ́n máa bá a nìṣọ́ láti gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Jèhófà, Ọlọ́run ìfẹ́.”

English: During May 2019, news reports indicated that heavy rains and some 500 tornadoes battered the United States.
Yoruba: Lóṣù May 2019, ìròyìn fi hàn pé ojò púpọ̀ tó rọ̀ àti ọgọ́rùn márùn-ún (500) ìjì líle tó jà ní Amẹ́ríkà ba nǹkan jẹ́ gan-an.

English: Jehovah’s Witnesses in Arkansas, Indiana, Mississippi, Missouri, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, and Texas were affected by the severe weather.
Yoruba: Ojú ọjọ́ tí kò bára dé yìí kan àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Arkansas, Indiana, Mississippi, Missouri, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania àti Texas.

English: None of our brothers and sisters were killed. However, the storms injured six publishers, four of whom were hospitalized.
Yoruba: Kò sí ìkankan lára àwon ará wa tó bá àjálù náà lọ. Àmọ́, mẹ́fà lára wọn fara pa, mẹ́rin nínú wọn sì wà nílé ìwòsàn.

English: In addition, 6 homes of our brothers were destroyed and 98 homes and 12 Kingdom Halls were damaged.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn ilé mẹ́fà àwọn ará wa ló bà jẹ́ pátápátá, ilé méjìdínlọ́gọ́rùn-ún (98) àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba méjìlá sì bà jẹ́.

English: As a result of the damaged and destroyed homes, 84 of our fellow worshippers were displaced.
Yoruba: Gbogbo èyí mú kí àwọn ará mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́rin (84) kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé.

English: As the brothers continue to assess the damage, they are providing food, water, and housing to those impacted.
Yoruba: Báwọn ará ṣe ń yẹ àwọn nǹkan tó bà jẹ́ wò, wọ́n ń pèsè oúnjẹ, omi àti ibùgbé fáwọn tọ́rọ̀ náà kàn.

English: Local elders and circuit overseers are caring for the spiritual and emotional needs of our brothers.
Yoruba: Àwọn alàgbà ìjọ àtàwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà lágbègbè náà ń fún àwọn ará níṣìírí, wọ́n sì ń gbà wọ́n níyànjú.

English: We will continue to support and pray for our fellow worshippers, as they cope with the aftermath of these storms.
Yoruba: A ò ní ṣíwọ́ ìrànwọ́, a ò sì ní dákẹ́ àdúrà fáwọn ará wa bí wọ́n ṣe ń fara da ìṣòro tí ìjì tó jà ti dá sílẹ̀.

English: Since July 4, 2019, powerful earthquakes and aftershocks have struck southern California in the Mojave Desert region.
Yoruba: Láti July 4, 2019, àwọn ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó lágbára wáyé ní Gúúsù California ní agbègbè aṣálẹ̀ Mojave.

English: This includes a 7.1-magnitude quake that is considered to be one of the strongest recorded in this area in the last two decades.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ náà lágbára tó 7.1 lórí ìwọ̀n, wọ́n sì gbà pé ó wà lára àwọn ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó tíì lágbára jù lọ ní agbègbè yìí láti ogún (20) ọdún sẹ́yìn.

English: The quakes occurred near the city of Ridgecrest, which is home to 215 publishers.
Yoruba: Àwọn ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ náà wáyé nítòsí ìlú ńlá Ridgecrest níbi tí àwọn akéde igba ó lé mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún (215) ń gbé.

English: Thankfully, none of our brothers were seriously injured.
Yoruba: A dúpẹ́ pé kò sí ẹnì kankan nínú wọn tó ṣèṣe gan-an, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé àwọn akéde mẹ́ta fara pa díẹ̀.

English: However, three publishers sustained minor injuries, and initial reports indicate that seven publishers are displaced.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ìsọfúnni tí a gbà fi hàn pé àwọn akéde méje ló di aláìnílé mọ́.

English: Also, 7 homes of our brothers were heavily damaged and 35 sustained minor damage.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, ilé méje tó jẹ́ tàwọn ará wa bà jẹ́ gan-an, tí márùndínlógójì (35) sì bà jẹ́ díẹ̀.

English: Additionally, two Kingdom Halls were lightly damaged.
Yoruba: Ní àfikún, Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba méjì ló bà jẹ́ díẹ̀.

English: Two circuit overseers are coordinating the relief efforts in the area.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòjútó àyíká méjì ló ń bojú tó ètò ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn tí àjálù bá ní agbègbè náà.

English: The circuit overseers and local elders are also shepherding the brothers and sisters affected by the earthquake.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòjútó àyíká yìí àti àwọn alàgbà tún ń ṣèbẹ̀wò olùṣọ́ àgùntàn sọ́dọ̀ àwọn arákùnrin àti arábínrin tí àjálù náà bá.

English: We pray that Jehovah continues to provide our fellow worshippers with the wisdom needed to cope with natural disasters like these.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà fún àwọn ará wa lọ́gbọ́n tí wọ́n nílò láti kojú àwọn àjálù bí èyí.​

English: Dates: August 16-18, 2019
Yoruba: Ọjọ́ Tí A Ṣe É: August 16 sí 18, 2019

English: Location: The Dome at America’s Center in St. Louis, Missouri, United States
Yoruba: Ibi Tí A Ti Ṣe É: Ilé Olórùlé Rìbìtì tí wọ́n ń pè ní “The Dome” tó wà ní St. Louis, Missouri, lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà

English: Program Languages: English, Croatian
Yoruba: Èdè: Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Croatian

English: Peak Attendance: 28,122
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá: 28,122

English: Total Number Baptized: 224
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Ṣèrìbọmi: 224

English: Number of International Delegates: 5,000
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá Láti Ilẹ̀ Òkèèrè: 5,000

English: Invited Branches: Argentina, Australasia, Britain, Canada, Central Europe, Colombia, Croatia, Czech-Slovak, Finland, France, Japan, Philippines, Poland, Portugal, Scandinavia, Serbia, South Africa
Yoruba: Àwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì Tá A Pè: Argentina, Australasia, ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Kánádà, Central Europe,, Kòlóńbíà, Croatia, Czech-Slovak, Finland, Faransé, Japan, Philippines, Poland, Portugal, Scandinavia, Serbia, South Africa

English: Local Experiences: Martin Gulley, external communications manager for Metrolink, commented:
Yoruba: Ìrírí: Martin Gulley, tó jẹ́ agbẹnusọ fún iléeṣẹ́ Metrolink sọ pé:n.

English: “You can say you love someone. You can say you love something.
Yoruba: “O lè sọ pé o nífẹ̀ẹ́ ẹnì kan tàbí ohun kan.

English: But until you put it into action, it’s not [love] necessarily.
Yoruba: Àmọ́, ó dìgbà tó o bá fi ìfẹ́ yẹn hàn ká tó mọ̀ pé kì í ṣe ọ̀rọ̀ orí ahọ́n lásán ni.

English: You are showing love in action.
Yoruba: Bí ẹ̀yin Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ṣe ń ṣe fi hàn pé lóòótọ́ lẹ nífẹ̀ẹ́.

English: What you are doing is humbling yourself, and love humbles you, it doesn’t exalt you.
Yoruba: Onírẹ̀lẹ̀ ni yín, ó ṣe tán, ìfẹ́ máa ń jẹ́ kí èèyàn rẹ ara ẹ̀ sílẹ̀ ni, kì í jẹ́ kó gbéra ga.

English: I am identified as a Metrolink employee by this badge. You are identified as one of Jehovah’s Witnesses by the love.”
Yoruba: Báàjì tó wà láyà mi ló jẹ́ kẹ́ ẹ mọ̀ pé òṣìṣẹ́ Metrolink ni mi, àmọ́ ìfẹ́ la fi ń dá ẹ̀yin Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà mọ̀.”

English: Jerry Vallely, external communications manager for Bi-State Development (a transit agency focused on encouraging economic growth in the St. Louis region), adds:
Yoruba: Jerry Vallely ni ọ̀gá àgbà tó jẹ́ agbẹnusọ fún ilé-iṣẹ́ Bi-State Development (ìyẹn, àjọ elétò ìrìnnà kan tó ń rí sí ìdàgbàsókè ọrọ̀-ajé ní agbègbè St. Louis). Ó sọ pé:

English: “You are not just looking at tasks on a checklist. You are really thinking about the people at the end; whether it’s the friends that are coming in to town, whether it’s the city that you are working with, or whether it’s us here at Metrolink.
Yoruba: “Ìṣẹ́ tí ẹ̀ ń ṣe kọ́ ló jẹ́ bàbàrà fún un yín, ohun tó jẹ yín lógún ni àǹfààní táwọn èèyàn máa rí látinú iṣẹ́ náà, ìyẹn àwọn àlejò tó ń bọ̀, àwọn tí ẹ̀ ń bá ṣiṣẹ́ nínú ìlú, àti àwa òṣìṣẹ́ Metrolink tí a wà níbí.

English: You are thinking about the entire experience for everyone that you are working with and doing what you can to make things nicer, to make things better.”
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ n ronú nípa bí inú gbogbo àwọn tí ẹ̀ ń bá ṣiṣẹ́ ṣe máa dùn, bí gbogbo nǹkan ṣe máa gún régé, tá á sì sunwọ̀n sí i.”

English: On November 30, 2018, a magnitude 7.0 earthquake struck just outside of Anchorage, Alaska.
Yoruba: Ní November 30, 2018, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó lágbára ṣẹlẹ̀ nítòsí ìlú Anchorage, ìpínlẹ̀ Alaska.

English: Although no casualties were reported from the quake, there was significant damage to roadways as reported on by the media.
Yoruba: Bí ó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kò sẹ́ni tó bá ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ náà lọ, àwọn oníròyìn sọ pé ó ba àwọn ọ̀nà jẹ́ gan-an.

English: The United States branch reports that seven publishers sustained minor injuries resulting from the quake.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà ròyìn pé àwọn akéde méje fara pa díẹ̀ nígbà tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí wáyé.

English: Sixteen homes of our brothers and two Kingdom Halls were damaged.
Yoruba: Ilé mẹ́rìndínlógún (16) àwọn ará wa àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba méjì ló bà jẹ́.

English: Under the direction of the circuit overseers, congregations are providing food, clothing, water, and shelter to those in need.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká ṣètò bí àwọn ìjọ á ṣe máa pèsè oúnjẹ, aṣọ omi àti ilé fún àwọn ará tó nílò wọn.

English: Additionally, local elders are providing spiritual comfort to all who have been impacted.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, àwọn alàgbà tó wà lágbègbè náà ń fi Bíbélì tu gbogbo àwọn tí àjálù náà kàn nínú.

English: Our brothers who have been affected by this earthquake remain in our prayers.
Yoruba: À ń rántí àwọn ará wa tí ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ yìí kàn nínú àdúrà wa.

English: We are confident that Jehovah will be a strength and a stronghold for his people as they continue to trust in him.
Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà máa jẹ́ agbára àti ibi ààbò fún àwọn èèyàn rẹ̀ bí wọ́n ṣe ń gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé e.

English: Brother Albert Barnett and his wife, Sister Susan Barnett, from the West Congregation in Tuscaloosa, Alabama Severe weather ripped through parts of the southern and midwestern United States on January 11 and 12, 2020.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Albert Barnett àti ìyàwó rẹ̀, Arábìnrin Susan Barnett, ń dara pọ̀ mọ́ ìjọ West nílùú Tuscaloosa, ìpínlẹ̀ Alabama Ní January 11 àti 12, 2020, Ìjì lílé kan jà, ó sì ṣọṣẹ́ làwọn agbègbè kan ní orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà.

English: Two days of heavy rain, high winds, and numerous tornadoes caused major damage across multiple states.
Yoruba: Ọṣẹ́ kékeré kọ́ ní àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá òjò, ìjì tó fẹ́ atẹ́gùn àti ìjì líle tó ṣẹlẹ̀ fún odindi ọjọ́ méjì ṣe ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìpínlẹ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdè yẹn.

English: Sadly, Brother Albert Barnett and his wife, Sister Susan Barnett, 85 and 75 years old respectively, were killed when a tornado struck their mobile home.
Yoruba: Ó bani nínú jẹ́ pé Arákùnrin Albert Barnett ẹni ọdún márùndínláàádọ́rùn-ún (85) àti ìyàwó rẹ̀, Arábìnrin Susan Barnett, tó jẹ́ ẹni ọdún márùndínlọ́gọ́rin (75) kú nígbà tí ìjì líle náà kọlu ilé wọn.

English: The United States branch also reports that at least four of our brothers’ homes sustained minor damage, along with two Kingdom Halls.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ròyìn pé, ó kéré tán ilé àwọn ará wa mẹ́rin àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba méjì ni ìjì náà kọlù, àmọ́ àwọn ilé náà kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ bà jẹ́ púpọ̀.

English: Additionally, the storms caused major damage to a brother’s business property.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ìjì líle náà ba ilé tí arákùnrin wa kan ti ń tajà jẹ́ gan-an.

English: Local elders and the circuit overseer are offering practical and spiritual support to those affected by this disaster.
Yoruba: Àwọn alàgbà àtàwọn alábòójútó àyíká ń ṣe gbogbo ohun tí wọ́n lè ṣe láti ṣèrànwọ́ fáwọn tí àjálù náà bá, wọ́n sì ń fún wọn níṣìírí látinú Bíbélì.

English: We know that our heavenly Father, Jehovah, is providing comfort to our brothers and sisters who are grieving because of this tragedy.
Yoruba: A mọ̀ pé Baba wa ọ̀run Jèhófà ń pèsè ìtùnú fáwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó ń ṣọ̀fọ̀ nítorí àjàlù yìí.​

English: Hurricane Dorian, one of the most powerful storms ever recorded in the Atlantic Ocean, made landfall as a Category 5 storm on Great Abaco Island in the northern Bahamas on Sunday morning, September 1, 2019.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle tó ń jẹ́ Dorian ni ìjì tó lágbára jùlọ tó tíì jà lórí Òkun Àtìláńtíìkì. Erékùṣù Abaco lápá àríwá Bahamas ló ti wáyé láàárọ̀ Sunday September 1, 2019.

English: Dorian is especially dangerous due to its slow movement, high wind speeds, and heavy rains.
Yoruba: Ohun tó mú kí ìjì lílé Dorian burú gan-an ni pé, ìjì náà kìí sáré, ó máa ń fẹ́ atẹ́gùn tó le, àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá òjò sì máa ń rọ̀.

English: The storm passed by the Leeward Islands, Puerto Rico, and the Virgin Islands as a tropical storm with little or no reported damage.
Yoruba: Ìjì náà fẹ́ lọ sí erékùṣù Leewards Islands lórílẹ̀-èdè Puerto Rico àti erékùṣù Virgin Islands, àmọ́ kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ ṣọṣẹ́ púpọ̀ níbẹ̀.

English: The United States branch office continues to gather information while monitoring the storm’s impact on our brothers and also on branch-owned properties.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ń kó ìsọfúnni jọ nípa bí ìjì líle náà ṣe ṣèpalára fáwọn ará wa àtàwọn dúkìá ètò Ọlọ́run.

English: At this time, there have been no reported injuries among the 46 publishers in the two congregations on Great Abaco Island.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn tó tó wa létí báyìí ni pé kò sí akéde kankan tó fara pa nínú àwọn akéde mẹ́rìndínláàádọ́ta (46) tó wà ní ìjọ méjì tó wà ní erékùṣù Great Abaco Island.

English: However, the only Kingdom Hall on the island was destroyed.
Yoruba: Àmọ́, ìjì náà ti ba Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan ṣoṣo tó wà ní erékùṣù náà jẹ́.

English: On Grand Bahama Island, there are four congregations and 364 publishers.
Yoruba: Ìjọ mẹ́rin ló wà ní erékùṣù Grand Bahama Island, wọ́n sì ní ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta àti mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́ta (364) akéde.

English: Initial reports indicate that 196 of our brothers are displaced and 22 homes have sustained damage.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn tá a kọ́kọ́ gbọ́ ni pé àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin tó tó igba ó dín mẹ́rin (196) ló sá fi ilé wọ́n sílẹ̀, ilé méjìlélógún (22) ló bà jẹ́ díẹ̀.

English: Three homes have been destroyed.
Yoruba: Ilé mẹ́ta ló sì bà jẹ́ kọjá àtúnṣe.

English: The branch provided instruction in advance of the storm to local circuit overseers and elders in the affected areas.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ti fún àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àtàwọn alàgbà tó wà níbi tí àjálù náà ti ṣẹlẹ̀ ní ìtọ́ni kí ìjì náà tó wáyé.

English: The branch recommended that all the brothers relocate to the capital city of Nassau or other sheltered areas.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì sọ fáwọn ará pé kí wọ́n kó lọ sí olú ìlú Nassau tàbí agbègbè míì tí kò léwu.

English: We pray for our brothers and sisters who are suffering as a result of this hurricane.
Yoruba: Gbogbo ìgbà là ń gbàdúrà fáwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó wà níbi tí ìjì líle yìí ti ṣọṣẹ́.

English: We know that Jehovah sees their difficulty and will continue to give them strength to cope with this time of distress.
Yoruba: A mọ̀ pé Jèhófà ń rí ìyà tó ń jẹ wọ́n, ó sì máa fún wọn lókun tá á jẹ́ kí wọ́n lè fara da àkókò wàhálà yìí.​

English: On October 10, 2018, Hurricane Michael made landfall in Florida and proceeded to wreak havoc through the southeastern United States.
Yoruba: Ní October 10, 2018, ìjì líle kan tí wọ́n pè ní Michael jà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Florida lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, ó sì ba nǹkan jẹ́ gan-an láwọn ìpínlẹ̀ tó wà ní gúúsù ìlà oòrùn Ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà.

English: The Category 4 storm is considered one of the most powerful to hit the United States and has caused massive destruction to property.
Yoruba: Ìjì yìí le gan-an, wọ́n sì sọ pé ó wà lára àwọn ìjì tó le jù tó tíì jà lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, tó sì ba ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ nǹkan jẹ́.

English: The hurricane has also caused the deaths of at least 18 people.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle yìí tún pa ó kéré tán, èèyàn méjìdínlógún (18).

English: The hurricane affected brothers and sisters in 94 congregations and 13 circuits.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle yìí kan àwọn ará wa ní ìjọ mẹ́rìnléláàádọ́rùn-ún (94) àti àyíká mẹ́tàlá (13).

English: None of our brothers were killed in the disaster, but three suffered injuries.
Yoruba: Kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tó kú nínú àjálù yìí, àmọ́ àwọn mẹ́ta fara pa.

English: The storm damaged 528 of our brothers’ homes and 34 Kingdom Halls, and a total of 39 Kingdom Halls lost power.
Yoruba: Ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún ó lé méjìdínlọ́gbọ̀n (528) ilé àwọn ará wa àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́rìnlélọ́gbọ̀n (34) ni ìjì yìí bà jẹ́, bákan náà, ó ba iná jẹ́ ní Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mọ́kàndínlógójì (39).

English: The United States branch office, with the assistance of a Disaster Relief Committee and over 40 circuit overseers, is coordinating the relief work.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì wa lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà àti Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù ń ṣiṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú ogójì (40) alábòójútó àyíká láti ṣètò ohun táwọn ará nílò.

English: This work includes supplying our brothers with food, medical assistance, shelter, and water, as well as stabilizing homes by placing tarps on roofs and cleaning up the extensive damage from fallen trees.
Yoruba: Iṣẹ́ yìí gba pé kí wọ́n pèsè oúnjẹ, oògùn, ilé àti omi fáwọn ará, kí wọ́n ta tapolíìnì sórí ilé wọn, kí wọ́n sì palẹ̀ mọ́ gbogbo pàǹtírí táwọn igi tó wó lu nǹkan dá sílẹ̀.

English: Arrangements have also been made to provide spiritual support and shepherding to our brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Wọ́n tún ṣètò láti ṣèrànwọ́ fáwọn ará nípa tẹ̀mí, kí wọ́n sì ṣèbẹ̀wò olùṣọ́ àgùntàn sọ́dọ̀ wọn.

English: Though our fellow worshippers are not immune to the difficult circumstances of this system, including those caused by natural disasters, they confidently rely on our God for his unfailing support.
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé àwọn ohun burúkú tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ nínú ayé yìí, títí kan àwọn ìṣòro tí àjálù ń fà, ń kan àwọn ará wa, wọ́n gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Ọlọ́run pátápátá pé á máa ran àwọn lọ́wọ́.

English: Dates: July 12-14, 2019
Yoruba: Déètì: July 12-14, 2019

English: Location: NRG Stadium in Houston, Texas, United States
Yoruba: Ibi Tá A Ti Ṣe É: Pápá Ìṣeré NRG ní Houston, ìpínlẹ̀ Texas, lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà

English: Program Languages: English, Korean
Yoruba: Èdè: Gẹ̀ẹ́sì àti Korean

English: Peak Attendance: 50,901
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá: 50,901

English: Total Number Baptized: 401
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Ṣèrìbọmi: 401

English: Number of International Delegates: 5,000
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá Láti Ilẹ̀ Òkèèrè: 5,000

English: Invited Branches: Australasia, Belgium, Brazil, Britain, Canada, Colombia, Czech-Slovak, France, India, Italy, Japan, Korea, Philippines, and Scandinavia
Yoruba: Àwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì Tá A Pè: Australasia, Belgium, Brazil, Britain, Kánádà, Kòlóńbíà, Czech-Slovak, Faransé, Íńdíà, Ítálì, Japan, Kòríà, Philippines àti Scandinavia

English: Experience: Sylvester Turner, the mayor of the city of Houston, was impressed by the 50,000 Jehovah’s Witnesses and their guests who came to Houston for the convention.
Yoruba: Ìrírí: Inú Sylvester Turner tó jẹ́ olórí ìlú Houston dùn láti rí ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà àádọ́ta (50,000) àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà àtàwọn àlejò tó wá sí ìlú Houston fún àpéjọ náà.

English: He stated: “It’s an infusion, in many ways, of fresh air.
Yoruba: Ó sọ pé: “A ò lè sọ bí inú wa ṣe dùn tó torí ńṣe lara tù wa pẹ̀sẹ̀.

English: That’s why we open the doors.
Yoruba: Ìdí nìyẹn tí a fi gbà wọ́n tọwọ́tẹsẹ̀.

English: If you [Jehovah’s Witnesses] can come twice a year, you are more than welcome in the city of Houston.
Yoruba: Tẹ́yin Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà bá lè máa wá lẹ́ẹ̀mejì lọ́dún, tayọ̀tayọ̀ là á máa kí i yín káààbọ̀ sí ilú Houston.

English: Come back next year, and the year after that.
Yoruba: Àá ma retí yín lọ́dún tó ń bọ̀ àtèyí tó tẹ̀ lé e.

English: Update: The United States branch office has confirmed that, unfortunately, a 70-year-old brother from Paradise, in Northern California, has also died as a result of the Camp Fire.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn Lọ́ọ́lọ́ọ́: Ó ṣeni láàánú pé ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ti rí àrídájú pé iná Camp Fire tún gbẹ̀mí arákùnrin kan tó jẹ́ ẹni àádọ́rin (70) ọdún tó wá láti ìlú Paradise, ní agbègbè àríwá ìpínlẹ̀ California.

English: Three major wildfires in California, United States, have caused catastrophic damage and at least 48 deaths.
Yoruba: Ó kéré tán, èèyàn méjìdínláàádọ́ta (48) ló kú látàrí iná runlérùnnà tó jó lẹ́ẹ̀mẹta ní ìpínlẹ̀ California lrílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ nǹkan ló sì bà jẹ́.

English: The largest of the three blazes, known as the Camp Fire, continues to rage on in Northern California, having already burned 117,000 acres (47,000 hectares) and destroyed an estimated 7,100 structures, most of which were homes.
Yoruba: Èyí tó le jù nínú iná mẹ́tẹ̀ẹ̀ta ni wọ́n ń pè ní iná Camp Fire, iná yìí ṣì ń jo lọ ní àríwá California, ó ti jó ibi tó fẹ̀ tó ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́fà (117,000) éékà, nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún méje ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún kan (7,100) ilé ló ti run, ilé gbígbé ló sì pọ̀ jù níbẹ̀.

English: In Southern California, two blazes, the Hill Fire and the Woolsey Fire, have burned a combined total of 94,500 acres (38,000 hectares) and destroyed an estimated 435 buildings.
Yoruba: Ní gúúsù ìpínlẹ̀ California, ẹ̀ẹ̀mejì ni iná jó, wọ́n pe ọ̀kan ní Hill Fire, ìkejì Woolsey Fire, iná méjèèjì yìí jó ibi tó fẹ̀ tó éékà ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà àádọ́rùn ó lé mẹ́rin àtààbọ̀ (94,500), ilé tó sì run tó ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin ó lé márùndínlógójì (435).

English: According to one media report, the total acreage burned by wildfires in California this year amounts to “an area larger than Belgium and Luxembourg.”
Yoruba: Ìròyìn kan sọ pé, tá a bá pa orílẹ̀-èdè Belgium àti Luxembourg pọ̀, kò tíì tó gbogbo ibi tí iná jó ní ìpínlẹ̀ California.

English: Preliminary reports from the United States branch office indicate that the Camp Fire forced approximately 427 publishers to evacuate from Chico and Paradise.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn tá a kọ́kọ́ gbọ́ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ni pé iná Camp Fire lé àwọn akéde tó tó ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin àti mẹ́tàdínlọ́gbọ̀n (427) kúrò nílùú Chico àti Paradise.

English: Sadly, an elderly sister from the Ponderosa Congregation was killed by the fire.
Yoruba: Ó dùn wá pé iná yẹn pa arábìnrin àgbàlagbà kan láti Ìjọ Ponderosa.

English: Additionally, it has been confirmed that, at this time, at least 94 homes of our brothers have been destroyed or suffered major damage.
Yoruba: A tún rí àrídájú pé lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí, ó kéré tán, mẹ́rìnléláàádọ́rùn-ún (94) ilé àwọn ará wa ni iná yẹn ti run, òmíì nínú wọn sì ti bà jẹ́ gidi gan-an.

English: One Kingdom Hall in Paradise was also destroyed.
Yoruba: Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan tó wà nílùú Paradise náà run pátápátá.

English: As a result of the Hill and Woolsey fires, some 420 publishers from the cities of Oxnard, Simi Valley, and Thousand Oaks were evacuated.
Yoruba: Nǹkan bí akéde ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin ó lé ogún (420) tó ń gbé nílùú Oxnard, Simi Valley àti Thousand Oaks ló ti kúrò nílùú nítorí àwọn iná tó jó yìí.

English: Sadly, one brother and his non-Witness mother were killed in Malibu while fleeing the fire.
Yoruba: Ó ṣeni láàánú pé arákùnrin kan àti ìyá rẹ̀ tí kì í ṣe Ẹlẹ́rìí kú nílùú Malibu níbi tí wọ́n ti ń sá fún iná náà.

English: Initial assessments indicate that 21 homes of our brothers have been damaged as well as one Kingdom Hall.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn tá a kọ́kọ́ gbọ́ fi hàn pé ilé mọ́kànlélógún (21) àwọn ará wa ló bà jẹ́, tó fi mọ́ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan. Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì dá Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù méjì sílẹ̀, kí wọ́n lè pèsè ohun táwọn ará wa nílò.

English: The branch office has established two Disaster Relief Committees to care for the needs of our brothers.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká ṣètò àwọn alàgbà láti lọ ṣèbẹ̀wò sọ́dọ̀ àwọn akéde tí iná yìí ṣe ní jàǹbá, kí wọ́n sì pèsè ìrànwọ́ nípa tara fún àwọn tí àjálù náà dé bá.

English: Under the direction of their circuit overseers, local elders are providing shepherding and practical assistance to the publishers who have been affected by these wildfires.
Yoruba: Ní Saturday, November 10, wọ́n ṣe àkànṣe ìpàdé kan nílùú Chico fún àwọn ará tó lé ní igba àti àádọ́rin (270).

English: On Saturday, November 10, a special program was held in Chico for more than 270 brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka Orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà àtàwọn alábòójútó àyíká fi Ìwé Mímọ́ fún àwọn ará ibẹ̀ níṣìírí.

English: A member of the United States Branch Committee provided encouraging Scriptural thoughts along with the local circuit overseers.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà tu àwọn ará wa tó ń kojú ìṣòro tó nira yìí nínú, kó sì fún wọn lókun.

English: We pray that our brothers and sisters who are dealing with this difficult situation will be comforted and strengthened by Jehovah, remembering that very soon he will wipe away our tears and swallow up death forever.
Yoruba: A tún gbàdúrà pé kí wọ́n máa rántí pé láìpẹ́, Jèhófà máa nu gbogbo omijé wa kúrò, á sì gbé ikú mì títí láé.​

English: Dates: May 17-19, 2019
Yoruba: Déètì: May 17 sí 19, 2019

English: Location: Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, Georgia, United States
Yoruba: Ibi Tá A Ti Ṣe É: Pápá Ìṣeré Mercedes-Benz Stadium nílùú Atlanta, ìpínlẹ̀ Georgia, Amẹ́ríkà

English: Program Languages: Amharic, English, Russian
Yoruba: Èdè: Amharic, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Russian

Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá: 46,374

Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Ṣèrìbọmi: 314

Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá Láti Ìlẹ̀ Òkèèrè: 5,000

Yoruba: Áwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíísì Tó Wá: Australasia, Brazil, Britain, Kánádà, Chile, Kòlóńbíà, Etiópíà, Finland, ilẹ̀ Faransé, Gíríìsì, Hong Kong, Israel, Ítálì, Japan, Kazakhstan, Netherlands, Pọ́túgà, Ròmáníà, Scandinavia, Trinidad and Tobago

English: This is the first of 24 overviews and photo galleries that will be published in the Newsroom of jw.org following each of the international conventions scheduled for 2019.
Yoruba: Èyí ni àkọ́kọ́ lára ìtọ́wò mẹ́rìnlélógún (24) àwọn àpéjọ àgbáyé ọdún 2019 tá a máa gbé sí abala Ìròyìn lórí ìkànnì jw.org/yo bí àpéjọ kọ̀ọ̀kan bá ṣe ń parí.

English: Since May 3, 2018, the ongoing eruption of Kilauea volcano on the Big Island of Hawaii, U.S.A., has forced approximately 2,000 residents to evacuate and has destroyed at least 36 structures.
Yoruba: Láti May 3, 2018, òkè ayọnáyèéfín Kilauea tó ń bú gbàù ní Erékùṣù Ńlá Hawaii lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ti lé àwọn tó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì (2,000) kúrò nílé wọn, ó sì ti ba, ó kéré tán, ilé mẹ́rìndínlógójì (36) jẹ́.

English: Among those who have been evacuated are four Witness families and one elderly sister.
Yoruba: Ara àwọn tó ti kúrò nílé wọn ni ìdílé Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà mẹ́rin àti arábìnrin àgbàlagbà kan.

English: Although no Kingdom Halls were damaged by lava flows or volcanic debris, a magnitude 6.9 earthquake on May 4 caused minor damage to a Kingdom Hall.
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé àwọn nǹkan gbígbóná tó ń ru jáde látinú òkè yẹn ò ba Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kankan jẹ́, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ kan tó wáyé ní May 4 ba Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan jẹ́ díẹ̀.

English: A Disaster Relief Committee (DRC), along with the assistance of local brothers and sisters, is caring for the affected publishers.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù àtàwọn ará lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin tó wà nílùú yẹn ń bójú tó àwọn akéde tọ́rọ̀ náà kàn.

English: Once conditions have stabilized, the DRC will determine what additional relief efforts might be needed.
Yoruba: Tí nǹkan bá ti lójú déwọ̀n àyè kan, ìgbìmọ̀ náà máa pinnu ìrànwọ́ míì táwọn akéde náà bá tún máa nílò.

English: In view of this ongoing natural disaster, we continue to pray for our brothers and sisters that have been affected, confident that Jehovah will become their stronghold during this distressing time.
Yoruba: A ò dákẹ́ àdúrà lórí àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin tọ́rọ̀ kàn torí àjálù tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ lọ́wọ́ yìí, ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà máa jẹ́ odi agbára wọn lásìkò wàhálà yìí.

English: Dates: July 5-7, 2019
Yoruba: Déètì: July 5 sí 7, 2019

English: Location: Marlins Park in Miami, Florida, United States
Yoruba: Ibi Tá A Ti Ṣeé: Marlins Park ní Miami, Florida, Lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà
