Yoruba: Èdè: Gẹ̀ẹ́sì àti Chinese Mandarin

English: Peak Attendance: 28,000
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá: 28,000

English: Total Number Baptized: 181
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Ṣèrìbọmi: 181

English: Number of International Delegates: 5,000
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá Láti Ilẹ̀ Òkèèrè: 5,000

English: Invited Branches: Australasia, Brazil, Britain, Canada, Colombia, Dominican Republic, Fiji, Ghana, Greece, Hong Kong, Israel, Japan, the Netherlands, Scandinavia, South Africa, Spain, Taiwan, Trinidad and Tobago, Ukraine
Yoruba: Àwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì Tá A Pè: Australasia, Brazil, Britain, Kánádà, Kòlóńbíà, Dominican Republic, Fíjì, Gánà, Gírí ìsì, Hong Kong, Israel, Japan, Netherlands, Scandinavia, South Africa, Sípéènì, Taiwan, Trinidad and Tobago, Ukraine

English: Local Experience: Francis X. Suarez, mayor of the city of Miami, visited the convention site on Sunday and commented: “I love the fact that the message is ‘Love Never Fails’! It’s a very positive message.”
Yoruba: Ìrírí: Alákòóso ìlú Miami tórúkọ rẹ̀ ń jẹ́ Francis X. Suarez wá sí àpéjọ náà lọ́jọ́ Sunday, ó sì sọ pé: “Inú mi dùn pé ‘Ìfẹ́ Kì Í Yẹ̀ Láé’! ni àkòrí àpéjọ tẹ́ ẹ ṣe yìí. Àkòrí yẹn tuni lára gan-an.”

English: He added: “I think [the convention] is nothing but good for any major city in the United States or around the world.”
Yoruba: Ó wá fi kún un pé: “Ó máa dáa tẹ́ ẹ bá lè ṣe irú àpéjọ yìí láwọn ìlú tó wà ní Amẹ́ríkà àti láwọn ibòmíì kárí ayé.”"

English: Firefighters continue to battle six wildfires in Southern California, which have already burned over 250,000 acres in the counties of Los Angeles, Riverside, San Diego, Santa Barbara, and Ventura.
Yoruba: Àwọn panápaná ṣì ń bá iná runlérùnnà jà ní Southern California, iná yìí ti jó ibi tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì àti ààbọ̀ [250,000] éékà ní àwọn àgbègbè mẹ́fà bíi Los Angeles, Riverside, San Diego, Santa Barbara, àti Ventura.

English: Initial reports indicate that 484 publishers have evacuated their homes and most are being cared for by local brothers or family members living in safer areas.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn tá a kọ́kọ́ gbọ́ jẹ́ ká mọ̀ pé àwọn akéde ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin, àti àádọ́rin lé mẹ́rin [484] ti sá kúrò nílé, wọ́n sì lọ ń gbé pẹ̀lú àwọn arákùnrin míì tàbí pẹ̀lú àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí wọn tó ń gbé ní apá ibi tí àlááfíà wà.

English: Additionally, six homes of our brothers have been destroyed and three others have been damaged.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, mẹ́fà nínú ilé àwọn arákùnrin wa ló jóná, ilé mẹ́ta míì sì bàjẹ́.

English: Local elders and circuit overseers are providing spiritual support and practical assistance to our brothers and sisters who have been affected.
Yoruba: Àwọn alàgbà àti àwọn alábòójútó àyíká ń fi Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run pèsè ìtùnú fún àwọn ará wa ti àjálù náà bá, wọ́n sì tún ń bójú tó àìní wọn nípa tara

English: We continue to pray for our brothers and sisters and look forward to the day when the words of Proverbs 1:33 are fulfilled:
Yoruba: Gbogbo ìgbà là ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa, a sì tún fojú sọ́nà fún ìgbà tí ọ̀rọ̀ tó wà nínú Òwe 1:33 máa ní ìmúṣẹ:

English: “But the one listening to me will dwell in security and be undisturbed by the dread of calamity.”
Yoruba: “Ní ti ẹni tí ń fetí sí mi, yóò máa gbé nínú ààbò, yóò sì wà láìní ìyọlẹ́nu lọ́wọ́ ìbẹ̀rùbojo ìyọnu àjálù.”

English: Media Contact: David A. Semonian, Office of Public Information, +1-845-524-3000
Yoruba: Agbẹnusọ fún Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà: David A. Semonian, Ọ́fíìsì Agbéròyìnjáde, +1-845-524-3000

English: The storm, which made landfall on September 5, 2017, is one of the strongest hurricanes ever measured in the Atlantic.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle kan tó mi ilẹ̀ tìtì wáyé ní September 5, 2017, ó sì wà lára àwọn ìjì líle tó lágbára jù lọ tó wáyé ní àgbègbè Òkun Àtìláńtíìkì.

English: It has already devastated many islands in the Caribbean.
Yoruba: Ó ti ba ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn erékùṣù tó wà ní agbègbè Caribbean jẹ́.

English: At this time, none of our brothers and sisters have been reported injured or killed in the storm.
Yoruba: Títí di báyìí, a kò tíì gbọ́ pé ẹnì kankan nínú àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa ṣèṣe tàbí pé wọ́n kú nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ́ yìí.

English: One Kingdom Hall in La Désirade, Guadeloupe; one Kingdom Hall in St. Barts; and an Assembly Hall in St. Martin sustained damage.
Yoruba: Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan tó wà ní La Désirade, Guadeloupe; Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan ní St. Barts àti Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ kan ní St. Martin la gbọ́ pé ìjì líle náà bà jẹ́.

English: The island of Barbuda was especially hard hit by the storm, with an estimated 50 percent of the island’s residents left homeless.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle náà ṣọṣẹ́ lọ́nà tó le gan-an ní erékùṣù Barbuda, bí ìdajì àwọn tó ní ilé ní erékùṣù náà ni kò nílé lórí mọ́.

English: The entire population of the island, which includes 11 of our brothers, has been ordered by the government to evacuate to Antigua in anticipation that another hurricane, José, will hit the Caribbean over the weekend.
Yoruba: Gbogbo àwọn tó ń gbé níbẹ̀, tó fi mọ́ àwọn arákùnrin wa mọ́kànlá [11] ni ìjọba ti sọ fún pé kí wọ́n tètè kúrò ní àgbègbè yẹn, kí wọ́n máa lọ sí Antigua torí wọ́n fura pé ìjì líle míì tí wọ́n pè ní José tún máa jà ní agbègbè Caribbean yẹn ní òpin ọ̀sẹ̀.

English: The brothers have put in place several initiatives to care for ongoing relief efforts as Hurricane Irma continues tracking north through the Bahamas, Cuba, and the southeastern United States.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ nǹkan ní àwọn arákùnrin tó wà lágbègbè yẹn ti ṣe kí wọ́n lè fi àwọn nǹkan kòṣeémánìí ránṣẹ́ sí àwọn ará bí ìjì líle tí wọ́n pè ní Irma ṣe ń jà lọ sí apá gúùsù Bahamas, Cuba àti gúúsù ìlà oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà.

English: This includes identifying housing in advance for brothers and sisters that may be displaced.
Yoruba: Ara ohun tí wọ́n ṣe ni pé wọ́n ti ń ṣètò ilé sílẹ̀ fún àwọn ará tó ṣeé ṣe kí ìjì náà ba ilé wọn jẹ́.

English: Media Contact: David A. Semonian, Office of Public Information, +1-845-524-3000
Yoruba: Agbẹnusọ fún àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà: David A. Semonian, Ọ́fíìsì Agbéròyìnjáde, +1-845-524-3000

English: Information is becoming available regarding the status of our brothers and sisters in the Caribbean and southeastern United States in the wake of Hurricane Irma.
Yoruba: A gbọ́ròyìn nípa bí nǹkan ṣe ń lọ sí fún àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó wà ní àgbègbè Caribbean àti gúúsù ìlà oòrùn Amẹ́ríkà lẹ́yìn tí ìjì líle Hurricane Irma ṣoṣẹ́.

English: Sadly, an elderly brother in Florida and one of our sisters in Georgia died while evacuating.
Yoruba: Ó dùn wá gan-an pé arákùnrin àgbàlagbà kan nílùú Florida àti arábìnrin kan ní Georgia kú sínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.

English: Additionally, two of our brothers were injured in Tortola, which is the largest of the British Virgin Islands.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, àwọn arákùnrin méjì fara pa ní ìlú Tortola.

English: Throughout the Caribbean, over 40 homes have sustained major damage and at least 40 of our brothers have been displaced.
Yoruba: Ilé àwọn ará wa tó bà jẹ́ ní gbogbo àgbègbè Caribbean lé ní ogójì [40], ó kéré tán àwọn arákùnrin wa tí iye wọn jẹ́ ogójì [40] ló ti sá kúrò nílé wọn.

English: Assessments are ongoing as the brothers gain access to affected regions.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará wa ṣì ń bá iṣẹ́ nìṣó láti mọ bí nǹkan ṣe ń lọ sí láwọn àgbègbè míì tí ìjì yẹn ti ṣọṣẹ́.

English: We sympathize with those who have lost loved ones and the many who are impacted by the storm.
Yoruba: A kẹ́dùn gan-an pẹ̀lú àwọn tí èèyàn wọn kú sínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà, tó fi mọ́ ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn míì tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà ṣàkóbá fún láwọn ọ̀nà míì.

English: We continue to rely on the comfort Jehovah provides through the congregation.
Yoruba: A nígbàgbọ́ pé Jèhófà á máa tù wá nínú nìṣó nípasẹ̀ ìjọ rẹ̀.

English: Media Contact: David A. Semonian, Office of Public Information, +1-845-524-3000
Yoruba: Agbẹnusọ fún Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà: David A. Semonian, Ọ́fíìsì Agbéròyìnjáde, +1-845-524-300

English: A massive wildfire continues to burn near Redding, California, since igniting on July 23, 2018.
Yoruba: Iná ńlá kan tó sọ ní July 23, 2018 ṣì ń jó nítòsí agbègbè Redding, ní ìpínlẹ̀ California títí di báyìí.

English: The fire, named after the location where it ignited, has killed eight people, consumed more than 110,000 acres, and destroyed over 1,300 buildings.
Yoruba: Orúkọ ibi tí iná yìí ti sọ ni wọ́n fi pe iná náà, ó ti pa èèyàn mẹ́jọ, ó sì lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún ó lé mẹ́wàá (110,000) éékà ilẹ̀ tó ti jó, kódà àwọn ilé tó bà jẹ́ lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta (1,300).

English: No major injuries have been reported among the publishers living in the affected areas, although one of our brothers suffered burns that were not life-threatening while operating a bulldozer to assist firefighters to contain the blaze.
Yoruba: Kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn akéde tó ń gbé láwọn ibi tí iná ti ṣọṣẹ́ yìí tó fara pa kọjá bó ṣe yẹ, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé iná náà jó arákùnrin wa kan lára níbi tó ti ń fi ọkọ̀ katapílà lànà fáwọn panápaná kí wọ́n lè ríbi kápá iná náà.

English: Additionally, a total of 454 brothers and sisters have been displaced and are temporarily staying in the homes of their relatives or other publishers.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin àti àádọ́ta ó lé mẹ́rin (454) akéde wa lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin ni wọ́n kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé, tí wọ́n sì lọ sọ́dọ̀ àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí wọn tàbí sọ́dọ̀ àwọn ará fúngbà díẹ̀.

English: The homes of 12 Witness families have been destroyed.
Yoruba: Iná náà ba ilé ìdílé méjìlá jẹ́ lára àwọn ará wa.

English: All publishers have been accounted for and the circuit overseers, together with local elders, are cooperating to provide the necessary spiritual and material assistance to our brothers during this distressful time.
Yoruba: Gbogbo àwọn akéde la ti gbúròó wọn, àwọn alábòójútó àyíká pẹ̀lú àwọn alàgbà ìjọ sì ń ṣètò bí wọ́n ṣe máa pèsè ohun táwọn ará nílò nípa tara àti nípa tẹ̀mí lásìkò wàhálà yìí.​

English: The United States Branch Committee has provided the following information regarding our brothers affected by the numerous wildfires reported in Northern California, as well as the fast-moving brush fire that has scorched Southern California.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ti fún wa láwọn ìsọfúnni yìí nípa àwọn arákùnrin wa tí ìjàǹbá iná ṣẹlẹ̀ sí ní Northern California àti iná igbó tó ń yára ṣọṣẹ́ gan-an ní Southern California.

English: Northern California: The United States branch office has contacted the circuit overseers in and around the counties of Mendocino, Napa, and Sonoma, and they report that all of our brothers are safe, although one publisher has been injured.
Yoruba: Northern California: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ti kàn sí àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà lágbègbè Mendocino, Napa àti Sonoma, wọ́n sì sọ fún wa pé gbogbo àwọn ará wa ti kúrò níbi tó léwu, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé akéde kan fara pa.

English: Some 700 of our brothers have had to evacuate, while some 2,000 more are ready to leave should the need arise.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará tó tó ọgọ́rùn-ún méje (700) ti fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀, àwọn ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì (2,000) sì ti múra tán láti lọ tó bá ṣẹlẹ̀ pé ipò nǹkan burú sí i.

English: All of our displaced brothers have been accommodated by fellow Witnesses in safer locations.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará tó wà níbi tí kò séwu ti gba àwọn tó sá kúrò níbi tí ewu wà sílé wọn.

English: Thus far, we have confirmed that one Kingdom Hall and three homes of our brothers have been destroyed.
Yoruba: A gbọ́ pé Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan àti ilé àwọn ará mẹ́ta ló bà jẹ́ pátápátá.

English: Additionally, 22 homes have sustained major damage and 32 have sustained minor damage.
Yoruba: Láfikún sí i, ilé méjìlélógún (22) ló bà jẹ́ gan-an, ilé méjìlélọ́gbọ̀n (32) sì bà jẹ́ díẹ̀.

English: The circuit overseers are taking the lead to provide much-needed encouragement and support.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká ń mú ipò iwájú láti fún àwọn ará ní ìṣírí àti ìtìlẹ́yìn tí wọ́n nílò.

English: Southern California: In the Anaheim area, a total of 25 Witness families have been evacuated, with no injuries to our brothers.
Yoruba: Southern California: Lágbègbè Anaheim, ìdílé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n (25) ni wọ́n ti sá kúrò nílé wọn, àmọ́ kò sẹ́nì kankan tó fara pa.

English: All those evacuated have been accommodated in the homes of fellow Witnesses.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará tó wà níbí tí kò léwu ti gba gbogbo àwọn ará yìí sílé wọn.

English: There have been no reports of damage to any of our brothers’ homes or Kingdom Halls.
Yoruba: Kò sí ilé àwọn ará tàbí Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kankan tó bà jẹ́.

English: We are confident that Jehovah will prove to be a “secure refuge” for all those affected during this time of distress.
Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà máa jẹ́ “ibi gíga ààbò” fún gbogbo àwọn tọ́rọ̀ kàn lásìkò wàhálà yìí.

English: On June 24, 2019, high winds and heavy rain pounded south Texas.
Yoruba: Ní June 24, 2019, ìjì líle àti òjò àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá ṣọṣẹ́ gan-an ní gúúsù Texas.

English: News reports indicate that hundreds of homes were flooded and more than 100 people were evacuated.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn fi hàn pé ọgọ́rọ̀ọ̀rún ilé ni ọ̀gbàrá òjò náà bà jẹ́, ó sì ju ọgọ́rùn-ún èèyàn tí wọ́n kó kúrò lágbègbè náà.

English: Although no publishers were injured in the storm, 47 were displaced.
Yoruba: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kò sí akéde kankan tó fara pa nibi ìjì náà, àmọ́ àkéde mẹ́tàdínláàádọ́ta (47) ni ò nílé mọ́ rárá.

English: Additionally, the storm damaged 65 homes of our brothers and sisters, as well as one apartment attached to a Kingdom Hall.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ìjì náà ba ilé àwọn ará márùndínláàádọ́rin (65) jẹ́, ó sì tún bá ilé kan tá a kọ́ mọ́ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan jẹ́.

English: Circuit overseers and local elders are shepherding those affected by the storm.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àtàwọn alàgbà ń ṣèbẹ̀wò sọ́dọ̀ àwọn ará tí àjálù náà bá.

English: Also, a Disaster Relief Committee is coordinating the arrangements for housing and the distribution of food, water, and clothing.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù ti ń ṣètò ilé, oúnjẹ, omi àti aṣọ fáwọn ará.

English: Efforts are already underway to clean and stabilize the damaged homes as well as the Kingdom Hall apartment.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, iṣẹ́ ń lọ lórí àtúnṣe àwọn ilé àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tó bà jẹ́.

English: We will continue to support our brothers and sisters in south Texas, as they trust in Jehovah and cope with the aftermath of this severe weather.
Yoruba: A ò ní fi àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa ní gúúsù Texas sílẹ̀, inú wa dùn pé Jèhófà ni wọ́n gbára lé, ó sì dájú pé á ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́ láti fara da àjálù yìí.​

English: Two detention centers in Palm Beach County, Florida, broadcast the prerecorded Memorial talk for more than 1,100 inmates on the evening of April 7, even though none of Jehovah’s Witnesses could be present to conduct the observance.
Yoruba: Ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n méjì tó wà ní Palm Beach County, ní Florida ṣe àtagbà àsọyé Ìrántí Ikú Kristi àwọn tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún (1,100) èèyàn tó wà nínú ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n nírọ̀lẹ́ April 7, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kò sí Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kankan tó lè lọ síbẹ̀ láti darí ìtòlẹ́sẹẹsẹ náà.

English: One of the 12 brothers who participates in a weekly volunteer ministry at the prisons said: “We were so surprised by how everything fell into place.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn méjìlá (12) tó máa ń lọ wàásù lọ́gbà ẹ̀wọ̀n lọ́sọ̀ọ̀sẹ̀ sọ pé: “Ó yà wá lẹ́nu gan-an pé gbogbo ètò náà lọ dáadáa bó ṣe yẹ.

English: It was clear that Jehovah wanted these men to hear the Memorial talk.” The brothers had been seeking permission from the prison chaplain to hold the Memorial observance at the two detention centers.
Yoruba: Kò sí àní-àní pé Jèhófà fẹ́ káwọn tó wà lẹ́wọ̀n yìí gbọ́ àsọyé Ìrántí Ikú Kristi.” Àwọn ará ti gbàṣẹ lọ́dọ̀ alábòójútó ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n tó wà níbẹ̀ láti sọ àsọyé Ìrántí Ikú Kristi láwọn ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n méjì yìí.

English: After restrictions related to the COVID-19 outbreak were imposed, those plans were shelved.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ kò ṣeé ṣe mọ́ torí òfin tí Ìjọba ṣe nípa àrùn COVID-19 tó ń jà.

English: Before the brothers could provide an alternate plan, the chaplain surprised them by asking for a prerecorded version of the Memorial discourse.
Yoruba: Ṣùgbọ́n káwọn ará tó rí ojútùú sí ọ̀rọ̀ náà, alábòójútó ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n náà bi wọ́n pé ṣé wọ́n lè fún òun ní àsọyé Ìrántí Ikú Kristi tí wọ́n ti gbohùn ẹ̀ sílẹ̀.

English: He was already arranging to broadcast the talk in both facilities.
Yoruba: Ó ti ṣètò bí wọ́n ṣe máa ta àtagbà àsọyé náà ní ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n méjèèjì.

English: In addition to the video, the brothers planned to send the chaplain Memorial invitations to distribute or post.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ sí fídíò yẹn, àwọn arákùnrin yẹn ti ń ṣètò bí wọ́n ṣe máa fi ìkésíni Ìrántí Ikú Kristi ránṣẹ́ sí alábòójútó ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n náà kó lè fún àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n tàbí kó lẹ̀ ẹ́ sójú pátákó fún wọn.

English: Again to their surprise, the chaplain had already posted notices around the buildings advertising the Memorial talk.
Yoruba: Àmọ́, ó tún yà wọ́n lẹ́nu lẹ́ẹ̀kan sí i pé alábòójútó ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n náà ti lẹ ìsọfúnni nípa Ìrántí Ikú Kristi káàkiri àwọn ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n náà.

English: On the evening of the Memorial, every inmate had access to the broadcast of the Scriptural talk.
Yoruba: Nígbà tó máa fi di ìrọ̀lẹ́ ọjọ́ Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, gbogbo àwọn tó wà nínú ẹ̀wọ̀n ló ti láǹfààní láti wo àsọyé yẹn.

English: After the Memorial, the chaplain contacted the brothers to request more Bibles for the inmates.
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, alábòójútó ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n yẹn sọ fún àwọn ará pé kí wọ́n fún òun ní Bíbélì tó pọ̀ sí i kóun lè fún àwọn tó wà nínú ẹ̀wọ̀n.

English: All of the Bibles left at the detention centers had been distributed.
Yoruba: Gbogbo Bíbélì tí wọ́n kó sí ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n ni wọ́n ti gbà tán.

English: However, the requests for Bibles exceeded the supply.
Yoruba: Kódà, Bíbélì náà ò kárí àwọn tó ń béèrè fún un.

English: We rejoice that not even prison bars can prevent God’s Word from reaching people.
Yoruba: Inú wa dùn pé kò sóhun tó lè ní káwọn èèyàn má gbọ́rọ̀ Ọlọ́run, kódà ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n gan-an ò dí i lọ́wọ́.​

English: NEW YORK—Residents in Texas, U.S.A., continue to recover from the aftermath of Hurricane Harvey, which made landfall near Corpus Christi on August 25, 2017.
Yoruba: NEW YORK​—Lẹ́yìn tí ìjì líle tí wọ́n ń pè ní Hurricane Harvey jà, tó sì sọlẹ̀ ní tòsí àgbègbè Corpus Christi ní August 25, 2017, ràbọ̀ràbọ̀ ẹ̀ ti ń tán lára àwọn tó ń gbé nílùú Texas lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà.

English: Two Disaster Relief Committees are spearheading the relief efforts to assist the thousands of brothers and sisters who were affected.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ méjì tó ń ṣètò ìrànwọ́ nígbà àjálù ló ń darí bí ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin tí àjálù ṣẹlẹ̀ sí ṣe máa rí ìrànwọ́ gbà.

English: A brother searches for Jehovah’s Witnesses at a relief center in Houston, Texas.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin kan ń wá àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà níbì kan tí wọ́n ti ń ṣètò ìrànwọ́ ní Houston, nílùú Texas.

English: More than 7,000 volunteered to assist with the initial cleanup efforts, which encompassed 2,300 homes of publishers.
Yoruba: Ó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún méje [7,000] èèyàn tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti ṣèrànwọ́ nígbà tí wọ́n kọ́kọ́ bẹ̀rẹ̀ àtúnṣe gbàrà tí ìjì náà jà tán. Ara ibi tí wọ́n tún ṣe ni ilé àwọn akéde tó jẹ́ ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì àti ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta [2,300].

English: Approximately 1,000 volunteers are assisting with the more extensive relief construction work each week.
Yoruba: Lọ́sọ̀ọ̀sẹ̀, àwọn tó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ẹgbẹ̀rún kan [1,000] ló ń yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti ṣèrànwọ́ lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ tó ṣì ń lọ lọ́wọ́, ìyẹn kíkọ́ àwọn ilé tí ìjì náà bà jẹ́.

English: So far, they have completed repairs on 48 Kingdom Halls, and over 545 homes are scheduled to be repaired in the coming months.
Yoruba: Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba méjìdínláàádọ́ta [48] ni wọ́n ti tún ṣe tán báyìí, àwọn ilé tí wọ́n sì ṣètò pé wọ́n máa tún ṣe láàárín oṣù díẹ̀ sí i lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún àti márùndínláàádọ́ta [545].

English: It is estimated that the relief work will cost $8.5 million in this area alone and will be completed by June 30, 2018.
Yoruba: A retí pé a máa ná tó mílíọ̀nù mẹ́jọ ààbọ̀ owó dọ́là sórí iṣẹ́ tá a máa ṣe ní àdúgbò yìí nìkan, iṣẹ́ náà á sì parí títí June 30, 2018.

English: Since the end of August 2017, a total of 22 branch representatives, including 7 Branch Committee members, have visited the disaster areas to provide spiritual encouragement to the affected publishers.
Yoruba: Láti ìparí oṣù August 2017, àwọn aṣojú ẹ̀ka méjìlélógún [22], tó fi mọ́ àwọn méje tó wà lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka, ló ti ṣèbẹ̀wò sí àwọn ibi tí àjálù náà ti ṣẹlẹ̀ kí wọ́n lè fi ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run gbé àwọn akéde tí àjálù ṣẹlẹ̀ sí ró.

English: We pray that all those involved in the relief efforts will have their ‘hands strengthened’ for the work.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí gbogbo àwọn tó ń lọ́wọ́ sí ètò ìrànwọ́ yìí rí okun gbà kí wọ́n lè ṣiṣẹ́ náà yọrí.​

English: Relief workers in Aransas Pass, Texas.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó ń ṣètò ìrànwọ́ ní Aransas Pass, nílùú Texas.

English: After battering the islands of the Bahamas as a Category 5 storm, Hurricane Dorian hit the east coast of the United States.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle tó ń jẹ́ Dorian yìí kọ́kọ́ jà ní àwọn erékùṣù tó wà ní Bahamas, ó sì ba nǹkan jẹ́ níbẹ̀ gan-an. Ẹ̀yìn ìyẹn ló wá rọ́ lọ sí àwọn etíkun tó wà ní ìlà oòrùn Amẹ́ríkà.

English: It passed over Cape Hatteras, North Carolina, on Friday morning, September 6, 2019, as a Category 1 storm, leaving surging floodwaters that impacted homes and businesses.
Yoruba: Ní àárọ̀ Friday, September 6, 2019, ó kọjá ní ìlú Cape Hatteras ní North Carolina, ó sì fa àkúnya omi tó ń ru gùdù, èyí tó ya wọ ilé àti àwọn ilé ìtajà káàkiri.

English: On September 7, 2019, the storm caused hurricane-force winds in Nova Scotia, Canada.
Yoruba: Ní September 7, 2019, ìjì náà fa ẹ̀fúùfù líle gan an nílùú Nova Scotia, ní orílẹ̀ èdè Kánádà.

English: Publishers from Nassau gather at the airport to welcome their fellow brothers and sisters who were evacuated from Great Abaco Island The United States branch reports that of the 1,742 publishers in the Bahamas only one sister experienced a minor injury.
Yoruba: Àwọn akéde láti Nassau wá kí àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wọn tí wọ́n kó kúrò ní erékùṣù Great Abaco káàbọ̀ ní pápákọ̀ òfuurufú Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà ròyìn pé lára àwọn akéde tó tó ẹgbẹ̀rún kan, ọgọ́rùn-ún méje àti méjìlélógójì (1,742) tó wà ní Bahamas, arábìnrin kan ṣoṣo ló kàn fara pa díẹ̀.

English: As of this report, a total of 48 homes of Witnesses sustained damage and 8 homes were destroyed.
Yoruba: Ní àsìkò tá a ń kọ ìròyìn yìí, ilé méjìdínláàádọ́ta (48) tó jẹ́ ti àwọn ará wa ni ìjì náà bà jẹ́ nígbà tí ilé mẹ́jọ bàjẹ́ kọjá àtúnṣe.

English: Many of the publishers living on Great Abaco Island were evacuated to Nassau, the capital of the Bahamas.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ lára àwọn akéde tó ń gbé ní erékùṣù Great Abaco ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ṣètò pé kí wọ́n kó lọ sí ìlú Nassau, tó jẹ́ olú ìlú Bahamas.

English: They were warmly welcomed by local brothers and sisters at the airport.
Yoruba: Àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tó sì wà níbẹ̀ kí wọn káàbọ̀ tayọ̀tayọ̀ ní pápá ọkọ̀ òfuurufú.

English: Our brothers and sisters collect and package relief supplies at the West Palm Beach Christian Convention Center The Disaster Relief Committee and the local circuit overseer are organizing relief aid and shepherding the publishers affected.
Yoruba: Àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin ń ṣètò àwọn nǹkan ìrànwọ́ ní gbọ̀ngàn àpéjọ tó ń jẹ́ West Palm Beach Christian Convention Center Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù àti alábòójútó àyíká tó wà ní agbègbè náà ń ṣètò ìtọ́jú pàjáwìrì, wọ́n sì tún ń ṣètò ìbẹ̀wò olùṣọ́ àgùntàn fún àwọn akéde tí àjálù dé bá.

English: Brothers from the United States branch office have also traveled to the area to assist in the relief efforts and provide spiritual encouragement to the congregations.
Yoruba: Àwọn arákùnrin láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà náà rìnrìn àjò lọ sí agbègbè náà kí wọ́n lè pèsè àwọn ohun tí àwọn ará yìí nílò kí wọ́n sì fi Bíbélì tù wọ́n nínú.

English: Relief supplies shipped from the West Palm Beach Christian Convention Center arrive in Freeport, Bahamas.
Yoruba: Àwọn nǹkan ìrànwọ́ tí wọ́n fi ọkọ̀ òkun kó láti gbọ̀ngàn àpéjọ West Palm Beach Christian Convention Center dé sí Freeport ní Bahamas.

English: Local brothers load the boxes onto a truck for distribution In the United States, the storm primarily affected North and South Carolina.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará tó wà níbẹ̀ ń kó àwọn páálí ẹrù náà sínú ọkọ̀ tó máa pín in kiri Ní orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà, apá Àríwá àti Gúúsù Carolina ni ìjì náà ti ṣọṣẹ́ jùlọ.

English: No brothers or sisters were injured in the disaster, but 737 of our brothers have been displaced, most of whom were temporarily evacuated until they are able to return to their homes.
Yoruba: Ko sí arákùnrin tàbí arábìnrin kankan tó fara pa nínú àjálù náà, àmọ́ àwọn ará tó tó ọgọ́rùn-ún méje àti mẹ́tàdínlógójì (737) ló ni láti sa fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀.

English: Also, 50 homes and 12 Kingdom Halls sustained damage.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ lára wọn ní ìgbìmọ̀ náà ṣètò pé kí wọ́n kó kúrò fúngbà díẹ̀ títí dìgbà tí wọ́n a fì lè pa dà sílé.

English: No injuries were reported among our brothers in Canada.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, àádọ́ta (50) ilé àti gbọ̀ngàn ìjọba méjìlá (12) ló bà jẹ́.

English: The storm caused minor property damage to some of our brothers’ homes as well as power outages.
Yoruba: A ò gbọ́ ìròyìn pé ẹnikẹ́ni lára àwọn ará wà ní Kánádà fara pa. Ìjì náà ba àwọn nǹkan díẹ̀ jẹ́ lára ilé àwọn arákùnrin wa kan, bẹ́ẹ̀ ló sì ba iná mànàmáná wọn jẹ́.

English: The brothers and sisters in the local congregations were able to assist those affected.
Yoruba: Àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tó wà nínú ìjọ ládùúgbò yẹn ṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún àwọn ará tí àjálù náà dé bá.

English: We are grateful that Jehovah is hearing the “pleas for help” of our brothers who are trusting in him during these difficult times.
Yoruba: A mà dúpẹ́ o, pé Jèhófà ń gbọ́ “ẹ̀bẹ̀ [àwọn ará wa] fún ìrànlọ́wọ́,” bí wọ́n ṣe ń gbọ́kàn lé e ní àkókò tí nǹkan lè koko yìí.​

English: The wildfires in California have been largely contained, and the United States Branch Committee has provided the following updated information regarding our brothers in the region.
Yoruba: Wọ́n ti ń kápá iná runlérùnnà tó ń jó lọ́nà tó kàmàmà ní California.

English: No deaths have been reported, but eight of our brothers were injured and more than 1,400 were displaced.
Yoruba: Nínú ìsọfúnni díẹ̀ tá a rí gbà látọ̀dọ̀ Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka ti Orílẹ̀-Èdè Amẹ́ríkà nípa àwọn arákùnrin wa tó wà lágbègbè yẹn, kò sí arákùnrin wa tàbí arábìnrin wa kankan tó kú, àmọ́ àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́jọ ṣèṣe, àwọn ẹgbẹ̀rún kan àti ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin [1,400] ló sì ti sá kúrò nílé.

English: Additionally, a total of 29 of our brothers’ homes were completely destroyed.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ilé àwọn arákùnrin wa mọ́kàndínlọ́gbọ̀n [29] ló ti bàjẹ́ pátápátá.

English: All the displaced brothers were cared for by other Witnesses in neighboring congregations and circuits, and the majority have already returned to their homes.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó sá kúrò nílé torí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú yìí ń rí ìtọ́jú gbà látọ̀dọ̀ àwọn ará tó wà ní ìjọ àti àyíká míì tó wà nítòsí wọn, púpọ̀ nínú àwọn arákùnrin wa ló sì ti pa dà sílé wọn.

English: While the fires were still raging, representatives from the branch office visited the circuit overseers, the Disaster Relief Committee, and local relief volunteers.
Yoruba: Lásìkò tí iná yẹn ṣì ń ṣọṣẹ́, àwọn aṣojú láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì lọ́ ṣèbẹ̀wò sáwọn Alábòójútó àyíká, Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù àtàwọn tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti ṣèrànwọ́ fáwọn tí àjálù dé bá.

English: Encouraging visits were held with the families who lost their homes.
Yoruba: Wọ́n tún ṣèbẹ̀wò sọ́dọ̀ àwọn tó pàdánù ilé wọn sínú ìjàǹbá yẹn.

English: Additionally, special meetings with the two primary circuits impacted by the fires were arranged to provide scriptural comfort and support to the large number of evacuees.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, wọ́n tún ṣe ìpàdé àkànṣe kan pẹ̀lú àwọn àyíká méjì tí àjálù yẹn dé bá gan-an kí wọ́n lè fi Bíbélì tù wọ́n nínú, kí wọn sì ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́.

English: We are confident that Jehovah will continue to comfort and support our brothers as they face this distressing situation.
Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà á máa báa lọ láti pèsè ìtùnú fáwọn arákùnrin wa tó wà nínú ìṣòro yìí.

English: Torrential rain and melted snow triggered flooding in Nebraska and Iowa during mid-March 2019.
Yoruba: Òjò àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá àti yìnyín tó yọ́ fa omíyalé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Nebraska àti Iowa lóṣù March 2019.

English: As rivers in the area rose to historic levels, water breached dams and levees, damaging hundreds of homes and killing at least four people.
Yoruba: Omíyalé náà mú kí àwọn odò tó wà lágbègbè náà kún kọjá ààlà, àwọn ibi tó ń gba omi dúró ya lulẹ̀, ó ba ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ilé jẹ́, ó sì pa ó kéré tán èèyàn mẹ́rin.

English: The United States branch reports that none of the 5,123 publishers in the area died or suffered injuries.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà sọ pé kò sí ìkankan lára ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún àti mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́fà (5,123) akéde tó wà níbẹ̀ tó kú tàbí tó fara pa.

English: However, 84 publishers were displaced.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ akéde mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́rin (84) ní láti kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé.

English: Additionally, 8 of the brothers’ homes sustained major damage and 34 sustained minor damage.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ilé mẹ́jọ àwọn ará wa bà jẹ́ gan-an, ilé mẹ́rìnlélọ́gbọ̀n (34) míì sì bà jẹ́ díẹ̀.

English: Volunteers in nearby congregations have begun the cleanup efforts with the support of Local Design/Construction personnel.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará ìjọ lágbègbè náà ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti palẹ̀ ìdọ̀tí mọ́, wọ́n sì ń ṣiṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn ará tó wà ní Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ.

English: The circuit overseers in the impacted areas are coordinating shepherding for those affected.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà lágbègbè tí àjálù náà ti ṣẹlẹ̀ ń fáwọn ará tọ́rọ̀ kàn níṣìírí.

English: We pray that our brothers will continue to be comforted by the practical and spiritual support they are receiving during this trial.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí ìrànlọ́wọ́ táwọn ará wa rí gbà nípa tara àti nípa tẹ̀mí tù wọ́n nínú lásìkò ìṣòro yìí.

English: On January 9, a powerful storm resulting in widespread mudslides wreaked havoc on residents in the southern part of California, United States.
Yoruba: Ní January 9 lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, ìjì líle kan jà ní gúúsù ìpínlẹ̀ California. Ìjì yẹn ló fa ọ̀gbàrá púpọ̀ gan-an tó sì han àwọn ará ìlú léèmọ̀.

English: News reports indicate that at least 21 people were killed and hundreds of homes were damaged or destroyed.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn jẹ́ ká mọ̀ pé àwọn mọ́kànlélógún [21] ló pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn sínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú yẹn, ọ̀pọ̀ ilé ló wó, àwọn míì sì bàjẹ́.

English: No publishers were among those killed by the disaster.
Yoruba: Kò sí ọ̀kankan nínú àwọn ará wa tó kú sínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.

English: In Burbank, the home and property of one publisher was damaged, and an additional eight families were evacuated in Ventura.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ ní ìlú Burbank, ìjì yẹn ba ilé àtàwọn nǹkan ìní akéde kan jẹ́. Bákan náà, ní ìlú Ventura ìdílé mẹ́jọ ló ti sá kúrò nílé.

English: No Kingdom Halls were damaged by the mudslides.
Yoruba: Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kankan kò bàjẹ́.

English: The circuit overseers and the Disaster Relief Committee, along with Local Design/Construction representatives, continue to support publishers who have been affected by the mudslides and the recent wildfires.
Yoruba: Àwọn Alábòójútó àyíká pẹ̀lú Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù àti àwọn aṣojú láti Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ jọ ń ṣiṣẹ́ pọ̀ láti ṣèrànwọ́ fáwọn tí àjálù dé bá.

English: During this time, we continue to keep our brothers in our prayers, confident that Jehovah will keep them strong.
Yoruba: Ní irú àsìkò tí nǹkan nira yìí, àá máa báa lọ láti rántí àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa nínú àwọn àdúrà wa, ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà máa fún wọn lókun tí wọ́n nílò.​

English: Joseph F. Rutherford, then serving as president of the Watch Tower Society, was present when construction began on the Kingdom Hall located at 1228 Pensacola Street, Honolulu, Hawaii.
Yoruba: Ọdún 1935 ni ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ amọ́kànyọ̀ yìí kọ́kọ́ wáyé.

English: The year was 1935.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Joseph F. Rutherford, tó jẹ́ ààrẹ Watch Tower Society nígbà yẹn wà níbẹ̀ nígbà tí wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í kọ́ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tó wà ní ojúlé 1228 ní Pensacola Street, ìlú Honolulu, ìpínlẹ̀ Hawaii.

English: This little building would carry the distinction of being the first in the world to be named “Kingdom Hall.” It would also serve as an anchor for tremendous growth over the next eight decades.
Yoruba: Kò ní yà yín lẹ́nu pé ilé kékeré tí wọ́n kọ́ nígbà yẹn ni ilé ìjọsìn àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tá a kọ́kọ́ pè ní “Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba.” Àtìgbà yẹn làwa èèyàn Jèhófà ti ń pe àwọn ibi tá a máa ń kóra jọ sí láti jọ́sìn ní Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba, ìyẹn sì ti lé lọ́gọ́rin (80) ọdún báyìí.

English: Today, 85 years later, the Pensacola Street Kingdom Hall is used by four congregations that support meetings held in five languages, including Hawaii Pidgin.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, àwọn ìjọ mẹ́rin ló ń ṣèpàdé nínú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba yẹn, èdè márùn-ún ni wọ́n sì fi ń ṣèpàdé níbẹ̀, títí kan èdè Hawaii Pidgin.

English: * The Kingdom Hall shortly after it was built in 1935 Before the COVID-19 pandemic, our brothers invited the local community, government officials, and educators to an open house from February 11 to 15, 2020, after completely remodeling the historic building.
Yoruba: * Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tá a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ tún kọ́ ní 1228 Pensacola Street, Honolulu, Hawaii Ní February 11 sí 15, 2020, ìyẹn kí àrùn COVID-19 tó gbayé kan, lẹ́yìn tá a ti tún Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba àkọ́kọ́ yẹn kọ́, àwọn ará wa pe àwọn ará ìlú, àwọn aṣojú ìjọba àtàwọn olùkọ́ láti wá ṣèbẹ̀wò kí wọ́n sì rín yí ká ilé náà.

English: Visitors were escorted on a tour of the building, viewed historical displays, and listened to presentations by the brothers that highlighted the activities of Jehovah’s modern-day organization.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará wa mú àwọn àlejò náà rìn yí ká ilé náà, kí wọ́n lè rí onírúurú fọ́tò àtàwọn àkọ́sílẹ̀ ìtàn nípa ilé náà. Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, àwọn arákùnrin tún ṣàlàyé àwọn nǹkan táwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ń gbé ṣe lóde òní fún wọn.

English: The event culminated on February 16, with a dedication talk by Brother David H. Splane, a member of the Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: Nígbà tó di February 16, Arákùnrin David H. Splane tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà wá fọba lé e pẹ̀lú àsọyé ìyàsímímọ́.

English: One sister who helped with preparations for the program said: “Even though the community open house wasn’t about preaching, we feel that a great witness was given to many who may otherwise have never learned about Jehovah’s Witnesses.” The event helped our brothers and sisters gain a deeper sense of their rich spiritual heritage in the Hawaiian Islands and to personally see the fulfillment of the words, “In the islands of the sea they will glorify the name of Jehovah the God of Israel.
Yoruba: Arábìnrin kan tó wà lára àwọn tó ṣe àwọn ìmúrasílẹ̀ kan kí ètò náà lè kẹ́sẹ járí sọ pé: “Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kì í ṣe torí àtiwàásù fáwọn èèyàn náà la ṣe ní kí wọ́n wá ṣèbẹ̀wò, a gbà pé ẹ̀rí ńlá ni ìbẹ̀wò náà jẹ́ fún ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn tó ṣeé ṣe kí wọ́n má mọ̀ nípa àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.” Ètò tá a ṣe pé káwọn èèyàn rìn yí ká Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba yẹn mú káwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin túbọ̀ lóye ìtàn àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà láwọn erékùṣù Hawaii, ó sì mú kí wọ́n rí ìmúṣẹ Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run tó sọ pé: “Ní àwọn erékùṣù òkun, wọ́n máa yin orúkọ Jèhófà, Ọlọ́run Ísírẹ́lì lógo.

English: ^ par. 2 During the current COVID-19 pandemic, all congregation meetings in the United States are temporarily being held via videoconference rather than in Kingdom Halls.
Yoruba: ^ ìpínrọ̀ 2 Lásìkò tí àrùn COVID-19 gbòde, orí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára ni gbogbo ìjọ àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ti ń ṣèpàdé dípò kí wọ́n máa kóra jọ nínú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba.

English: In recent months, multiple wildfires have blazed across the state of California, charring some 362 square kilometers (140 sq mi) and leaving a massive burn scar on the landscape.
Yoruba: Ní oṣù díẹ̀ sẹ́yìn, àwọn iná kan jó ní ìpínlẹ̀ California, ó sì ba agbègbè tó tó ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta ó lé ọgọ́ta àti méjì kìlómítà jẹ́ níbùú àti lóòró (362 square kilometers).

English: The United States branch reports that more than 1,700 brothers and sisters had to evacuate due to the various fires.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà ròyìn pé àwọn ará tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún méje (1,700) ló ti sá kúrò nílé nítorí àwọn iná tó jó léraléra náà.

English: No injuries or fatalities have been reported.
Yoruba: A ò tíì gbọ́ pé ẹnikẹ́ni fara pa tàbí kú.

English: The Sandalwood Fire in Calimesa that started on October 10, 2019, destroyed the home of one of our brothers.
Yoruba: Ní October 10, 2019, iná tó jó àdúgbò Sandalwood tó wà ní Calimesa ba ilé ọ̀kan lára àwọn arákùnrin wa jẹ́.

English: Also, some homes have sustained minor smoke damage.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, èéfín ba àwọn ilé kan jẹ́ díẹ̀.

English: Almost all who evacuated have been able to return home.
Yoruba: Ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ jẹ́ gbogbo àwọn tó sá kúrò nílé ló ti pa dà sílé.

English: “We can’t overstate the importance of obeying direction in these cases,” stated one elder who lives in one of the affected areas.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn alàgbà tó ń gbé láwọn ibi tí iná náà ti jó sọ pé: “Ó ṣe pàtàkì gan-an pé ká máa tẹ̀ lé ìtọ́ni tí irú nǹkan báyìí bá ṣẹlẹ̀, kódà, ó yẹ ká tẹnu mọ́ ọn dáadáa.

English: “Our brothers quickly evacuated the danger zones, and this allowed firefighters to concentrate on fighting the blaze instead of searching for people.” Circuit overseers and local elders continue to coordinate relief supplies for evacuees.
Yoruba: Ẹsẹ̀kẹsẹ̀ làwọn ará wa ti kúrò láwọn ibi tí iná náà ti ń jó, ìyẹn sì jẹ́ kó rọrùn fáwọn panápaná láti gbájú mọ́ bí wọ́n ṣe máa pa iná náà dípò kí wọ́n máa wá àwọn èèyàn kiri.” Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àti àwọn alàgbà tó ń gbé lágbègbè náà ń ṣe gbogbo ohun tí wọ́n lè ṣe láti pèsè ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn tó sá kúrò nílé.

English: The loving concern and hospitality demonstrated by publishers in the surrounding areas have been outstanding.
Yoruba: Ìfẹ́ àti ẹ̀mí ọ̀làwọ́ tí àwọn akéde tó ń gbé lágbègbè yìí fi hàn bùáyà.

English: Regarding this outpouring of Christian love, one circuit overseer noted, “We had no problem finding housing for all those displaced.” We are grateful to Jehovah for those who “have become a source of great comfort” for our brothers and sisters affected by these wildfires.
Yoruba: Torí ìfẹ́ tó jinlẹ̀ táwọn ará fi hàn, alábòójútó àyíká kan sọ pé: “Kò ṣòro fún wa rárá láti rí ilé táwọn tó sá kúrò nílé máa gbé.” A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà torí àwọn tó “ti di orísun ìtùnú” fún àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tí iná yìí lé kúrò nílé.

English: On November 14, 2019, a student opened fire on fellow classmates at a high school in Santa Clarita, California.
Yoruba: Ní November 14, 2019, ọmọ ilé ìwé kan dàbọn bolẹ̀ láàárín àwọn ọmọ kíláàsì rẹ̀ ní ilé ẹ̀kọ́ girama tó wà nílùú Santa Clarita, ní California.

English: The gunman killed two students and wounded three, before shooting himself.
Yoruba: Ọmọ náà pa ọmọ ilé ìwé méjì, ó sì ṣe àwọn mẹ́ta léṣe, kó tó wá pa ara ẹ̀.

English: Sadly, Dominic Blackwell, the son of one of our sisters, was one of the students killed.
Yoruba: Ó bani nínú jẹ́ pé Dominic Blackwell, ọmọ arábìnrin wa kan wà lára àwọn ọmọ ilé ìwé tó yìnbọn pa.

English: He was 14 years old and regularly attended meetings with his mother, Sister Nancy Blackwell.
Yoruba: Ọmọ ọdún mẹ́rìnlá (14) ni, ó sì máa ń lọ sí ìpàdé déédéé pẹ̀lú ìyá rẹ̀ tó ń jẹ́ Nancy Blackwell.

English: Dominic is survived by his parents and three younger siblings.
Yoruba: Bàbá, ìyá àti àbúrò mẹ́ta ni Dominic fi sílẹ̀.

English: The elders are providing Scriptural comfort and support to the family and the local congregation.
Yoruba: Àwọn alàgbà ń pèsè ìtùnú látinú Ìwé Mímọ́ fún ìdílé yìí àtàwọn ará ìjọ wọn.

English: We are deeply saddened to hear about this tragedy.
Yoruba: Ó bà wá nínú jẹ́ gan-an pé irú àjálù burúkú yìí ṣẹlẹ̀.

English: We long for the time when God will “wipe out every tear .
Yoruba: À ń retí ìgbà tí Ọlọ́run máa ‘nu gbogbo omijé kúrò tí ikú ò ní sí mọ́, tí kò sì ní sí ọ̀fọ̀ tàbí ẹkún tàbí ìrora mọ́.’

Yoruba: Déètì: August 9 sí 11, 2019

Yoruba: Ibi Tó Ti Wáyé: Chase Field ní Phoenix, Arizona, Orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà

Yoruba: Èdè: Gẹ̀ẹ́sì

Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá Láti Ilẹ̀ Òkèèrè: 5,000

Yoruba: Àwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì Tá A Pè: Australasia, ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Kánádà, Central Europe, Chile, Faransé, Gíríìsì, Íńdíà, Ítálì, Kòríà, Micronesia, Scandinavia, Sri Lanka, Tahiti, Thailand, Trinidad and Tobago, Tọ́kì

English: Local Experience: Steve Moore, the president and CEO of Visit Phoenix, which helps book conventions, hotels, and resorts in the Phoenix area, commented:
Yoruba: Ìrírí: Steve Moore tó jẹ́ ààrẹ àti Ọ̀gá àgbà iléeṣẹ́ kan tí wọ́n ń pè ní Visit Phoenix, ló bá wa ṣètò ibi tá a ti ṣe àpéjọ náà, àwọn òtẹ́ẹ̀lì àti ibi ìgbafẹ́ tá a ṣeré lọ ní ìlú Phoenix, ó sọ pé:

English: “[This convention] is the most professionally organized convention I’ve ever had the pleasure of working with in a very long career.
Yoruba: “Ọjọ́ pẹ́ gan-an tí mo ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ yìí, àmọ́ àpéjọ yín ló ṣì wà létòletò jù látìgbà tí mo ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ yìí. Inú mi dùn pé a jọ ṣiṣẹ́.

English: And on top of that, you promise to clean the stadium before you leave—no one else does that.”"
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ẹ ṣèlérí pé ẹ máa jẹ́ kí pápá ìṣeré yìí wà ní mímọ́ kẹ́ ẹ tó kúrò, kò sẹ́ni tó sọ bẹ́ẹ̀ rí, àfẹ̀yin nìkan.”"

English: In January 2019, the museum exhibits at world headquarters were officially made available in American Sign Language (ASL).
Yoruba: Bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti January 2019, ó ti ṣeé ṣe fáwọn tó gbọ́ Èdè Adití ti Amẹ́ríkà (ASL) láti túbọ̀ gbádùn ìbẹ̀wò wọn sí oríléeṣẹ́ wa.

English: Enrique Ford, who oversees the Museum Department, explains: “The translation and computer programming effort that went into making the museum content available to the ASL community was extraordinary!
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Enrique Ford, tó jẹ́ alábòójútó Ẹ̀ka Àwọn Nǹkan Ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé sọ pé: “Iṣẹ́ kékeré kọ́ ni ẹ̀ka ìtúmọ̀ èdè àti ti kọ̀ǹpútà ṣe láti mú káwọn ará wa lóye àwọn nǹkan ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé yìí ní Èdè Adití ti Amẹ́ríkà (ASL)!

English: Now deaf and hard-of-hearing brothers and sisters who visit our exhibits can have an immersive, engaging, and educational experience when they tour.” Ana Barrios, who is deaf and serves as a regular pioneer in New York, was among the first to tour the exhibits in ASL.
Yoruba: Torí náà, àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin tí wọ́n jẹ́ adití tàbí tí wọn ò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ gbọ́rọ̀ tí wọ́n máa ń ṣèbẹ̀wò síbi ìpàtẹ wa máa gbádùn ẹ̀ dọ́ba báyìí. Á mú kí wọ́n túbọ̀ mọyì ohun tí wọ́n rí, á wú wọn lórí, á sì túbọ̀ kọ́ wọ́n lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ gan-an.” Arábìnrin Ana Barrios, tó jẹ́ adití tó sì ń ṣe aṣáájú-ọ̀nà déédéé nílùú New York, wà lára àwọn tó kọ́kọ́ ṣèbẹ̀wò síbi ìpàtẹ yìí.

English: She commented: “Getting the device with ASL content was thrilling!
Yoruba: Ẹ gbọ́ ohun tó sọ: “Nígbà tí mò ń wo àlàyé nípa àtẹ náà lédè adití lórí ẹ̀rọ tí wọ́n gbé fún mi, orí mi wú!

English: Although I had been to the museum before and was familiar with the layout, the information had not yet touched my heart because I didn’t fully understand the details from just reading the English captions.
Yoruba: Kì í ṣe ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tí mo máa wá síbí rèé, léraléra ni mo sì ti rí àwọn nǹkan tí wọ́n pàtẹ, síbẹ̀ ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ rèé tí ohun tí mo rí wọ̀ mí lọ́kàn gan-an, ó sì yé mi dáadáa ju ìgbà tí mo kàn ka èdè òyìnbó tí wọ́n fi ṣàlàyé ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan wọn.

English: After watching a few tracks in ASL, I started to get a sense of Jehovah’s name in a way that I never had before.
Yoruba: Bí mo ṣe bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í gbọ́ àlàyé náà lédè mi làwọn nǹkan wá túbọ̀ ṣe kedere sí mi.

English: The exhibit highlighted aspects of Jehovah’s personality that stirred emotions in me to the point of tears!” The ASL project began in June 2017.
Yoruba: Bí àpẹẹrẹ, mo wá lóye ohun tí orúkọ Jèhófà dúró fún, àṣé mi ò tiẹ̀ fi bẹ́ẹ̀ lóye ẹ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀! Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ìpàtẹ yẹn jẹ́ kí n túbọ̀ lóye àwọn ànímọ́ Jèhófà, àlàyé yẹn wọ̀ mí lọ́kàn débi pé ṣe ni mo bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í da omi lójú!” June 2017 niṣẹ́ títúmọ̀ àti ṣíṣètò bẹ̀rẹ̀ lórí ìpàtẹ àwọn nǹkan ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé ní Èdè Adití ti Amẹ́ríkà.

English: A total of 23 brothers and sisters, including 6 deaf and 6 hearing publishers who grew up with deaf parents, helped with the translation and production of the museum content into ASL.
Yoruba: Mẹ́tàlélógún (23) làwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tó kópa nínu rẹ̀, adití ni mẹ́fà lára wọn, mẹ́fà míì sì láwọn òbí tó jẹ́ adití. Gbogbo wọn ló lọ́wọ́ nínú iṣẹ́ títúmọ̀ àwọn àlàyé yẹn sí ASL, wọ́n sì tún kópa nínú àwọn fídíò náà.

English: The translation group filmed over 900 videos, about nine hours of content, to match the museum audio tracks.
Yoruba: Fídíò tí wọ́n ṣe lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́sàn-án (900), wọ́n sì gùn tó nǹkan bíi wákàtí mẹ́sàn-án, kó lè bá àlàyé tá a ti gba ohùn rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ mu.

English: Recording sessions for the ASL tour information were conducted in three studio locations: the ASL remote translation office in Fort Lauderdale, Florida; the United States branch facilities in Wallkill, New York; and the world headquarters offices in Warwick, New York.
Yoruba: Ilé ìgbohùnsílẹ̀ mẹ́ta tó wà fún èdè adití la ti ṣe iṣẹ́ náà: Ọ́fíìsì àwọn atúmọ̀ Èdè Adití (ASL) ní Fort Lauderdale, ìpínlẹ̀ Florida; èyí tó wà ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ní Wallkill, ìpínlẹ̀ New York; àtèyí tó wà ní oríléeṣẹ́ wa ní Warwick, ìpínlẹ̀ New York.

English: Before releasing the final version of the ASL museum content, deaf brothers and sisters of different ages and backgrounds tested and helped refine the translation and tour experience.
Yoruba: Kó lè dá wa lójú pé kò sí tàbí-ṣùgbọ́n kankan nínú iṣẹ́ náà, a pe àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin mélòó kan tí wọ́n jẹ́ adití, tọ́jọ́ orí wọn sì yàtọ̀ síra pé kí wọ́n bá wa fojú ṣùnnùkùn wò ó. A ṣiṣẹ́ lórí àwọn àkíyèsí wọn kó tó di pé a gbé e jáde níkẹyìn.

English: Some of the brothers and sisters who assisted with the production of the ASL content for the Warwick museum.
Yoruba: Díẹ̀ rèé lára àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tó túmọ̀ sí èdè adití nípa àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé tá a pàtẹ sí Warwick.

English: The Museum Department purchased touch-screen devices that can display the ASL tour content in a similar format to the standard audio tour devices used for the Warwick museum exhibitions.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka Ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé ra ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé alágbèéká mélòó kan tó lè jẹ́ káwọn tó ń sọ èdè adití (ASL) lóye àwọn nǹkan tí wọ́n ń rí bí wọ́n ṣe ń rìn yíká tí wọ́n sì ń fojú lóúnjẹ. Àlàyé kan náà táwọn tó ti nǹkan bọ etí ń gbọ́ nípa ìpàtẹ Warwick yìí làwọn náà ń wò lórí ẹ̀rọ tí wọ́n mú dání.

English: The Museum Department also enabled the existing 14 touch screens in the exhibits to accommodate ASL videos.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ sáwọn ẹ̀rọ téèyàn lè mú dání, Ẹ̀ka Ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé tún ṣètò ohun tá a lè pè ní tẹlifíṣọ̀n gàdàgbà mẹ́rìnlá míì tó ń ṣàgbéyọ àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé náà, tó sì ń ṣàlàyé wọn lédè ASL.

English: Mark Sanderson, a member of the Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses, states: “The purpose of the Warwick museum is to encourage and build up the faith of all who visit world headquarters.
Yoruba: Mark Sanderson, tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sọ pé: “Kí nìdí tá a fi ṣètò ìpàtẹ àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé yìí? A fẹ́ kó fún gbogbo àwọn tó ń ṣèbẹ̀wò sí oríléeṣẹ́ wa níṣìírí, kó sì fún ìgbàgbọ́ wọn lókun.

English: We’re excited to have the museum exhibit content available in 14 languages, including ASL for visiting deaf and hard-of-hearing brothers and sisters and non-Witnesses alike.” To date, over half a million visitors have toured Warwick.
Yoruba: Inú wa dùn pé èdè mẹ́rìnlá (14) ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ la fi ṣàlàyé onírúurú nǹkan tó wà níbi ìpàtẹ yìí, títí kan Èdè Adití ti Amẹ́ríkà (ASL). Torí náà, ó dùn mọ́ wa pé àwọn ará wa tó jẹ́ adití àtàwọn tí kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ gbọ́rọ̀, títí kan àwọn tí kì í ṣe Ẹlẹ́rìí ló máa jàǹfààní.” Tá a bá ṣírò ẹ̀, ó lè ní ìlàjì mílíọ̀nù èèyàn tó ti wá ṣèbẹ̀wò sí oríléeṣẹ́ wa ní Warwick.

English: The worldwide brotherhood is invited to come and see firsthand the museum exhibits and learn more about the rich spiritual heritage of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: A ké sí ẹ̀yin ará wa níbi gbogbo láyé pé kẹ́ ẹ wá síbi, kẹ́ ẹ sì fojú ara yín rí àwọn nǹkan tá a pàtẹ síbi ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé yìí. Ẹ̀gàn ni hẹ̀ẹ̀, á jẹ́ kẹ́ ẹ túbọ̀ mọyì àwọn ohun ribiribi táwa èèyàn Jèhófà ti gbé ṣe àtohun tó ti wáyé nínú ìtàn àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.

English: All who do so will be encouraged to continue to “put their confidence in God.”—Psalm 78:7.
Yoruba: Kò sí àní-àní, gbogbo àwọn tó ti wá síbí lo pinnu pé títí láé làwọn á máa “gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Ọlọ́run.”—Sáàmù 78:7.

English: Opened since April 3, 2017, the self-guided tours at world headquarters in Warwick, New York, are comprised of three exhibits.
Yoruba: A ṣí i ní April 3, 2017, ìpàtẹ yìí pín sọ́nà mẹ́ta ní oríléeṣẹ́ wa tó wà nílùú Warwick, ní New York. Kò sí pé ẹnì kan ń mú èèyàn kiri ibẹ̀ tàbí kó máa ṣàlàyé fúnni.

English: “The Bible and the Divine Name” highlights that both God’s Word and his name have been preserved throughout history.
Yoruba: “The Bible and the Divine Name” ṣàlàyé báwọn kan ṣe sapá fún ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún láti tẹ Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run àti orúkọ rẹ̀ rì àtohun tí kò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣàṣeyọrí.

English: (Isaiah 40:8) Over 100 rare Biblical scrolls, leaves, manuscripts, and books are showcased.
Yoruba: (Àìsáyà 40:8) Èèyàn á rí àwọn Bíbélì tó ṣọ̀wọ́n, tó lé lọ́gọ́rùn-ún (100) àtàwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé míì tó jẹ mọ́ Bíbélì.

English: “A People for Jehovah’s Name” includes a visual history of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: “A People for Jehovah’s Name” ṣe àfihàn ohun táwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà gbé ṣe àtohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí wa látọdún yìí wá.

English: Artifacts and first-person accounts showing how Jehovah has progressively guided his people are featured.
Yoruba: Àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé àti ìrírí àwọn tọ́rọ̀ ṣojú wọn jẹ́ ká rí bí Jèhófà ṣe ń darí àwa èèyàn rẹ̀ látọdún yìí wá.

English: “World Headquarters—Faith in Action” explains the work of the six committees of the Governing Body and how they organize the worldwide activities of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: “World Headquarters—Faith in Action” ṣàlàyé ojúṣe ìgbìmọ̀ mẹ́fẹ̀ẹ̀fà ti Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí àti bí wọ́n ṣe ń bójú tó onírúurú iṣẹ́ táwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ń ṣe kárí ayé.

English: “Courage to Stand Firm in a Time of Trial” is a special rotational exhibit.
Yoruba: “Courage to Stand Firm in a Time of Trial.” Wọ́n máa ń pààrọ̀ ohun tí wọ́n kó síbi ìpàtẹ yìí látìgbàdégbà.

English: It covers the time period of 1914 to 1919, and shows how the Bible Students faced tests of their faith, both individually and as an organization.
Yoruba: Ó jẹ́ ká mọ bí nǹkan ṣe rí láàárín ọdún 1914 sí 1919, àdánwò ìgbàgbọ́ táwọn Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì kojú lẹ́nì kọ̀ọ̀kan àti lápapọ̀.

English: The interactive experience allows visitors to enjoy rare original photographs, documents, and graphics, as well as audio and video interviews.
Yoruba: Ìpàtẹ yìí ń jẹ́ káwọn tó ṣèbẹ̀wò rí àwọn fọ́tò tá a ti yà látọjọ́ gbọ́nhan, àwọn àkọsílẹ̀, àwòrán àtàwọn ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò tá a ti gbà sílẹ̀ tipẹ́tipẹ́. Àwọn tó ṣèbẹ̀wò lè tẹ́tí sí i tàbí kí wọ́n wò ó ní fídíò.

English: It has been open since October 3, 2018.
Yoruba: October 3, 2018 nibi ìpàtẹ yìí ti di àpéwò.

English: The exhibit content will eventually be transported and put on display at other branches and a new special exhibition will be opened at Warwick.
Yoruba: A máa fàwọn nǹkan tá a kó síbi ìpàtẹ yìí ránṣẹ́ sáwọn ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa míì káwọn náà lè pàtẹ wọn, àá wá pàtẹ àwọn nǹkan míì sí Warwick.

English: Dates: May 24-26, 2019
Yoruba: Déètì: May 24 sí 26, 2019

English: Location: Marlins Park in Miami, Florida, United States
Yoruba: Ibi Tá A Ti Ṣe É: Marlins Park nílùú Miami, ìpínlẹ̀ Florida, Amẹ́ríkà

Yoruba: Èdè: Sípáníìṣì

English: Peak Attendance: 28,562
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá: 28,562

Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Ṣèrìbọmi: 230

Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá Láti Ìlẹ̀ Òkèèrè: 4,600

English: Invited Branches: Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Britain, Canada, Central America, Central Europe, Chile, Colombia, Cuba, Ecuador, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Spain"
Yoruba: Áwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíísì Tó Wá: Ajẹntínà, Bolivia, Brazil, Britain, Kánádà, Central America, Central Europe, Chile, Kòlóńbíà, Cuba, Ecuador, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Sípéènì"

English: On Saturday, July 13, 2019, a Category 1 hurricane made landfall in Louisiana before quickly downgrading to a tropical storm known as Barry.
Yoruba: Ní Saturday, July 13, 2019, ìjì líle kan rọ́ lu ìlú Louisiana, kó tó di pé ọwọ́ wà rọlẹ̀ díẹ̀ tí wọ́n fi wá ń pè é ní Barry.

English: This tropical storm caused wind damage, flooding, and widespread power outages across the states of Alabama, Louisiana, and Mississippi.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle yìí ba nǹkan jẹ́, ó fa àkúnya omi, ó sì jẹ́ kí iná mànàmáná lọ ní ibi púpọ̀ yí ká ìpínlẹ̀ Alabama, Louisiana, àti Mississippi.

English: Although no publishers were injured or killed by this storm, 123 were displaced.
Yoruba: Bí o tì lẹ́ jẹ́ pé kò sí akéde kankan tó fara pa tàbí kú nínú ìjì náà, àwọn mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́fà (123) ni wọ́n di aláìnílé lórí.

English: Additionally, the storm damaged 27 homes of our brothers and sisters, as well as 5 Kingdom Halls.
Yoruba: Láfikún, ìjì líle náà ba ilé mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rùn-ún (97) tó jẹ́ ti àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa jẹ́, pẹ̀lú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba márùn-ún.

English: Circuit overseers and local elders are shepherding those affected by the storm.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àti àwọn alàgbà ìjọ ń lọ bẹ àwọn tọ́rọ̀ náà kàn wò kí wọ́n lè fún wọn níṣìírí.

English: Also, publishers in neighboring congregations are providing water, food, and shelter where needed.
Yoruba: Bákan náà làwọn akéde láti àwọn ìjọ tó wà nítòsí ń pèsè omi, oúnjẹ àti ibùgbé níbi tí wọ́n ti nílò wọn.

English: Efforts to stabilize properties and perform repairs locally are already underway.
Yoruba: Wọ́n ti ń ṣètò bí wọ́n á ṣe tún àwọn ilé tó nílò àtúnṣe ṣe.

English: Our prayers and support will continue to be with our brothers and sisters in the southern United States as they cope with the aftermath of Tropical Storm Barry.
Yoruba: Àá máa fi àwọn arákùnrin àti àwọn arábìnrin wa ní Gúúsù Amẹ́ríkà tí ìjì líle Barry ṣe lọ́ṣẹ́ sínú àdúrà wa, àá sì máa tì wọ́n lẹ́yìn.

English: On May 31, 2019, a gunman opened fire on employees working in a municipal office building in Virginia Beach, Virginia, United States.
Yoruba: Ní May 31, 2019, ọkùnrin kan bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í ròjọ̀ ọta ìbọn lu àwọn tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní ọ́fíìsì ìlú Virginia Beach, ìpínlẹ̀ Virginia, lórílẹ̀-èdè United States.

English: Twelve people were killed and four were injured.
Yoruba: Èèyàn méjìlá ló kú, àwọn mẹ́rin sì fara pa.

English: The United States branch reports that sadly, one of our sisters, LaQuita Brown, was among those killed in this attack.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn tá a gbọ́ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà fi hàn pé, ó ṣeni láàánú pé arábìnrin wa kan tó ń jẹ́, LaQuita Brown, wà lára àwọn tó kù nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú yìí.

English: Sister Brown was 39 years old and a regular pioneer in the Seaview French Congregation in Norfolk, Virginia.
Yoruba: Ẹni ọdún mọ́kàndínlógójì (39) ni Arábìnrin Brown, aṣáájú-ọ̀nà sì ni nínú Ìjọ Seaview tí wọ́n ti ń sọ èdè Faransé nílùú Norfolk, ìpínlẹ̀ Virginia.

English: She also served as a Local/Design Construction volunteer.
Yoruba: Arábìnrin yìí máa ń yọ̀ǹda ara rẹ̀ láti ṣisẹ́ pẹ̀lú Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ.

English: The local elders, along with the circuit overseer, are providing Scriptural encouragement and emotional support to Sister Brown’s friends and family.
Yoruba: Àwọn alàgbà tó wà lágbègbè náà àti alábòójútó àyílká wọn ń fún tẹbítọ̀rẹ́ Arábìnrin Brown níṣìírí, wọ́n sì ń tù wọ́n nínú.

English: We are deeply saddened to hear about the loss of our sister.
Yoruba: Ikú arábìnrin yìí dùn wá gan-an.

English: We look forward to the time when tragedies like this will no longer occur and there will be an “abundance of peace” on the earth.
Yoruba: À ń retí àsìkò tí irú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú yìí ò ní wáyé mọ́, tí “ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àlàáfíà” á sì wá káàkiri ayé.

English: A series of more than 100 tornadoes tore through the southeastern United States from April 12 to April 13, 2020.
Yoruba: Ní April 12 àti 13, 2020, ó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún (100) ìgbà tí ìjì líle tí wọ́n ń pè ní tornado ṣoṣẹ́ ní apá gúúsù ìlà oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà.

English: The National Weather Service reported that one tornado, which spanned some two miles in width, was one of the largest in recorded history.
Yoruba: Àjọ Tó Ń Bójú Tó Ipò Ojú Ọjọ́ sọ pé ọ̀kan lára ìjì líle náà fẹ̀ tó kílòmítà mẹ́ta, ó wà lára àwọn ìjì líle tó tóbi jù tó tíì jà rí.

English: The branch immediately contacted circuit overseers in the area to determine how our brothers were affected.
Yoruba: Ẹsẹ̀kẹsẹ̀ ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì kàn sí àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà ní agbègbè yẹn kí wọ́n lè mọ bí nǹkan ṣe ń lọ sí pẹ̀lú àwọn ará wa.

English: No brothers or sisters were killed by the severe weather. One sister suffered minor injuries when a tornado hit her home.
Yoruba: Kò sí ìkankan nínú àwọn ará wa tí ìjì náà pa. Àmọ́, arábìnrin kan fara pa díẹ̀ nígbà tí ìjì náà fẹ́ lu ilé rẹ̀.

English: In total, 63 publishers were displaced, 12 homes were destroyed, and 58 homes sustained damage.
Yoruba: Àwọn akéde mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́ta (63) ló ní láti kúrò nílé, ilé méjìlá (12) ló wó, ilé méjìdínlọ́gọ́ta (58) ló sì bà jẹ́.

English: Additionally, five Kingdom Halls were lightly damaged and one Kingdom Hall sustained major damage from a falling tree.
Yoruba: Láfikún síyẹn, Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba márùn-ún ló bà jẹ́ díẹ̀, àmọ́ igi kan wó lu Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan, ó sì bà á jẹ́ gan-an.

English: Local elders and circuit overseers are continuing to evaluate the situation.
Yoruba: Àwọn alàgbà àtàwọn alábòójútó àyíká ṣì ń kíyè sí bí nǹkan ṣe rí.

English: They are caring for the immediate practical and spiritual needs of our brothers and sisters, providing much-needed comfort to those who suffered loss.
Yoruba: Wọ́n ń bójú tó ohun táwọn ará nílò nípa tara àti nípa tẹ̀mí, wọ́n sì ń pèsè ìtùnú fáwọn tí àjálù náà bá.​

English: Tropical Depression Florence has inundated large parts of North Carolina, South Carolina, and other states with floodwaters.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle kan tí wọ́n pè ní Florence jà lọ́pọ̀ ibi ní ìpínlẹ̀ North Carolina, South Carolina àtàwọn ìpínlẹ̀ míì lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, omíyalé sì tún ṣẹlẹ̀ níbẹ̀.

English: Initially a Category 4 hurricane, Florence has killed at least 32 people and displaced thousands.
Yoruba: Ìgbà kan wà tí ìjì líle tí wọ́n ń pè ní Florence yìí pa ó kéré tán, èèyàn méjìlélọ́gbọ̀n (32), tó sì sọ ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún èèyàn di aláìrílégbé.

English: The United States branch reports that no publishers have been killed or seriously injured by the storm, although over 4,000 Witnesses have been displaced.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà sọ pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn akéde wa tó bá ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà lọ tàbí tó fara pa ju bó ṣe yẹ, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rin (4,000) Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tí ìjì náà lé kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé.

English: Though conditions are improving, some areas are still not accessible due to high floodwaters.
Yoruba: Lóòótọ́, ìjì náà ti jà tán, síbẹ̀ àwọn ibì kan ò tíì ṣeé dé torí omi tó bo gbogbo ibẹ̀.

English: Current assessments indicate that the storm damaged 351 homes of our brothers and sisters and 21 Kingdom Halls.
Yoruba: Àyẹ̀wò tí wọ́n ṣe gbẹ̀yìn fi hàn pé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta àti mọ́kànléláàádọ́ta (351) ilé àwọn ará wa pẹ̀lú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mọ́kànlélógún (21) ni ìjì náà bà jẹ́.

English: Food, water, clothing, shelter, and basic medical needs are being coordinated through a Disaster Relief Committee (DRC).
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù ń ṣiṣẹ́ lórí bí àwọn ará ṣe máa rí oúnjẹ, omi, ibùgbé àti ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn tí wọ́n nílò.

English: Relief efforts include the work of two tree removal crews who are assisting with the widespread damage.
Yoruba: Àwùjọ méjì kan tún wà tó ń ṣèrànwọ́ láti kó àwọn igi tó wó lulẹ̀ kúrò lágbègbè náà.

English: With flooding now becoming the major concern, volunteers from local congregations and others invited from elsewhere are coming to assist and will be working under the direction of the DRC.
Yoruba: Ohun tó kù báyìí ni bí wọ́n ṣe máa tún àwọn nǹkan tí omíyalé ti bà jẹ́ ṣe. Àwọn ará láwọn ìjọ tó wà níbẹ̀ àtàwọn tó wá láti ibòmíì ń yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti bá Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù náà ṣiṣẹ́.

English: Local elders and circuit overseers are making shepherding visits on those affected.
Yoruba: Àwọn alàgbà ìjọ àti àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà níbẹ̀ sì ń lọ sọ́dọ̀ àwọn tọ́rọ̀ náà kàn láti fún wọn níṣìírí.

English: We pray for our brothers and sisters who are dealing with difficult circumstances as a result of the recent storm and look forward to the time when we will “feel no dread.
Yoruba: À ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn ará wa tí nǹkan nira fún nítorí ìjì líle tó jà lẹ́nu àìpẹ́ yìí, a sì ń retí ìgbà tí ‘ẹ̀rù kankan’ ò ní bà wá mọ́.

English: Deadly tornadoes ripped through portions of Alabama, Florida, and Georgia, on Sunday, March 3, 2019, resulting in 23 fatalities and dozens of injuries.
Yoruba: Ní Sunday March 3, 2019, ìjì tó le gan-an jà láwọn apá ibì kan ní ìpínlẹ̀ Alabama, Florida àti Georgia, ó gbẹ̀mí èèyàn mẹ́tàlélógún (23), ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ló sì fara pa.

English: The United States branch reports that there were no deaths among our brothers.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà sọ pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tó kú.

English: However, one of our sisters was injured when a tornado completely destroyed her home in Fort Valley, Georgia.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ arábìnrin wa kan fara pa nígbà tí ìjì líle ba ilé rẹ̀ jẹ́ pátápátá ní ìlú Fort Valley, ìpínlẹ̀ Georgia.

English: She is getting the necessary medical attention at a nearby hospital.
Yoruba: Wọ́n ti ń tọ́jú rẹ̀ nílé ìwòsàn kan tó wà nítòsí.

English: Additionally, the branch reports that six of our brothers’ homes sustained damage and four others were totally destroyed.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì sọ pé ilé mẹ́fà àwọn ará wa ni ìjì náà bà jẹ́, ó sì wó ilé mẹ́rin míì pátápátá.

English: Under the direction of circuit overseers in the area, publishers have supplied food, shelter, and clothing to the affected brothers, and local elders are providing spiritual comfort.
Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà lágbègbè náà ń ṣètò báwọn ará ṣe ń rí oúnjẹ, ibi tí wọ́n á gbé àti aṣọ, àwọn alàgbà sì ń fi Bíbélì fún wọn níṣìírí.

English: We pray that our brothers who have been impacted by this disaster are comforted by our yeartext for 2019, “Do not be anxious, for I am your God.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí àwọn ará wa tí àjálù yìí kàn rí ìtùnú nínú ẹṣin ọdún wa ti 2019 tó sọ pé, “Má wò yí ká, nítorí èmi ni Ọlọ́run rẹ.

English: The ongoing economic crisis in Venezuela continues to affect our brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Bí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé ṣe túbọ̀ ń dẹnu kọlẹ̀ ní Fẹnẹsúélà nípa lórí àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin.

English: Every week, the branch office in Venezuela receives reports of publishers who have been victims of crimes.
Yoruba: Ọ̀sọ̀ọ̀sẹ̀ ni ìròyìn nípa àwọn ará wa tí wọ́n hùwà ọ̀daràn sí ń dé ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà.

English: Also, numerous Kingdom Halls in the country have been burglarized.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, ọ̀pọ̀ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba lórílẹ̀-èdè náà ni wọ́n ti jí àwọn nǹkan tó wà nínu rẹ̀ kó lọ.

English: Our brothers face hyperinflation as well as shortages of food, medicine, and other basic goods.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará wa ń fara dà á bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé gbogbo nǹkan ló ti gbówó lérí, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni kò sí oúnjẹ, oògùn àtàwọn nǹkan tó ṣe pàtàkì míì.

English: Since 2013, over 20,000 publishers have fled to other countries, including Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Italy, Peru, Portugal, Spain, and the United States.
Yoruba: Látọdún 2013, ó lé ní ọ̀kẹ́ kan (20,000) akéde tó ti sá lọ́ sáwọn orílẹ̀-èdè míì bíi, Ajẹntínà, Brazil, Chile, Kòlóńbíà, Ecuador, Ítálì, Peru, Pọ́túgà, Sípéènì àti Amẹ́ríkà.

English: * Despite these difficult circumstances, the approximately 140,000 Jehovah’s Witnesses who remain in Venezuela are active in their spiritual activities.
Yoruba: * Láìka gbogbo ìṣòro yìí sí, nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ogóje (140,000) Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Fẹnẹsúélà báyìí ń bá ìjọsìn wọn lọ.

English: The branch office in Venezuela continues to organize the ongoing relief work within the country.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà kò dáwọ́ dúró láti máa ṣètò ìrànwọ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.

English: There are now 60 relief committees, which have primarily been tasked with distributing food to the brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí, ọgọ́ta (60) ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń ṣètò ìrànwọ́ ló ń ṣiṣẹ́ kára láti pín oúnjẹ fáwọn ará lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin.

English: To date, the Venezuela branch, with the assistance of the Brazil branch, has distributed hundreds of tons of donated food to over 64,000 publishers in 1,497 congregations.
Yoruba: Títí di báyìí, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà pẹ̀lú èyí tó wà nílẹ̀ Brazil ti pín oúnjẹ tí àwọn ará kó jọ, tó sì kún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọkọ̀ akẹ́rù fún àwọn akéde tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́ta (64,000) láwọn ìjọ ẹgbẹ̀rún kan, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin àti mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rùn-ún (1,497).

English: The Venezuela branch also continues to help care for the spiritual needs of the brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà tún ń pèsè àwọn ohun táwọn ará nílò láti máa bá ìjọsìn wọn lọ.

English: This summer, there were 122 “Be Courageous”! Regional Conventions held throughout the country, the last of which concluded on September 2, 2018.
Yoruba: Lọ́dún yìí, Àpéjọ Agbègbè “Jẹ́ Onígboyà”! méjìlélọ́gọ́fà (122) ni wọ́n ṣe káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè náà, September 2, 2018 ni wọ́n parí èyí tó kẹ́yìn lára wọn.

English: The conventions provided a vital spiritual boost to the brothers and sisters, many of whom had to overcome severe economic challenges to attend.
Yoruba: Àpéjọ Agbègbè yìí túbọ̀ fún àwọn ará lókun gan-an nípa tẹ̀mí, ọ̀pọ̀ lára wọn ló sì tiraka gan-an kí wọ́n tó lè wá sí àpéjọ náà.

English: Witnesses in Venezuela are actively comforting the many distressed people in the country with the Bible’s message.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará ní Fẹnẹsúélà ń ṣiṣẹ́ kára láti fi ọ̀rọ̀ Bíbélì tu ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn tí wàhálà ti bá lórílẹ̀-èdè náà nínú.

English: Currently, publishers conduct close to 200,000 Bible studies each month.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, iye ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì táwọn akéde ń darí lóṣooṣù fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ọ̀kẹ́ mẹ́wàá (200,000).

English: There has also been an increase of newly interested ones attending congregation meetings, and 7,259 individuals were baptized.
Yoruba: Iye àwọn tó ń kẹ́kọ̀ọ́, tí wọ́n sì ń wá sípàdé ti pọ̀ sí i, àwọn ẹgbẹ̀rún méje ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́jì àti mọ́kàndínlọ́góta (7,259) ló sì ṣèrìbọmi.

English: These positive spiritual developments demonstrate that God’s spirit is fortifying our Venezuelan brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Àwọn ìtẹ̀síwájú tí à ń rí yìí fi hàn pé ẹ̀mí Ọlọ́run ló ń fún àwọn ará wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà lágbára.

English: We pray that they continue to trust in Jehovah until his Kingdom ends all present distresses.—Proverbs 3:5, 6.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí wọ́n gbára lé Jèhófà títí dìgbà tí Ìjọba rẹ̀ máa fòpin sí gbogbo wàhálà tí à ń kojú báyìí.—Òwe 3:5, 6.

English: For more information on the situation in Venezuela, watch the video Venezuela—Love and Faith During Difficult Times.
Yoruba: Tó o bá fẹ́ mọ̀ sí i nípa ohun tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ ní Fẹnẹsúélà, wo fídíò Fẹnẹsúélà—Wọ́n Ní Ìfẹ́ àti Ìgbàgbọ́ Bí Nǹkan Tiẹ̀ Nira.

English: ^ par. 2 In times of economic, social, or political crisis, each publisher must decide whether or not to flee their country of residence.
Yoruba: ^ ìpínrọ̀ 2 Láwọn àkókò tí ọrọ̀ ajé àti ètò ìṣèlú ò bá fara rọ, akéde kọ̀ọ̀kàn ló máa pinnu bóyá kí òun kúrò lórílẹ̀-èdè tóun ń gbé tàbí kóun dúró.

English: The organization does not promote or encourage one’s decision to either leave or remain.
Yoruba: Ètò Ọlọ́run kì í pinnu fáwọn èèyàn bóyá kí wọ́n kúrò tàbí kí wọ́n dúró.

English: The social and economic crisis in Venezuela continues.
Yoruba: Ìlú ò fara rọ, ọrọ̀ ajé sì ti dẹnu kọlẹ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà.

English: Access to food, water, fuel, and medicine is severely limited because of shortages and high prices.
Yoruba: Àwọn èèyàn ò rí oúnjẹ, omi, epo pẹtiróòlù, ati oògùn tí wọ́n máa lò torí kò sí lárọ̀ọ́wọ́tó, èyí tó wà sì gbówó lérí.

English: Frequent power outages have intensified the food shortages, as the lack of power interferes with refrigeration.
Yoruba: Àìsí iná ti mú kí oúnjẹ túbọ̀ ṣọ̀wọ́n, torí kò sí bí wọ́n á ṣe tọjú rẹ̀ kó má bàa bà jẹ́.

English: Crime is a constant concern.
Yoruba: Ìwà ọ̀daràn sì ń peléke sí i.

English: Despite these difficult conditions, the over 136,500 publishers in Venezuela continue to share zealously in the ministry.
Yoruba: Síbẹ̀, lójú gbogbo ìṣòro yìí, àwọn akéde ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rìndínlógóje àtààbọ̀ (136,500) tó wà ní Fẹnẹsúélà ó yéé fìtara wàásù.

English: For example, in January 2019, although there were 7,000 fewer publishers in the country compared to the previous year, they dedicated 90,000 more hours in the field ministry.
Yoruba: Bí àpẹẹrẹ, ní January 2019, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé iye àwọn akéde lórílẹ̀-èdè náà fi ẹgbẹ̀rún méje (7,000) dín sí tọdún tó kọjá, wákàtí tí wọ́n fi wàásù fi ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà àádọ́rùn-ún (90,000) ju ti tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ.

English: In April 2019, more than 195,600 Bible studies were being conducted.
Yoruba: Ní April 2019, ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì tí wọ́n ṣe fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì (195,600).

English: The number of regular pioneers rose to over 30,000.
Yoruba: Àwọn aṣáájú-ọ̀nà déédéé pọ̀ sí i, wọ́n ti lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgbọ̀n (30,000).

English: In response to the special worldwide effort to invite others to the Memorial of Christ’s death, the number of auxiliary pioneers increased to 20,400.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará kọ́wọ́ ti ẹ̀tò tá a ṣe kárí ayé láti pe àwọn èèyàn wá síbi Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, ìyẹn sì mú kí iye àwọn aṣáájú-ọ̀nà olùrànlọ́wọ́ di ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ogún ó lé ọgọ́rùn mẹ́rin (20,400).

English: These efforts no doubt contributed to almost 471,000 people attending the Memorial—more than triple the number of publishers.
Yoruba: Ìsapá tí wọ́n ṣe yìí mú kí nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin ó lé mọ́kànléláàádọ́rin (471,000) èèyàn wá síbi Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, èyí sì ju ìlọ́po mẹ́ta iye àwọn akéde tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.

English: Additionally, congregation meetings are well supported, in part, because our brothers continue to provide the Bible’s message to people searching for a trustworthy solution to their problems.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ló ń wá sípàde, torí pé àwọn ará ò yéé kọ́ àwọn tó ń wá ojútùú sí ìṣòro wọn lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì.

English: The Venezuela branch continues to coordinate relief efforts to help our brothers receive basic food items to supplement their diet.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà ṣètò iṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́ kí àwọn ará wa lè rí ohun tí wọ́n nílò jẹ.

English: Each month, with the assistance of neighboring branches and generous donations to the worldwide work, the Venezuela branch distributes hundreds of tons of donated food to 75,000 publishers in 1,595 congregations.
Yoruba: Lọ́lá ìrànwọ́ láti àwọn ẹ̀ka tó wà láyìíká àti owó ìtìlẹyìn kárí ayé, oṣooṣù ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà ń pín ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ẹrù oúnjẹ fún ẹgbẹ̀rún márùndínlọ́gọ́rin (75,000) akéde ní ìjọ ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ọgọ́rùn márùn-ún ó lé márùndínlọ́gọ́rùn-ún (1,595).

English: Our brothers in Venezuela face many difficulties, but we are encouraged that they continue ‘exulting in Jehovah and being joyful in the God of their salvation.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ ìṣoro làwọn ará wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà ń fara dà, àmọ́ inú wa dùn pé wọ́n ń ‘yọ̀ gidigidi nínú Jèhófà, inú wọn sì ń dùn nínú Ọlọ́run ìgbàlà wọn.

English: NEW YORK—International media outlets have been reporting on deteriorating conditions in Venezuela set off by economic troubles.
Yoruba: ÌLÚ NEW YORK— Kárí ayé ni àwọn oníròyìn ti ń sọ nípa wàhálà tó ń bá orílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà nítorí ọrọ̀ ajé tó dẹnu kọlẹ̀.

English: The Venezuela Branch Committee reports that our brothers and sisters have also been affected by this crisis.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà sọ pé wàhálà náà ò yọ àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa sílẹ̀.

English: The Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses is deeply concerned by these reports.
Yoruba: Àwọn ìròyìn yìí ò múnú Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí dùn rárá.

English: Armed criminals have entered some Kingdom Halls during weekly meetings to steal electronic devices and other valuables.
Yoruba: Àwọn adigunjalè wọ àwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan nígbà tí ìpàdé àárín ọ̀sẹ̀ ń lọ lọ́wọ́, wọ́n sì jí àwọn ẹ̀rọ̀ abánáṣiṣẹ́ àtàwọn nǹkan iyebíye míì.

English: Additionally, in some cases, meetings are held in private homes because violent conflicts block access to Kingdom Halls.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, àwọn ìgbà míì wà tí àwọn ará máa ṣèpàdé ní ilé àdáni, torí pé àwọn tó ń bára wọn jà ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n rọ́nà dé Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba.

English: A number of our brothers and sisters are among those who have lost their jobs because their place of employment closed down.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ lára àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa ló wà lára àwọn tí iṣẹ́ bọ́ mọ́ lọ́wọ́ torí pé ibi tí wọ́n ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ kógbá wọlé.

English: Some who own businesses have been targeted by criminals and gangs and, as a result, have been forced to sell their business and flee the country for their safety.
Yoruba: Ṣe ni àwọn ọ̀daràn àtàwọn jàǹdùkú tún ń dájú sọ àwọn tó níṣẹ́ ara wọn, ìyẹn lò fà á táwọn kan fi gbé okòwò wọn tà, tí wọ́n sì sá kúrò nílùú kí wọ́n lè rímú mí.

English: Sadly, over the last few years, there have been at least 680 brothers and sisters kidnapped, over 13,146 have been victims of armed robbery, and 144 have even been victims of rape or attempted rape.
Yoruba: Ó bani nínú jẹ́ pé, láwọn ọdún àìpẹ́ yìí, ó kéré tán ọgọ́rùn-ún méje ó dín ogún [680] àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin ni wọ́n ti jí gbé, ó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́tàlá àti mẹ́rìndínláàádọ́jọ [13,146] nínú wọn tí àwọn adigunjalè jí nǹkan wọn, àwọn mẹ́rìnlélógóje [144] ni wọ́n sì ti fipá bá lò pọ̀ tàbí tí wọ́n fẹ́ ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ fún.

English: Tragically, reports as of August 10, 2017, indicate that 47 of our brothers and sisters have been murdered.
Yoruba: Èyí tó burú jù ni ohun tí ìròyìn tó dé ní August 10, 2017 sọ, pé àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin mẹ́tàdínláàádọ́ta [47] ni wọ́n ti pa.

English: Some have also died because they could not obtain needed medical treatment.
Yoruba: Àwọn míì tiẹ̀ tún gbẹ́mìí mì torí pé wọn ò rí ìtọ́jú tó yẹ gbà.

English: The Governing Body continues to closely monitor the situation, utilizing donated funds allocated to assist brothers and sisters who are in need of basic relief supplies.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí ń wo bí nǹkan ṣe ń lọ sí lójú méjèèjì, wọ́n ń lo lára owó táwọn èèyàn fi ṣètọrẹ láti ran àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin tí wọ́n nílò oúnjẹ, ilé gbígbé àtàwọn nǹkan míì lọ́wọ́.

English: The Governing Body is also communicating with other branches around the world to ascertain the most appropriate means of providing support for our brothers and sisters in Venezuela, since individual efforts to provide direct assistance can be dangerous.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí tún ń bá àwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì kárí ayé sọ̀rọ̀ kí wọ́n lè rí ọ̀nà tó dáa jù láti ran àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà lọ́wọ́, torí pé ó léwu kéèyàn sọ pé òun fẹ́ lọ síbẹ̀ lọ ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́.

English: The Venezuela Branch Committee has set up an emergency relief committee at the branch office that oversees 24 subcommittees throughout the country to care for the needs of our brothers.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka orílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà ti yan ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń bójú tó ètò ìrànwọ́ pàjáwìrì sí ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì náà, ìgbìmọ̀ tí wọ́n yàn yìí sì ń bójú tó ìgbìmọ̀ kéékèèké mẹ́rìnlélógún [24] míì káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè náà láti pèsè ohun tí àwọn ará nílò.

English: The over 149,000 publishers in Venezuela are not only enduring despite suffering severe trials during the “last days,” they are also increasing their efforts to share the Bible’s comforting message with their neighbors.
Yoruba: Kì í ṣe pé àwọn akéde tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ogóje ó lé mẹ́sàn-án [149,000] tó wà ní Fẹnẹsúélà ń fara da ìpọ́njú tó lágbára “ní àwọn ọjọ́ ìkẹyìn” yìí nìkan ni, wọ́n tún ń fi kún ìsapá wọn láti máa sọ ọ̀rọ̀ ìtùnú tó wà nínú Bíbélì fún àwọn aládùúgbò wọn.

English: (2 Timothy 3:1-5; 2 Timothy 4:2) Luis R. Navas, a spokesman from the Venezuela branch office, explains: “Spiritually, we have never been so prosperous.
Yoruba: (2 Tímótì 3:1-5; 2 Tímótì 4:2) Luis R. Navas tó jẹ́ agbẹnusọ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà sọ pé: “A ò tíì lọ́rọ̀ nípa tẹ̀mí báyìí rí.

English: Our congregation meeting attendance has increased.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó ń wá sípàdé ìjọ ti pọ̀ sí i.

English: More publishers are regular pioneering while at the same time exercising greater caution in the ministry.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ akéde ló ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ aṣáájú-ọ̀nà déédéé, wọ́n sì ń ṣọ́ra ṣe bí wọ́n ń wàásù.

English: Since our neighbors know that we are strictly neutral and that we do not share in any of the criminal activity plaguing the country, they welcome the Bible-based message of hope and comfort we share.” Jehovah’s Witnesses in Venezuela will continue caring for one another and comforting their neighbors.
Yoruba: Torí pé àwọn aládùúgbò wa mọ̀ pé a ò gbè sẹ́yìn ẹnikẹ́ni àti pé a ò lọ́wọ́ sí ìwà ọ̀daràn èyíkéyìí tó ń lọ lórílẹ̀-èdè náà, wọ́n tẹ́wọ́ gba ọ̀rọ̀ ìrètí àti ìtùnú tí à ń sọ fún wọn látinú Bíbélì.” Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà á máa bójú tó ara wọn nìṣó lẹ́nì kọ̀ọ̀kan, wọ́n á sì máa tu àwọn aládùúgbò wọn nínú.

English: Around the world, their fellow brothers and sisters will continue to support them and pray in their behalf.
Yoruba: Kárí ayé, àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin bíi tiwọn á máa tì wọ́n lẹ́yìn nìṣó, wọn ò sì ní dákẹ́ àdúrà lórí wọn.

English: On Wednesday, August 23, Hato, a Category 10 typhoon, battered southern China, including the cities of Hong Kong and Macau.
Yoruba: Ní Wednesday, August 23, ìjì líle tó léńkekà kan tó ń jẹ́ Hato, jà ní apá gúúsù orílẹ̀-èdè Ṣáínà, ó sì dé ìlu Hong Kong àti Macau.

English: No deaths were reported in Hong Kong, but 34 people were injured.
Yoruba: Kò sí ẹni kankan tá a gbọ́ pé ó kú nílùú Hong Kong, àmọ́ àwọn mẹ́tàlélógbọ̀n [34] ló fara pa.

English: In Macau, at least 9 people died and 153 were injured.
Yoruba: Nílùú Macau, ó kéré tán àwọn mẹ́sàn-án ló kú, àwọn mẹ́tàléláàdọ́jọ [153] sì fara pa.

English: The branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses in Hong Kong, which also coordinates the Witnesses’ work in Macau, reported that no Witnesses were killed by the typhoon.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwa Ẹlẹ́rìi Jèhófa ní ìlu Hong Kong, tó tún ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí nílùú Macau, ròyìn pé kò sí Ẹlẹ́rìi kankan tó bá ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí lọ.

English: However, many are without power and potable water in Macau.
Yoruba: Àmọ́, ọ̀pọ̀ ni kò ní iná àti omi tí wọ́n máa lò nílùú Macau.

English: The branch office is coordinating with local Witnesses to provide their fellow believers in need with drinking water and other supplies.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ń ṣètò pẹ̀lú àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí lágbègbè yẹn láti pèsè omi àti àwọn ohun míì tí àwọn ará wọn tí àjálù yìí dé bá nílò.

English: Over 5,500 Jehovah’s Witnesses live in Hong Kong, and another 320 live in Macau.
Yoruba: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìi Jèhófa tó ju ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún àti ọgọ́rùn márùn-ún [5,500] ló ń gbé nílùú Hong Kong, àwọn ọgọ́rùn-un mẹ́ta àti ógún [320] ló sì ń gbé nílùú Macau.

English: Heavy monsoon rains in Kerala, India, triggered some 25 landslides, killing at least 75 people.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle tó máa ń bá òjò rìn jà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kerala, lórílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà, ó sì mú kí òkè ya lulẹ̀ níbi mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n (25), ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí gbẹ̀mí ó kéré tán, èèyàn márùndínlọ́gọ́rin (75).

English: According to the India Meteorological Department, the current southwest monsoon has produced some of the heaviest rains in the area’s history.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Ṣèwádìí Nípa Ojú Ọjọ́ Nílẹ̀ Íńdíà (India Meteorological Department) sọ pé ìjì líle tó máa ń jà lápá gúúsù ìwọ̀ oòrùn ayé ló tíì rọ òjò tó rinlẹ̀ jù lọ lápá ibí yìí nínú ìtàn.
