English: Under the direction of the branch, the Disaster Relief Committee and the circuit overseer in the region are working with the congregation elders to provide spiritual and practical support to those impacted by this disaster.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì dá Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù sílẹ̀, àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà lágbègbè náà àtàwọn alàgbà ìjọ ń fáwọn tí àjàlù yìí kàn níṣìírí, wọ́n sì ń pèsè ohun tí wọ́n nílò fún wọn.

English: We are confident that Jehovah will be for our brothers a “refuge and strength, a help that is readily found in times of distress.”—Psalm 46:1.
Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà máa jẹ́ ‘ibi ààbò àti okun pẹ̀lú ìrànlọ́wọ́ tó wà lárọ̀ọ́wọ́tó ní àkókò wàhálà’ fáwọn ará wa yìí.—Sáàmù 46:1.

English: On June 28, 2018, for the first time in South Korea’s history, the Constitutional Court declared a section of Korea’s Military Service Act (MSA) unconstitutional, as it does not provide alternative service for conscientious objectors.
Yoruba: Ọjọ́ kejìdínlọ́gbọ̀n oṣù June, ọdún 2018 ni ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ nínú ìtàn ilẹ̀ South Korea tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Tó Ń Rí Sí Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn máa sọ pé apá kan lára Ìlànà Iṣẹ́ Ológun Ilẹ̀ Korea, ìyẹn “Korea’s Military Service Act (MSA)” kò bófin mu, torí pé kò gba àwọn tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológún láyè láti ṣe iṣẹ́ míì.

English: The landmark ruling is the key to reversing a 65-year-old policy of imprisoning conscientious objectors under the MSA.
Yoruba: Ìdájọ́ tó ṣàrà ọ̀tọ̀ yìí ló máa yí ìlànà “MSA” tó ti wà látọdún márùndínláàádọ́rin (65) sẹ́yìn pa dà, ìyẹn ìdájọ́ tó sọ pé kí àwọn tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun máa lọ sẹ́wọ̀n.

English: Since 1953, over 19,300 of our brothers have been sentenced to a combined total of more than 36,700 years in prison.
Yoruba: Láti ọdún 1953, ó ju ẹgbẹ̀rún mọ́kàndínlógún ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta (19,300) àwọn ará wa tí wọ́n ti rán lẹ́wọ̀n ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rìndínlógójì ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún méje (36,700) ọdún lápapọ̀.

English: The Constitutional Court’s decision now opens the door for the Supreme Court of Korea to apply this ruling to specific cases involving conscientious objectors.
Yoruba: Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ Nílẹ̀ Korea á lè lo ìdájọ́ tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ yìí ṣe nínú ọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan àwọn tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.

English: In addition, Korean lawmakers are now obligated to institute alternative service for conscientious objectors by December 31, 2019.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ó ti wá di dandan pé káwọn tó wà nílé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ilẹ̀ Korea dá iṣẹ́ míì téèyàn lè fi sìnlú sílẹ̀, ó pẹ́ tán December 31, 2019.

English: We all rejoice with our brothers in Korea that the foundation has been laid to end decades of injustice.—Proverbs 15:30.
Yoruba: Gbogbo wa la bá àwọn ará wa ní Korea yọ̀ pé ohun tó máa fòpin sí ìwà ìrẹ́jẹ tí wọ́n ti ń hù sí wọn láti ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún ti ṣeé ṣe.​—Òwe 15:30.

English: The Korea branch reports that on November 30, 2018, 57 brothers were freed from prison and reunited with their families.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Korea ti fi tó wa létí pé ní November 30, 2018, mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́ta (57) nínú àwọn ará wa ni ìjọba dá sílẹ̀ lẹ́wọ̀n, tí wọ́n sì pa dà sọ́dọ̀ àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí wọn.

English: The worldwide brotherhood rejoices with this highly-anticipated development and praises Jehovah for granting his favor and blessing.—Numbers 6:24-26.
Yoruba: Gbogbo ẹgbẹ́ ará kárí ayé ló ń yọ̀ torí ohun tá a ti ń retí tipẹ́ ló ṣẹlẹ̀ yìí, a dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà tó ṣojúure sí wa, tó sì bù kún wa.​—Nọ́ńbà 6:​24-26.

English: We pray for the eight brothers remaining in prison, who are expected to be released sometime after they have served 6 months of their 18-month sentences.
Yoruba: À ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́jọ tó kù lẹ́wọ̀n, a retí pé àwọn aláṣẹ máa dá wọn sílẹ̀ tí wọ́n bá ti lo oṣù mẹ́fà nínú ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún kan ààbọ̀ tí ìjọba dá fún wọn.

English: Recently released brothers reunite with their parents (left, right).
Yoruba: Àwọn arákùnrin tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ dá sílẹ̀ pa dà sọ́dọ̀ àwọn òbí wọn (lọ́tùn-ún, lósì).

English: A brother is interviewed by the media outside of the prison (center).
Yoruba: Àwọn oníròyìn ń fọ̀rọ̀ wá arákùnrin kan lẹ́nu wò níwájú ìta ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n náà (àárín).

English: During the Pyeongchang 2018 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games, which were held from February 9-25, 2018, and March 9-18, 2018, brothers and sisters in Korea engaged in a special campaign to offer the many international visitors Bible-based publications free of charge.
Yoruba: Nígbà ìdíje Pyeongchang 2018 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games, tó wáyé ní February 9 sí 25, 2018, àti March 9 sí 18, 2018, àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin ní Korea ṣe àkànṣe ìwàásù láti jẹ́ kí àwọn àlejò lóríṣiríṣi tó wá láti ibi ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ lágbàáyé rí àwọn ìwé tó dá lórí Bíbélì gbà lọ́fẹ̀ẹ́.

English: Over 7,100 brothers and sisters from throughout the country participated in the campaign.
Yoruba: Ó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún méje àti ọgọ́rùn-ún kan (7,100) àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè náà tó kópa nínú àkànṣe ìwàásù yẹn.

English: Many of them came from the cities of Busan, Gwangju, Incheon, Seoul, and Suwon; some even came from as far away as Jeju Island, a popular tourist destination located over 300 miles south of Pyeongchang.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ nínú wọn ló wá láti ìlú Busan, Gwangju, Incheon, Seoul àti Suwon; àwọn kan tiẹ̀ wá láti Erékùṣù Jeju lọ́hùn-ún lọ́hùn-ún, ibi tó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta (300) máìlì sí gúúsù Pyeongchang táwọn èèyàn ti sábà máa ń lọ gbafẹ́.

English: Our brothers set up 152 public witnessing carts in 48 locations, including the Gangneung Olympic Park and the Pyeongchang Olympic Plaza.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará wa gbé àtẹ méjìléláàádọ́jọ (152) síbi méjìdínláàádọ́ta (48) ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀, títí kan ibi ìgbafẹ́ Gangneung Olympic Park àti Pyeongchang Olympic Plaza.

English: They were also permitted to display some of their publications at the entrance to one of the Olympic Village religious centers.
Yoruba: Wọ́n tún gbà wọ́n láyè kí wọ́n pàtẹ díẹ̀ lára àwọn ìwé wọn síbi àbáwọlé ọ̀kan lára àwọn ibi ìjọsìn tó wà ní Olympic Village.

English: Two carts near the north gate of Gangneung Olympic Park.
Yoruba: Wọ́n gbé àtẹ ìwé méjì sí tòsí ẹnubodè àríwá ní Gangneung Olympic Park.

English: Additionally, authorities granted our brothers permission to place carts in the Gangneung Station Square, the final stop of the recently completed high-speed KTX Gyeonggang Line, which transports passengers from Incheon and Seoul to Pyeongchang.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, àwọn aláṣẹ fún àwọn ará wa láyè láti gbé àtẹ ìwé wọn sí Gangneung Station Square tó jẹ́ ibùdókọ̀ tó gbẹ̀yìn fún ọkọ̀ ojú irin ayára-bí-àṣá tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ṣe tán, tí wọ́n ń pè ní KTX Gyeonggang Line, èyí tó máa ń gbérò láti ìlú Incheon àti Seoul lọ sí Pyeongchang.

English: On the opening day of the Olympic Games, over 28,000 people traveled through Gangneung Station.
Yoruba: Lọ́jọ́ tí wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìdíje òlíńpíìkì, ó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà méjìdínlọ́gbọ̀n (28,000) èèyàn tó gba ibùdókọ̀ Gangneung Station kọjá.

English: In order to accommodate the estimated 80,000 foreign visitors, our brothers offered books, brochures, magazines, and tracts in as many as 20 languages including Chinese, English, Kazakh, Korean, and Russian.
Yoruba: Kí àwọn ará wa lè kàn sí àwọn àlejò tó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rin (80,000) tí wọ́n ń retí pé wọ́n á wá síbi ìdíje náà, wọ́n pàtẹ ìwé ńlá, ìwé pẹlẹbẹ, ìwé ìròyìn àti àṣàrò kúkúrú lédè tó tó ogún (20), títí kan èdè Chinese, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Kazakh, Korean àti Russian.

English: Additionally, brothers and sisters fluent in Korean Sign Language used carts featuring sign-language videos to welcome the many deaf persons who came to the Paralympics.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin tó gbọ́ Èdè Àwọn Adití Lédè Korea dáadáa lo àwọn àtẹ tó ní móhùn-máwòrán lára láti máa fi àwọn fídíò èdè adití han ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn adití tó wá síbi Ìdíje Fáwọn Aláàbọ̀ Ara.

English: Over 71,200 pieces of literature were distributed, including more than 22,000 Memorial invitations.
Yoruba: Ìwé tí wọ́n pín lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà mọ́kànléláàádọ́rin àti igba (71,200), títí kan ohun tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún méjìlélógún (22,000) ìwé ìkésíni wá síbi Ìrántí Ikú Kristi.

English: Worldwide, Jehovah’s Witnesses use over 300,000 carts to display their literature in over 35 countries.
Yoruba: Kárí ayé, àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ń lo àtẹ ìwé tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta (300,000) láti pàtẹ ìwé wọn láwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tó lé ní márùndínlógójì (35).

English: In this way, they are able to preach to people wherever they may be found and fully accomplish their ministry.—2 Timothy 4:5.
Yoruba: Èyí ń jẹ́ kí wọ́n lè wàásù fáwọn èèyàn níbikíbi tí wọ́n bá ti lè rí wọn, kí wọ́n sì ṣàṣeparí iṣẹ́ òjíṣẹ́ wọn ní kíkún.​—2 Tímótì 4:5.

English: Thousands of Jehovah’s Witnesses from seven countries joined their brothers and sisters in Sri Lanka for a special convention, the first ever in Sri Lanka.
Yoruba: Ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ló wá láti orílẹ̀-èdè méje ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ láti wá bá àwọn ará wọn lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin ní orílẹ̀-èdè Siri Láńkà ṣe àkànṣe àpéjọ. Ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tírú ẹ̀ máa wáyé nìyẹn ní orílẹ̀-èdè náà.

English: The “Be Courageous”! Special Convention was held in the capital city, Colombo, from July 6 to 8, 2018, at the Sugathadasa National Sports Complex. The peak attendance was 14,121.
Yoruba: Ìlú Colombo tó jẹ́ olú-ìlú Siri Láńkà ni wọ́n ti ṣe àkànṣe àpéjọ náà, tí ẹṣin ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀ jẹ́ “Jẹ́ Onígboyà”! Pápá ìṣeré Sugathadasa National Sports Complex ni wọ́n lò, July 6 sí 8, 2018 ni wọ́n sì ṣe é. Àwọn ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rìnlá ó lé mọ́kànlélọ́gọ́fà (14,121) ló wá sí àpéjọ náà.

English: Highlights included discourses presented by a member of the Governing Body, a record number baptized at one time, and outstanding hospitality shown by the local brothers and sisters to some 3,500 delegates.
Yoruba: Ara àwọn ohun mánigbàgbé tó wáyé níbi àpéjọ náà ni àwọn àsọyé tí ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí sọ, àwọn tó ṣèrìbọmi ní àpéjọ yìí ló tíì pọ̀ jù nínú gbogbo àpéjọ tó ti wáyé ní Siri Láńkà, àwọn ará sì fìfẹ́ gba àwọn bí ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́ta ààbọ̀ (3,500) lálejò lọ́nà tó ta yọ.

English: Preparations began in September 2017 when congregations in Sri Lanka were informed that a special convention would be held the following year.
Yoruba: September 2017 ni wọ́n fi tó àwọn ará ní Siri Láńkà létí pé àkànṣe àpéjọ kan máa wáyé lọ́dún tó tẹ̀ lé e, àtìgbà yẹn ni ètò sì ti bẹ̀rẹ̀.

English: In addition to all the arrangements that were needed to host the event, the stadium was in need of significant repair and cleaning.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ sí gbogbo ètò tí wọ́n ṣe láti gbàlejò àwọn tó máa wá sí àpéjọ náà, pápá ìṣeré tí wọ́n fẹ́ lò nílò àtúnṣe tó pọ̀.

English: This effort included painting, removing garbage, fixing broken chairs, and repairing holes in the road.
Yoruba: Ó máa gba pé kí wọ́n kùn ún, kí wọ́n kó ìdọ̀tí ibẹ̀, kí wọ́n tún àwọn àga tó ti bà jẹ́ ṣe, kí wọ́n sì dí àwọn ihò ojú ọ̀nà.

English: Three weeks before the convention began, hundreds of Witnesses arrived to assist in the effort.
Yoruba: Nígbà tí àpéjọ náà ku ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́ta, ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ló wá kọ́wọ́ ti iṣẹ́ àtúnṣe náà.

English: One security officer remarked that it would have taken the maintenance staff up to four years to accomplish what the brothers were able to do in such a short time.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ṣọ́ kan tiẹ̀ sọ pé ó máa gba àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ pápá ìṣeré náà ní ọdún mẹ́rin láti ṣe ohun táwọn ará wa ṣe láàárín àkókò kúkúrú yẹn.

English: The spiritual program was complemented by a variety of tours and activities highlighting the Sri Lankan culture.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ sí àwọn àsọyé Bíbélì tí wọ́n sọ ní àpéjọ náà, wọ́n mú àwọn àlejò lọ wo oríṣiríṣi ibi, wọ́n sì ṣe àwọn nǹkan lóríṣiríṣi tó jẹ mọ́ àṣà ìbílẹ̀ Siri Láńkà.

English: An evening performance of traditional dancing and singing was a memorable aspect of the program, which also included a group of young Witnesses singing Kingdom songs.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará ṣe ohun kan tó jẹ́ mánigbàgbé nírọ̀lẹ́ ọjọ́ kan, wọ́n jó ijó ìbílẹ̀, wọ́n sì kọrin ìbílẹ̀. Àwọn ọ̀dọ́ kan tó jẹ́ Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà náà kọ àwọn orin Ìjọba Ọlọ́run.

English: Ashley Ferdinands, a representative at the branch office in Sri Lanka, said: “This special convention was a true gift to the brothers and sisters in our country and it was a privilege to host so many delegates.
Yoruba: Ashley Ferdinands tó jẹ́ aṣojú ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tó wà ní Siri Láńkà sọ pé: “Ohun ńlá ni ètò Ọlọ́run ṣe fáwọn ará wa lórílẹ̀-èdè yìí pẹ̀lú bí wọ́n ṣe ṣètò pé ká ṣe àkànṣe àpéjọ, àǹfààní ló sì jẹ́ láti gba àwọn ará wa tó pọ̀ lálejò.

English: We are very appreciative for the help of the many volunteers who made this convention a success.
Yoruba: A mọyì ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti ṣèrànwọ́ kí nǹkan lè lọ dáadáa ní àpéjọ yìí.

English: Of course, we give all praise to our heavenly Father who is the source of all good gifts and presents.”—James 1:17.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ Baba wa ọ̀run ni gbogbo ọpẹ́ yẹ, torí àtọ̀dọ̀ ẹ̀ ni gbogbo ẹ̀bùn rere ti ń wá.”—Jémíìsì 1:17.

English: On July 5, 2019, the revised edition of the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures in Chinese was released at a regional convention in Taoyuan City, Taiwan.
Yoruba: Ní July 5, 2019, a mú Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a tún ṣe jáde lédè Chinese ní àpéjọ agbègbè kan tá a ṣe ní ìlú Taoyuan lórílẹ̀-èdè Taiwan.

English: Brother Kenneth Cook, a member of the Governing Body, delivered the release talk at the National Taiwan Sport University Stadium.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Kenneth Cook tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí ló mú Bíbélì náà jáde nígbà tó ń sọ àsọyé kan nínú Gbọ̀ngàn National Taiwan Sport University.

English: A total of 12,610 people, including viewers tied in at four other conventions, attended this momentous occasion.
Yoruba: Àwọn ẹgbẹ̀rún-ún méjìlá, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́fà àti mẹ́wàá (12,610) ló gbádùn ètò yìí. Àwọn kan gbádùn ẹ̀ nínú gbọ̀ngàn yẹn, wọ́n sì ta àtagbà ẹ̀ sáwọn àpéjọ agbègbè mẹ́rin míì.

English: The Chinese New World Translation of the Christian Greek Scriptures was first published in 1995 in two editions, one using the traditional script common in Hong Kong and Taiwan, the other using simplified script common in China, Malaysia, and Singapore.
Yoruba: Ọdún 1995 ni wọ́n kọ́kọ́ tẹ Ìwé Mímọ́ Kristẹni Lédè Gíríìkì ní Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun jáde lédè Chinese, wọ́n sì ṣe é lọ́nà méjì. Wọ́n lo ọ̀nà ìkọ̀wé tó wọ́pọ̀ ní Hong Kong àti Taiwan mu nínú tí àkọ́kọ́, wọ́n sì lo ọ̀nà ìkọ̀wé tá a mú kó túbọ̀ rọrùn tó wọ́pọ̀ ní Ṣáínà, Màléṣíà àti Singapore fún èkejì.

English: The complete New World Translation in Chinese was released in 2001, again in two editions, one in traditional and the other in simplified.
Yoruba: Lọ́dún 2001, wọ́n mú odindi Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun jáde. Ẹ̀dà méjì ni wọ́n tún fi ṣe, àkọ́kọ́ jẹ́ ọ̀nà ìkọ̀wé tó jẹ́ ti ìbílẹ̀, ìkejì sì jẹ́ ọ̀nà ìkọ̀wé tá a mú kó túbọ̀ rọrùn láti lóye.

English: A third edition, containing simplified Chinese characters along with Pinyin, text rendered in the Roman alphabet, was published in 2004.
Yoruba: Nígbà tó dọdún 2004, a tẹ ẹ̀dà kẹta jáde. Ọ̀nà ìkọ̀wé tá a mú kó túbọ̀ rọrùn láti lóye ni wọ́n lò nínú ẹ̀dà yìí, yàtọ̀ síyẹn, wọ́n tún lo ọ̀nà ìkọ̀wé kan tá à ń pè ní Pinyin kí wọ́n lè fi álífábẹ́ẹ̀tì èdè Róòmù kọ ọ̀rọ̀ kọ̀ọ̀kan.

English: The revised New World Translation was also released in three editions.
Yoruba: Wọ́n wá mú Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a tún ṣe jáde ní ẹ̀dà mẹ́ta ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.

English: Traditional and simplified Chinese are available both in printed and digital format, while the edition including Pinyin is available on Watchtower ONLINE LIBRARY™.
Yoruba: Ti èdè ìbílẹ̀ àti èdè tá a mú kó túbọ̀ rọrùn láti lóye ni wọ́n tẹ̀ sínú ìwé àti sórí ẹ̀rọ, nígbà tí ẹ̀dà Pinyin wà lórí ÀKÁ ÌWÉ ORÍ ÍŃTÁNẸ́Ẹ̀TÌ™ (ti Watchtower).

English: Chinese Mandarin is the largest primary language in the world and has a total of over 1.1 billion speakers.
Yoruba: Ní gbogbo ayé, àwọn èèyàn tó lé ní bílíọ̀nù kan ló ń sọ èdè Chinese Mandarin. Òun sì ni èdè ìbílẹ̀ táwọn èèyàn ń sọ jù lọ láyé.

English: In addition to those who speak Mandarin, Chinese characters are read by millions who speak other dialects.
Yoruba: Ní àfikún sí àwọn tó ń sọ èdè Mandarin, ọ̀pọ̀ mílíọ̀nù èèyàn ló wà tó ń sọ àwọn èdè ìbílẹ̀ Chinese míì, wọ́n sì lè ka àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ tá a kọ lọ́nà ìkọ̀wé Chinese.

English: Our brothers and sisters working in this vast field can now use the revised New World Translation to help more people come to know Jehovah and gain accurate knowledge of his Word.—1 Timothy 2:4.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, àwọn ará wa tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ ìwàásù tó gbòòrò yìí lè fi Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a tún ṣe ran ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn láti mọ Jèhófà, kí wọ́n sì ní ìmọ̀ tó péye nípa Ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀.​—1 Tímótì 2:4.

English: During the night of Tuesday, February 6, a magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck near the east coast of Taiwan.
Yoruba: Ní alẹ́ Tuesday, February 6, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó lágbára gan-an wáyé ní etíkun tó wà ní ìlà oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè Taiwan.

English: Media reports indicate that at least 6 people have been confirmed dead and over 250 were injured.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn fi hàn pé àwọn mẹ́fà ló kú sí inú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí, àwọn tó ju àádọ́talénígba [250] ló sì fara pa yánnayànna.

English: An additional 76 people are still missing.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, àwọn mẹ́rìndínlọ́gọ́rin [76] míì ni wọ́n ṣì ń wá.

English: No publishers were killed or injured in the earthquake.
Yoruba: Kò sí arákùnrin tàbí arábìnrin wa kankan tó kú sínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà, wọn ò sì fara pa. Àmọ́, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ yẹn ba ilé kan tí Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba àti ọ́fíìsì àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè Taiwanese jẹ́.

English: However, a building that houses both the Amis (an indigenous Taiwanese language) remote translation office and a Kingdom Hall located in Hualien, one of the worst-hit areas, was damaged.
Yoruba: Ilé náà wà ní ìlú Hualien, ibẹ̀ wà lára àwọn ibi tí ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ náà ti ṣọṣẹ́ jù.

English: Additionally, an apartment where some members of the translation team live was severely damaged, requiring them to evacuate.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ilé tí àwọn kan lára àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè ń gbé bà jẹ́ gan-an, torí náà wọ́n ní láti kúrò ní ilé yẹn.

English: Local brothers immediately arranged for temporary accommodations for those affected, and the Taiwan branch is helping to provide other necessities.
Yoruba: Ẹsẹ̀kẹsẹ̀ ni àwọn ará tó wà ní ìtòsí bá wọn ṣètò ibi tí wọ́n lè forí pamọ́ sí fúngbà díẹ̀, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tó wà ní Taiwan náà ń pèsè àwọn nǹkan míì tí wọ́n nílò fún wọn.

English: We pray that our affected brothers and sisters will have peace of mind during this distressing time, and that the brothers entrusted with caring for them will prove to “be like a hiding place from the wind.”—Isaiah 32:2.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé, kí Ọlọ́run fún àwọn ará wa tí àjálù náà dé bá ní ìbàlẹ̀ ọkàn ní àsìkò tí nǹkan dojú rú yìí, kí àwọn tí wọ́n sì yàn láti bójú tó wọn dà “bí ibi ìfarapamọ́sí kúrò lọ́wọ́ ẹ̀fúùfù.”—Aísáyà 32:2.

English: On April 2, 2020, a Tajik military court in the capital city of Dushanbe sentenced Brother Jovidon Bobojonov to two years in prison for his conscientious objection to military service.
Yoruba: Ní April 2, 2020, ilé ẹjọ́ àwọn ológun tàwọn ará Tajik, tó wà ní ìlú Dushanbe tó jẹ́ olú ìlú orílẹ̀-èdè Tajikistan fi Arákùnrin Jovidon Bobojonov sẹ́wọ̀n ọdún méjì tórí pé ẹ̀rí ọkàn rẹ̀ kò gbà á láyè láti wọṣẹ́ ológun.

English: He will appeal his conviction.
Yoruba: Ó máa pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn.

English: On September 10, 2019, the Khujand City Court in Tajikistan sentenced Brother Shamil Khakimov to seven and a half years in prison for merely sharing his religious beliefs with others.
Yoruba: Ní September 10, 2019, ilé ẹjọ́ ìlú Khujand ní Tajikistan fi Arákùnrin Shamil Khakimov sí ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún méje àtààbọ̀ kìkì nítorí pé ó ń sọ ohun tó gbà gbọ́ fún àwọn míì.

English: Jehovah’s Witnesses are appealing this case.
Yoruba: Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ti pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn lórí ọ̀rọ̀ yìí.

English: Brother Khakimov’s ordeal began in early 2019.
Yoruba: Ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọdún 2019 ni wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í fojú Arákùnrin Khakimov rí màbo.

English: On February 26, authorities arrested 68-year-old Shamil, charging him with “inciting religious hatred.” Afterward, the court placed him in pretrial detention, which eventually was extended for six months.
Yoruba: Ní February 26, 2019, àwọn aláṣẹ mú Shamil, ẹni ọdún méjìdínláàádọ́rin (68), wọ́n sì fẹ̀sùn kàn án pé ó ń “mú kí àwọn èèyàn kórìíra ẹ̀sìn míì.” Ni ilé ẹjọ́ bá fi sí àtìmọ́lé láì tíì gbọ́ ẹjọ́ rẹ̀, oṣù mẹ́fà ló lò níbẹ̀.

English: In addition to dealing with this unjust prison term, Brother Khakimov suffers from high blood pressure and is still recovering from a medical procedure.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ sí wàhálà ti pé wọ́n sọ Arákùnrin Khakimov sẹ́wọ̀n lọ́nà àìtọ́, àìsàn ẹ̀jẹ̀ ríru ń bá a fínra, èyí tó ṣì ń gba ìtọ́jú rẹ̀ lọ́wọ́.

English: This is the first time one of Jehovah’s Witnesses has been imprisoned in Tajikistan since 2017, when 18-year-old Daniil Islamov was given a six-month prison sentence for refusing to wear a military uniform.
Yoruba: Èyí ni ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tí wọ́n máa ju ọ̀kan lára àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sẹ́wọ̀n ní Tajikistan látọdun 2017. Nígbà yẹn wọ́n ju Danil Islamov tó jẹ́ ẹni ọdún méjìdínlógún (18) sí ẹ̀wọ̀n oṣù mẹ́fà torí pé ó kọ̀ láti wọ aṣọ ológun.

English: Tajikistan is now one of five countries that have imprisoned at least one of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: Tajikistan náà ti wà lára àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè márùn-ún tó ti ju ó kéré tán, ọ̀kan lára àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sẹ́wọ̀n.

English: The other four are Eritrea, Russia, Singapore, and Turkmenistan.
Yoruba: Àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè mẹ́rin tó kù ni Eritrea, Rọ́ṣíà, Singapore àti Turkmenistan.

English: We pray that Jehovah will continue to supply Brother Khakimov everything that he needs to endure this trial.—Romans 15:5.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà máa báa lọ láti fún Arákùnrin Khakimov ní gbogbo ohun tó nílò láti fara da àdańwò yìí.​—Róòmù 15:5.

English: Jehovah’s Witnesses released the New World Translation of the Christian Greek Scriptures in the Laotian language at a regional convention held in Nong Khai, Thailand, on August 16, 2019.
Yoruba: Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà mú Ìwé Mímọ́ Kristian Lédè Griki ní Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Titun jáde lédè Laotian níbi àpéjọ agbègbè tí a ṣe ní Nong Khai, lórílẹ̀-èdè Thailand, ní August 16, 2019.

English: Brother Plakorn Pestanyee, a member of the Thailand Branch Committee, released the Bible on the first day of the convention.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Plakorn Pestanyee tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka orílẹ̀-èdè Thailand, ló mú Bíbélì náà jáde lọ́jọ́ àkọ́kọ́ àpéjọ náà.

English: The three-person translation team worked for one and a half years on the project.
Yoruba: Ìgbìmọ̀ ẹlẹ́ni-mẹ́ta tó túmọ̀ Bíbélì náà lo ọdún kan ààbọ̀ lórí iṣẹ́ náà.

English: As one of the translators explains: “The result is a translation that expresses the message of the Bible in the common vernacular of Laotian speakers, and yet accurately conveys the meaning of the original language, so that students of the Bible can understand ‘the deep things of God.’”—Job 11:7.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè náà sọ pé: “Ní báyìí, a ti ní ìtumọ̀ Bíbélì kan tó ṣàlàyé àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ inú Bíbélì lọ́nà tí àwọn tó ń sọ èdè Laotian gbà ń sọ̀rọ̀, síbẹ̀ ó gbé ìtumọ̀ àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ jáde lọ́nà tó pé pérépéré, kí àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì lè lóye ‘àwọn ohun ìjìnlẹ̀ Ọlọ́run.’ ”​—Jóòbù 11:7.

English: The translation features useful study tools, such as an index that assists readers to easily locate specific verses and a glossary that explains the meaning of Bible expressions.
Yoruba: Bíbélì tuntun yìí ní àwọn ohun èlò ìwádìí bí atọ́ka, tó máa ran àwọn tó ń kà á lọ́wọ́ láti tètè rí àwọn ẹsẹ Bíbélì àti àlàyé ọ̀rọ̀ tó ń ṣàlàyé àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ Bíbélì.

English: Another translator who assisted with the project states: “When we use this translation in our teaching, Bible students will understand important points much more easily than before, and it will reach their heart, helping them to cultivate love for Jehovah as a person.” We are confident the New World Translation of the Christian Greek Scriptures will help the Laotian-speaking brothers and sisters continue to be “fully competent, completely equipped for every good work.”—2 Timothy 3:16, 17.
Yoruba: Atúmọ̀ èdè míì tóun náà ṣe nínú iṣẹ́ ìtumọ̀ náà sọ pé: “Tá a bá fi Bíbélì yìí kọ́ àwọn èèyàn lẹ́kọ̀ọ́, àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì á lóye àwọn koko pàtàkì lọ́nà tó rọrùn ju ti tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ, á sì wọ̀ wọ́n lọ́kàn, èyí á sì jẹ́ kí wọ́n ní ìbátan tímọ́tímọ́ pẹ̀lú Jèhófà.” Ó dá wa lójú pé Ìwé Mímọ́ Kristian Lédè Griki ní Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Titun yìí á ran àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa tó ń sọ èdè Lao lọ́wọ́ láti kí wọ́n lè “kúnjú ìwọ̀n dáadáa, kí wọ́n sì gbára dì pátápátá fún gbogbo iṣẹ́ rere.”​—2 Tímótì 3:​16, 17.

English: A court in Turkmenistan convicted 26-year-old Brother Serdar Dovletov and sentenced him to three years in prison on November 12, 2019.
Yoruba: Ní November 12, 2019, Ilé ẹjọ́ kan ní orílẹ̀-èdè Turkmenistan dá Arákùnrin Serdar Dovletov lẹ́bi, ó sì fi sẹ́wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́ta. Ẹni ọdún mẹ́rìndínlọ́gbọ̀n (26) ni Arákùnrin Dovletov.

English: Brother Dovletov is one of ten brothers in the country who has been sentenced to prison for conscientious objection.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Dovletov wà lára àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́wàá ní orílẹ̀-èdè náà tí wọ́n fi sẹ́wọ̀n nítorí pé ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò gbà wọ́n láyè láti ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.

English: Seven have been convicted in 2019 and three were convicted in 2018.
Yoruba: Àwọn méje ni wọ́n fi sẹ́wọ̀n ní 2019, wọ́n ti fi àwọn mẹ́ta yòókù sẹ́wọ̀n ní 2018.

English: Their prison terms range from one to four years.
Yoruba: Àkókò tí wọ́n ní kí wọ́n lò lẹ́wọ̀n jẹ́ láàárín ọdún kan sí mẹ́rin.

English: Brother Dovletov is from the city of Baýramaly, Mary Region, in southeastern Turkmenistan.
Yoruba: Ìlú Baýramaly ni Arákùnrin Dovletov ti wá, ní agbègbè Mary tó wà ní apá gúúsù ìlà oòrùn Turkmenistan.

English: His wife, Surya, and mother, Sonya, are also Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ni Surya ìyàwó ẹ̀ àti Sonya màmá rẹ̀.

English: Brother Dovletov’s trial began on November 11, 2019.
Yoruba: November 11, 2019 ni ìgbẹ́jọ́ Arákùnrin Dovletov bẹ̀rẹ̀.

English: Brother Dovletov told the court that he conscientiously objects to military service based on his personal religious beliefs.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Dovletov sọ fún ilé ẹjọ́ náà pé ìsìn òun ló mú kí ẹ̀rí ọkàn òun kọ̀ láti ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.

English: Additionally, three doctors testified under oath that Brother Dovletov has a chronic duodenal ulcer that warrants an exemption from military service.
Yoruba: Ní àfikún, àwọn dókítà mẹ́ta ló jẹ́rìí pé Arákùnrin Dovletov ní ọgbẹ́ inú ọlọ́jọ́ pípẹ́, ìyẹn náà sì wà lára ìdí tó fi yẹ kí wọ́n yọ̀ǹda ẹ̀ láti má ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.

English: Despite the facts presented, the judge ruled Brother Dovletov guilty of “fraudulently” evading the draft and had him placed in a local detention center.
Yoruba: Láìka àwọn ẹ̀rí yìí sí, adájọ́ náà sọ pé Arákùnrin Dovletov jẹ̀bi fífi “ọgbọ́n jìbìtì” sá fún iṣẹ́ ológun, ó sì sọ pé kí wọ́n fi sí àhámọ́.

English: It is expected that soon he will join the other nine brothers imprisoned in the harsh Seydi labor camp in the desert of Lebap Region.
Yoruba: Láìpẹ́, ó máa dara pọ̀ mọ́ àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́sàn-an tí wọ́n fi sẹ́wọ̀n ní àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́ tó wà nílùú Seydi nínú aṣálẹ̀ kan lágbègbè Lebap.

English: Brother Dovletov will appeal the conviction.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Dovletov máa pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn lórí ìdájọ́ náà.

English: As our brothers in Turkmenistan continue to face injustice, we pray for them with full faith in the inspired promise that Jehovah will support their courageous stand of integrity.—Psalm 37:18, 24.
Yoruba: Bí àwọn arákùnrin wa ní Turkmenistan ṣe ń fara da ìwà ìrẹ́jẹ lórílẹ̀-èdè wọn, à ń gbàdúrà fún wọn pẹ̀lú ìgbàgbọ́ kíkún nínú ìlérí Jèhófà pé á tì wọ́n lẹ́yìn bí wọ́n ṣe ń fi ìgboyà di ìṣòtítọ́ wọn mú.​—Sáàmù 37:18, 24.

English: On April 19, 2019, for the first time in recent years, our brothers throughout the entirety of Uzbekistan were able to commemorate the Memorial of Christ’s death publicly.
Yoruba: Látọdún bíi mélòó kan báyìí, April 19, 2019 nìgbà àkọ́kọ́ táwọn ará wa káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè Uzbekistan ṣe Ìrántí Ikú Kristi tí ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn sì láǹfààní láti wá síbẹ̀.

English: Jehovah’s Witnesses in Uzbekistan are officially registered only in Chirchik, a city near Tashkent.
Yoruba: Ìlú Chirchik tó wà nítòsí ìlú Tashkent nìkan ló forúkọ ẹ̀sìn àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sílẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin ní gbogbo orílẹ̀-èdè Uzbekistan.

English: In previous years, our brothers living outside of Chirchik would commemorate the Memorial in secret so as to avoid potential police interference.
Yoruba: Láwọn ọdún tó kọjá, ńṣe làwọn ará wa tí kò sí ní ìlú Chirchik máa ń ṣe Ìrántí Ikú Kristi ní bòókẹ́lẹ́ káwọn ọlọ́pàá má bàa dà wọ́n láàmú.

English: This year, the brothers informed the police of the Memorial observance and invited them to attend.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ lọ́dún yìí, àwọn ará sọ fáwọn Ọlọ́pàá pé àwọn fẹ́ ṣe Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, wọ́n sì pè wọ́n pé kí wọ́n wá.

English: The police officers responded amicably and even took measures to ensure the safety of attendees.
Yoruba: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá náà fèsì tó dáa, wọ́n sì gbé ìgbésẹ̀ láti pèsè ààbò tó yẹ fáwọn tó wá síbi Ìrántí Ìkú Kristi.

English: In some areas, police officers attended the program.
Yoruba: Àní láwọn ibì kan, àwọn ọlọ́pàá wà lára àwọn tó wá gbọ́ àsọyé.

English: Brother Mark Sanderson of the Governing Body delivered the Memorial discourse in a Kingdom Hall complex in Chirchik, as shown in the lead photograph.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Mark Sanderson tó jẹ́ ara Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí ló sọ àsọyé Ìrántí Ikú Kristi ní Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tó wà ní ìlú Chirchik, bẹ́ ẹ ṣe rí i nínú àwòrán tó wà lókè yìí.

English: The program was translated into Russian.
Yoruba: Wọ́n túmọ̀ àsọyé náà sí èdè Russian.

English: The total attendance was 781.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó wá jẹ́ ogọ́rùn-ún méje àti mọ́kànlélọ́gọ́rin (781).

English: Later in the evening, two more Memorial observances were held at the same complex.
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn ìpàdé àkọ́kọ́ yìí, wọ́n ṣe ìpàdé méjì míì nínú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba náà.

English: During the visit, Brother Sanderson, accompanied by Paul Gillies from world headquarters and two brothers from Central Asia, met with senior officials from the Ministry of Justice and the National Centre for Human Rights.
Yoruba: Lásìkò ìbẹ̀wò yìí, Arákùnrin Sanderson pẹ̀lú Arákùnrin Paul Gillies láti oríléeṣẹ́ wa àtàwọn arákùnrin méjì láti Central Asia ṣèpàdé pẹ̀lú àwọn ọ̀gá ní Ilé Iṣẹ́ Ètò Ìdájọ́ àti ní Ọ́fíìsì Àwọn Tó Ń Bójú Tó Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn.

English: During the meetings, our brothers were allowed to present accurate information about our faith and organization.
Yoruba: Nínú ìpàdé náà, wọ́n ní kí àwọn ará wa ṣàlàyé àwọn ohun tá a gbà gbọ́ àti ètò wa.

English: It is hoped that well-informed officials will support registration in communities beyond Chirchik, which will help the brothers acquire appropriate facilities for worship.
Yoruba: A retí pé ohun táwọn aláṣẹ náà ti mọ̀ nípa wa máa mú kí wọ́n ṣèrànwọ́ láti forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wa sílẹ̀ láwọn agbègbè tó kù lẹ́yìn ìlú Chirchik, èyí sì máa mú kó rọrùn fáwọn ará láti lè ní àwọn ibi tí wọ́n á ti máa jọ́sìn.

English: Brother Mark Sanderson with fellow members of the delegation outside the Ministry of Justice of the Republic of Uzbekistan The public Memorial observance and the respectful meetings with officials are the latest positive developments in Uzbekistan.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Mark Sanderson pẹ̀lú àwọn ará tí wọ́n rán lọ rèé ní ìta Ilé Iṣẹ́ Ètò Ìdájọ́ Orílẹ̀-èdè Uzbekistan Ìrántí Ikú Kristi tí ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn wá àti ìpàdé tá a ṣe pẹ̀lú àwọn aláṣẹ yìí jẹ́ ohun tuntun tó wáyé ní Uzbekistan.

English: During the past six months, there have been no raids, fines, or arrests of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: Láti oṣù mẹ́fà báyìí, kò sí Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kankan tí wọ́n ya wọlé rẹ̀ tàbí tí wọ́n ní kó sanwó ìtanràn tàbí táwọn ọlọ́pàá mú.

English: And, approximately one year ago, on May 14, 2018, Mr. Javlon Vakhabov, the ambassador of Uzbekistan to the United States, publicly stated that parliament would work to change legislation to make it easier for Jehovah’s Witnesses to acquire registration.
Yoruba: Ní nǹkan bí ọdún kan sẹ́yìn, ní May 14, 2018, Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Javlon Vakhabov tó jẹ́ aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Uzbekistan lọ́dọ̀ ìjọba Amẹ́ríkà sọ ní lójú ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn pé àwọn aṣòfin máa rí sí i pé wọ́n ṣe àwọn ìyípadà tó yẹ kó lè rọrùn fáwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà láti forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wọn sílẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin.

English: We look to Jehovah to bless the efforts of our brothers in Uzbekistan as they continue to lead “a calm and quiet life with complete godly devotion and seriousness.”—1 Timothy 2:2.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ní pé kí Jèhófà bù kún ìsapá àwọn ará wa ní Uzbekistan bí wọ́n ṣe ń ‘gbé ìgbé ayé tó pa rọ́rọ́ nìṣó pẹ̀lú ìbàlẹ̀ ọkàn, tí wọ́n sì ń fi gbogbo ọkàn wọn sin Ọlọ́run.”—1 Tímótì 2:2.

English: In a six-month period beginning in March 2018, the Supreme Court of Uzbekistan and the Administrative Court of Karakalpakstan, an autonomous republic in Uzbekistan, decided in favor of Jehovah’s Witnesses in cases related to our freedom of worship.
Yoruba: Láàárín oṣù mẹ́fà, bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti March 2018, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ní Uzbekistan àti Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ìjọba Karakalpakstan, agbègbè kan tó ní ìjọba tiẹ̀ lọ́tọ̀ ní Uzbekistan, sọ nínú àwọn ẹjọ́ kan tí wọ́n dá pé àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà lómìnira lábẹ́ òfin láti jọ́sìn.

English: The Supreme Court reversed four lower court rulings against our brothers, and the Administrative Court reversed a fifth decision.
Yoruba: Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ yí ìdájọ́ mẹ́rin táwọn ilé ẹjọ́ kan ti ṣe fáwọn ará wa tẹ́lẹ̀ pa dà, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ìjọba sì tún yí ẹjọ́ kan pa dà láfikún sí àwọn ẹjọ́ mẹ́rin náà.

English: Timur Satdanov, one of our brothers exonerated by a Supreme Court victory in Uzbekistan.
Yoruba: Timur Satdanov, ọ̀kan lára àwọn ará wa tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ dá láre ní Uzbekistan.

English: Several of the cases involving our brothers resulted from police investigations in which authorities seized Bible-based literature, as well as electronic devices that contained copies of the Bible.
Yoruba: Ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ ni pé àwọn aláṣẹ gba àwọn ìwé tó dá lórí Bíbélì àtàwọn ẹ̀rọ alágbèéká tí Bíbélì wà nínú wọn lọ́wọ́ àwọn èèyàn, àwọn ọlọ́pàá ṣèwádìí nípa wọn, wọ́n sì gbé ọ̀rọ̀ náà lọ sí ilé ẹjọ́.

English: As a result, lower courts found the brothers guilty and imposed fines on the basis of a law that can be interpreted as prohibiting the distribution of religious material.
Yoruba: Àwọn ilé ẹjọ́ tó kọ́kọ́ gbọ́ ẹjọ́ náà dá àwọn ará wa lẹ́bi, wọ́n sì bu owó ìtanràn lé wọn, torí wọ́n gbà pé àwọn ará náà ti rú òfin táwọn kan sọ pé ó kà á léèwọ̀ fún ẹnikẹ́ni láti máa pín ìwé ẹ̀sìn kiri.

English: Thankfully, these recent high court decisions exonerate our brothers from these guilty verdicts and exempt them from the fines.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ a dúpẹ́ pé, ilé ẹjọ́ gíga dá àwọn ará wa láre lẹ́nu àìpẹ́ yìí, wọn ò sì ní sanwó ìtanràn náà mọ́.

English: Witnesses worldwide rejoice at these developments, grateful to the authorities and, above all, to Jehovah for his guidance and support ‘in the defending and legally establishing of his good news.’—Philippians 1:7.
Yoruba: Inú àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kárí ayé dùn sí ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ yìí, a sì dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn aláṣẹ, àmọ́ a fi ọpẹ́ tó ga jù fún Jèhófà pé ó tọ́ wa sọ́nà, ó sì tì wá lẹ́yìn “bí a ṣe ń gbèjà ìhìn rere, tí a sì ń fìdí rẹ̀ múlẹ̀ lọ́nà òfin.’—Fílípì 1:7.

English: Dates: November 22-24, 2019
Yoruba: Ọjọ́ Tí A Ṣe É: November 22 sí 24, 2019

English: Location: Marvel Stadium in Melbourne, Australia
Yoruba: Ibi Tí A Ti Ṣe É: Pápá Ìṣeré Marvel ní Melbourne, Ọsirélíà

English: Program Languages: Australian Sign Language, Chinese Cantonese, Chinese Mandarin, English, Korean, Spanish, Tagalog, Vietnamese
Yoruba: Èdè Tí A Lò fún Ìtòlẹ́sẹẹsẹ: Èdè Àwọn Adití Lọ́nà ti Ọsirélíà, Chinese Cantonese, Chinese Mandarin, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Korean, Sípáníìṣì, Tagalog, Vietnamese

English: Peak Attendance: 46,582 Total
Yoruba: Iye Àwọn Tó Pésẹ̀: Ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rìndínláàádọ́ta ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún àti méjìlélọ́gọ́rin (46,582)

English: Number Baptized: 407
Yoruba: Iye Àwọn Tó Ṣèrìbọmi: Ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin àti méje (407)

English: Number of International Delegates: 6,083
Yoruba: Iye Àwọn Aṣojú Tó Wá Láti Orílẹ̀-Èdè Míì: Ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́fà àti mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́rin (6,083)

English: Invited Branches: Argentina, Canada, Hong Kong, India, Italy, Japan, Korea, Philippines, Solomon Islands, South Africa, Taiwan, United States
Yoruba: Àwọn Ẹ̀ka Tí Aṣojú Ti Wá: Ajẹntínà, Kánádà, Hong Kong, Íńdíà, Ítálì, Japan, Kòríà, Philippines, Solomon Islands, South Africa, Taiwan, Amẹ́ríkà

English: Local Experiences: The manager of Ballarat Wildlife Park stated: “I can honestly say that in my 15 years working at the Ballarat Wildlife Park your group has by far been the most enjoyable and well-run group I have worked with.
Yoruba: Ìrírí: Ọ̀gá àgbà Ọgbà Ẹranko Ballarat sọ pé: “Gbogbo ẹnu ni mo fi ń sọ pé láti bí ọdún mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún (15) tí mo ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní Ọgbà Ẹranko Ballarat, àwùjọ yín ni mo tíì gbádùn jù, òun ló sì wà létòlétò jù lọ nínú àwùjọ tí mo ti ń bá ṣiṣẹ́.

English: A huge thanks to you and all of your wonderful guides.” A reservations manager commented about the 340 delegates who stayed at his hotel: “Everyone collaborates to solve problems.
Yoruba: Mo dúpẹ́ púpọ̀ lọ́wọ́ yín àti lọ́wọ́ àwọn tó mú àwọn èèyàn káàkiri.” Ọ̀gá àgbà ilé ìtura tí àwọn àlejò bí ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta ó lé ogójì (340) dé sí sọ pé: “Gbogbo wọn máa ń kóra jọ láti yanjú ìṣòro.

English: It looks to me like it is just a giant family and everyone is talking to and supporting each other.
Yoruba: Ṣe ni wọ́n dà bí ìdílé kan lójú mi tí gbogbo wọn jọ ń sọ̀rọ̀, tí wọ́n sì ń ti ara wọn lẹ́yìn.

English: Seriously, it has been a joy to deal with everyone.
Yoruba: Ká sòótọ́, inú mi dùn gan-an pé mo wà pẹ̀lú wọn.

English: I have been working in the hospitality industry for 11 years, and this is the only group that I have found like this.” As a result of his interactions with Jehovah’s Witnesses, the manager attended the convention on Saturday.
Yoruba: Ọdún kọkànlá (11) tí mo ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ ìgbàlejò rèé, síbẹ̀ àwùjọ wọn ló jọ mí lójú jù.” Torí ohun tí ọ̀gá náà rí, ó lọ sí àpéjọ tá a ṣe lọ́jọ́ Saturday pẹ̀lú àwọn ará..

English: Heavy rainfall has caused severe flooding in northeast Australia.
Yoruba: Àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá òjò ti mú kí alagbalúgbú omi ya bo apá àríwá-gúúsù orílẹ̀-èdè Ọsirélíà.

English: The floodwaters have displaced thousands of residents and caused major property damage and power outages.
Yoruba: Omíyalé yìí lé ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún èèyàn nílé, ọ̀pọ̀ nǹkan ló sì bà jẹ́ títí kan iná ìjọba.

English: The Australasia branch reports that, as a result of the flooding, 58 publishers from three congregations needed to relocate to the homes of family members or other Witnesses.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Ọsirélíà ròyìn pé akéde méjìdínlọ́gọ́ta (58) láti ìjọ mẹ́ta ni omíyalé yìí mú kí wọ́n lọ máa gbé lọ́dọ̀ àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí wọn tàbí àwọn ará.

English: A total of ten homes of our brothers were flooded, two of which were destroyed.
Yoruba: Ilé mẹ́wàá tó jẹ́ tàwọn ará wa ni àgbàrá ya wọ̀, ó sì ba méjì lára wọn jẹ́ pátápátá.

English: The branch has established a Disaster Relief Committee, and the circuit overseer and local elders are shepherding the affected publishers.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ti yan Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù, alábòójútó àyíká àtàwọn alàgbà tó wà lágbègbè náà sì ń bójú tó àwọn akéde tọ́rọ̀ yìíkan.

English: We pray that our brothers and sisters continue to endure and be comforted under the care of these loving shepherds.—1 Peter 5:2
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí àwọn araá wa máa fara dà á nìṣó, kí wọ́n sì rí ìtùnú lọ́dọ̀ àwọn alábòójútó onífẹ̀ẹ́ yẹn.—1 Pétérù 5:2

English: A Witness couple lost their home as a series of bushfires has burned more than one million hectares (approximately 2.5 million acres) across New South Wales and Queensland, Australia.
Yoruba: Tọkọtaya Ẹlẹ́rìí kan pàdánù ilé wọn nígbà tí iná tó jó léraléra nínú igbó sun mílíọ̀nù kan hẹ́kítà ilẹ̀ (nǹkan bíi mílíọ̀nù méjì ààbọ̀ éékà) jákèjádò ìpínlẹ̀ New South Wales àti ìpínlẹ̀ Queensland ní Ọsirélíà.

English: None of our brothers have been killed or injured in the fires.
Yoruba: Kò sí ìkankan nínú àwọn ará wa tó kú tàbí tó fara pa nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.

English: Kingdom Halls and Assembly Halls have been spared damage.
Yoruba: Kò sì sí Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tàbí Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ kankan tó bà jẹ́.

English: Local authorities suspect arsonists may have started some of the fires.
Yoruba: Àwọn aláṣẹ ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ sọ pé ó ṣeé ṣe kó jẹ́ pé àwọn tó ń dáná sun ilé ló bẹ̀rẹ̀ àwọn kan lára iná náà.

English: Since September, the fires have killed six people and destroyed at least 650 homes.
Yoruba: Láti oṣù September tí iná náà ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í jó, ó ti pa èèyàn mẹ́fà, ó sì ti jó ilé ó kéré tán ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́fà àti ààbọ̀ (650) run pátápátá.

English: About 200 brothers and sisters had to evacuate, but they have since returned to their homes.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará tó tó igba (200) lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin ló ní láti fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀, àmọ́ wọ́n ti pa dà sílé báyìí.

English: The couple whose home was destroyed are being cared for by other Witnesses.
Yoruba: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí kan ti ń bójú tó tọkọtaya tí ilé wọn bà jẹ́.

English: The congregation elders are giving spiritual support to those affected by the fires.—Acts 20:28.
Yoruba: Àwọn alàgbà ń fi Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run tu àwọn tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà kàn nínú.—Ìṣe 20:28.

English: Tropical Cyclone Harold, a Category 5 storm, moved through the northern islands of Vanuatu on April 5, 2020, causing extensive devastation.
Yoruba: Ìjì líle kan tó lágbára tí wọ́n ń pè ní Cyclone Harold jà ní apá àríwá àwọn erékùṣù tó wà ní Vanuatu ní April 5, 2020, ó sì ba ọ̀pọ̀ nǹkan jẹ́.

English: The cyclone continued southeast and struck the southwest parts of the Fiji islands on April 8, causing similar damage.
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn ìyẹn, ní April 8, ó tún ṣọṣẹ́ ní àwọn erékùṣù tó wà ní Fíjì, ó sì tún ba ọ̀pọ̀ nǹkan jẹ́ níbẹ̀ náà.

English: According to initial reports, none of our brothers have been injured or killed.
Yoruba: Nínú ìròyìn tá a kọ́kọ́ gbọ́, kò sí èyíkéyìí lára àwọn arákùnrin wa tó ṣèṣe, a ò sì gbọ́ pé ẹnì kankan lára wọn kú.

English: Some 280 publishers live on Espiritu Santo, the largest and most northern island of Vanuatu.
Yoruba: Àwọn akéde tó tó ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì àti ọgọ́rin (280) ló ń gbé ní erékùsù Espiritu Santo, ìyẹn erékùṣù tó tóbi jù lápá àríwá Vanuatu.

English: The island sustained major destruction of buildings and crops, as did other nearby islands.
Yoruba: Ńṣe làwọn ilé sùn lọ bẹẹrẹbẹ, ó sì ba àwọn nǹkan ọ̀gbìn jẹ́, ohun kan náà ló ṣe láwọn erékùṣù míì tó wà nítòsí.

English: In Fiji, the properties of approximately 260 publishers sustained major damage.
Yoruba: Ní Fíjì, ó bá ilé àwọn ará wa bí ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì àti ọgọ́ta (260) jẹ́ gan-an.

English: Water, electricity, and food supplies are limited.
Yoruba: Ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ yẹn ṣàkóbá gan-an, débi pé tipátipá ni wọ́n fi ń rí omi lo, iná ò sì, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni oúnjẹ ṣọ̀wọ́n.

English: The Fiji branch is coordinating the distribution of essential relief supplies.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa tó wà ní Fíjì ń ṣètò báwọn ará wa ṣe máa rí àwọn ohun tí wọ́n nílò.

English: Local elders are shepherding the affected brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, àwọn alàgbà ìjọ ń ṣèbẹ̀wò sọ́dọ̀ àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin kí wọ́n lè tù wọ́n nínú kí wọ́n sì fún wọn níṣìírí.

English: We are glad that our brothers affected by this cyclone are being cared for physically and spiritually.—Proverbs 17:17.
Yoruba: Inú wa dùn pé àwọn ará wa tó wà níbi tí ìjì ti jà yìí ń rí àbójútó torí pé wọ́n ń rí ìtùnú látinú Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run, àwọn ohun kòṣeémáàní tí wọ́n nílò sì ń tẹ̀ wọ́n lọ́wọ́.​—Òwe 17:17.

English: From May 10 to 19, Jehovah’s Witnesses in Israel made a concerted effort to participate in public witnessing in Tel Aviv.
Yoruba: Ní May 10 sí 19, àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà lórílẹ̀-èdè Israel sapá gan-an láti túbọ̀ wàásù láwọn ibi térò pọ̀ sí ní ìlú Tel Aviv.

English: The initiative was in response to the increased number of tourists who came to attend various cultural events in the city.
Yoruba: Wọ́n fẹ́ ṣe àwọn ọdún ìbílẹ̀ kan ní ìlú náà, èyí sì mú kí àwọn tó ń wá sí ìlú náà ń pọ̀ sí i, torí náà a ṣètò láti wàásù láwọn ibi térò pọ̀ sí.

English: For example, from May 14 to 18, Tel Aviv hosted the Eurovision Song Contest, a music competition, which drew about ten thousand tourists.
Yoruba: Bí àpẹẹrẹ, ní May 14 sí 18, wọ́n ṣe ìdíje orin Eurovision Song Contest ní ìlú Tel Aviv, àwọn tó sì wá síbẹ̀ tó ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́wàá.

English: Brother Gennadi Korobov, who assisted in coordinating the initiative, comments: “When we learned that there would be thousands of visitors to Tel Aviv for the music event, we saw this as a wonderful opportunity to increase our public witnessing activity.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Gennadi Korobov tó bójú tó iṣẹ́ ìwàásù náà sọ pé: “Nígbà tá a gbọ́ pé ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún èèyàn ló ń bọ̀ níbi ìdíje orin tó máa wáyé ní ìlú Tel Aviv, a gbà pé ó máa fún wa láǹfààní láti túbọ̀ wàásù láwọn ibi térò pọ̀ sí.

English: We were thrilled to have a total of 168 publishers from 22 congregations throughout Israel volunteer.” The brothers set up literature display carts at eight locations from 9:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. each day.
Yoruba: Ó wúni lórí láti rí àwọn akéde méjìdínláàádọ́sàn-án (168) tí wọ́n yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti ìjọ méjìlélógún (22) lórílẹ̀-èdè Israel.” Ojoojúmọ́ làwọn ará yìí pàtẹ àwọn ìwé wa síbi mẹ́jọ ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ láti aago mẹ́sàn-án àárọ̀ títí di aago mẹ́sàn-án alẹ́.

English: To accommodate the many international tourists, the carts featured literature in ten languages: Arabic, Chinese, English, French, German, Hebrew, Italian, Japanese, Russian, and Spanish.
Yoruba: Torí pé oríṣiríṣi orílẹ̀-èdè làwọn àlejò tí wá síbẹ̀, àwọn ará kó àwọn ìwé wa ní èdè mẹ́wàá síbi ìpàtẹ náà, ìyẹn: èdè Lárúbáwá, Chinese, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Faransé, Gámánì, Hébérù, Italian, Japanese, Russian àti Sípáníìṣì.

English: We are confident that there will be good results from this increased activity in Israel.
Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé iṣẹ́ ìwàásù tá a mú gbòòrò sí i lórílẹ̀-èdè Israel yìí máa sèso rere.

English: This effort is further evidence that Jehovah’s people praise him “at all times.”—Psalm 34:1, 2.
Yoruba: Ó sì tún jẹ́ ẹ̀rí tó túbọ̀ ń fi hàn pé àwọn èèyàn Jèhófà ń yìn ín “nígbà gbogbo.”—Sáàmù 34:1, 2.

English: On December 5, 2019, the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR) unanimously ruled in favor of 22 of Jehovah’s Witnesses from Armenia who were wrongly convicted of evading compulsory military service.
Yoruba: Ní December 5, 2019, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù dájọ́ pé àwọn arákùnrin méjìlélógún (22) láti orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia tí wọ́n dá lẹ́bi pé wọ́n sá fún iṣẹ́ ológun kò jẹ̀bi rárá.

English: The ECHR awarded them a total of over $267,000 (EUR 242,000).
Yoruba: Ilé Ẹjọ́ náà sì ní kí wọ́n san owó gbà-má-bínú tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì ó lé méjìdínláàádọ́rin dọ́là ($267,000) fún àwọn arákùnrin náà.

English: This is the highest monetary value the ECHR has awarded our brothers in a case involving conscientious objection.
Yoruba: Èyí ni owó tó pọ̀ jù tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù tíì bù rí pé kí wọ́n san fún àwọn arákùnrin wa tí wọ́n pè lẹ́jọ́ nítorí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn tí kò jẹ́ kí wọn ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.

English: In 2012, the brothers were convicted for conscientiously objecting to military service and for refusing alternative civilian service (ACS).
Yoruba: Ní 2012, wọ́n dá àwọn arákùnrin yìí lẹ́bi torí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun àti pé wọ́n tún kọ̀ láti ṣiṣẹ́ míì tí kì í ṣe iṣẹ́ ológun.

English: The brothers refused ACS because, at the time, it was under military supervision and was not truly civilian.
Yoruba: Ìdí tí wọ́n fi kọ̀ láti ṣiṣẹ́ míì tí kì í ṣe iṣẹ́ ológun ni pé lákòókò yẹn, àwọn ológun ló ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ náà. Torí náà, a ò lè sọ pé kì í ṣe iṣẹ́ ológun.

English: Therefore, all but two of the brothers served terms in prison prior to 2013, when Armenia enacted ACS that was truly civilian and stopped imprisoning our brothers for conscientious objection.
Yoruba: Nítorí náà, méjì péré nínú àwọn arákùnrin náà ni wọn ò jù sẹ́wọ̀n ṣáájú ọdún 2013, ìyẹn ọdún tí orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia ṣòfin pé kí iṣẹ́ míì wà, tó jẹ́ iṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú lóòótọ́, tí kì í ṣe iṣẹ́ ológun.

English: In handing down its December 5 decision, the ECHR relied on a victory Jehovah’s Witnesses obtained in 2017, the case of Adyan and Others v. Armenia.
Yoruba: Nígbà tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù fẹ́ gbé ìdájọ́ ẹ̀ kalẹ̀ ní December 5, ó tọ́ka sí ìdáláre tí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà rí gbà ní 2017 nínú ẹjọ́ tó wà láàárín orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia àti Adyan pẹ̀lú àwọn ìyókù ẹ̀ (Adyan and Others v. Armenia).

English: The ECHR stated that Armenia was well-aware of that case with a similar fact pattern and should have entered into a friendly settlement with the 22 brothers.
Yoruba: Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù sọ pé orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia mọ̀ dáadáa pé ẹjọ́ 2017 yìí jọra gan-an pẹ̀lú ti àwọn arákùnrin méjìlélógún yìí àti pé ṣe ló yẹ kí orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia fìfẹ́ yanjú ọ̀rọ̀ náà.

English: Despite our brothers’ attempts over the past year, the government refused to accept a friendly settlement.
Yoruba: Síbẹ̀, pẹ̀lú gbogbo bí àwọn arákùnrin wa ṣe sapá tó láti bí ọdún kan sẹ́yìn, ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia kọ̀ láti fi wọ́n sílẹ̀.

English: Thus, the ECHR unanimously ruled in favor of the brothers.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ ní báyìí, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù ti dá àwọn arákùnrin wa láre.

English: Thankfully, Armenia’s position on conscientious objection has vastly improved since 2013.
Yoruba: A dúpẹ́ pé ojú tí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia fi ń wo àwọn tó kọ̀ láti ṣiṣẹ́ ológun nítorí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ti yàtọ̀ sí i láti 2013.

English: Our brothers are no longer imprisoned or saddled with criminal records for their neutral stand.
Yoruba: Wọn ò fi àwọn arákùnrin wa sẹ́wọ̀n mọ́, kò sì sí àkọsílẹ̀ mọ́ pé wọ́n jẹ́ ọ̀daràn nítorí wọn ò dá sí tọ̀tún-tòsì.

English: For the past seven years, Armenia’s truly civilian ACS has been a model for other nations to adopt.
Yoruba: Láti bí ọdún méje sẹ́yìn, orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia ti ṣètò iṣẹ́ míì tí àwọn tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun lè ṣe, tí kò sì sí lábẹ́ ìdarí àwọn ológun rárá.

English: However, the ECHR’s December 5 judgment holds Armenia accountable for its failure to comply with international law in 2012.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ ṣá o, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù dá orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia lẹ́bi ní December 5 pé wọn ò tẹ̀ lé òfin àgbáyé ti ọdún 2012.

English: With this decision, the ECHR sends a clear message that it is willing to heavily penalize a country for violating international human rights laws.
Yoruba: Pẹ̀lú ìdájọ́ yìí, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù ń sọ fún gbogbo ayé pé òun máa fìyà tó tó ìyà jẹ orílẹ̀-èdè èyíkéyìí tó bá tẹ òfin ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn àgbáyé lójú.

English: We thank Jehovah for granting our brothers in Armenia this extraordinary legal victory.
Yoruba: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà pé ó fún àwọn arákùnrin wa tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè Armenia ní ìdáláre tó ṣàrà ọ̀tọ̀ yìí.

English: We pray that it opens the way for our brothers in other lands to conscientiously object to compulsory military service and to have the option for alternative civilian service where it is not yet available, such as in Azerbaijan, South Korea, Turkey, and Turkmenistan.
Yoruba: A gbàdúrà kí Jèhófà ṣí ọ̀nà sílẹ̀ fún àwọn arákùnrin wa lórílẹ̀-èdè míì láti má ṣe lọ́wọ́ nínú iṣẹ́ ológun tó jẹ́ dandan, kí wọ́n sì lè ní àǹfààní láti ṣe iṣẹ́ míì dípò iṣẹ́ ológun ní àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí kò tíì sí, bí Azerbaijan, South Korea, Turkey àti Turkmenistan.

English: On July 6, 2018, the Barda District Court of Azerbaijan ordered a one-year conditional sentence for one of our brothers, Emil Mehdiyev.
Yoruba: Ní July 6, 2018, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Barda lórílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan fìyà jẹ ọ̀kan lára àwọn arákùnrin wa tó ń jẹ́ Emil Mehdiyev, wọ́n sì fún un láwọn òfin tó gbọ́dọ̀ máa tẹ̀ lé fún ọdún kan gbáko tí kò bá fẹ́ ṣẹ̀wọ̀n.

English: The court found 18-year-old Emil guilty of evading military service, but did not impose a prison sentence.
Yoruba: Ilé ẹjọ́ sọ pé ọmọ ọlọ́dún méjìdínlógún (18) tó ń jẹ́ Emil yìí jẹ̀bi torí pé ó lóun ò wọṣẹ́ ológun, àmọ́ wọn ò rán an lọ sẹ́wọ̀n.

English: However, he cannot change his permanent address without notifying the authorities, and he is not allowed to leave Azerbaijan.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, kò lè kó kúrò níbi tó ń gbé láìsọ fáwọn aláṣẹ, wọn ò sì jẹ́ kó kúrò lórílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan.

English: In December 2017, Brother Mehdiyev reported to the Barda District Department of the State Service for Mobilization and Conscription.
Yoruba: Ní December 2017, wọ́n ránṣẹ́ pe Arákùnrin Mehdiyev ní Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Gbani Síṣẹ́, Tó sì Ń Fani Wọṣẹ́ ní Agbègbè Barda.

English: He refused to sign the draft notice, as his conscience would not permit him to perform military service.
Yoruba: Àmọ́ ó kọ̀ láti tọwọ́ bọ̀wé ìwọṣẹ́ ológun, torí ẹ̀rí ọkàn rẹ̀ ò jẹ́ kó ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.

English: In response to a summons, he returned to explain his conscientious stand and requested alternative civilian service in lieu of military service.
Yoruba: Nígbà tí wọ́n tún ránṣẹ́ sí i, ó pa dà lọ ṣàlàyé fún wọn pé ẹ̀rí ọkàn òun ò ní jẹ́ kóun ṣiṣẹ́ ológun, ó sì ní kí wọ́n jẹ́ kóun ṣiṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú míì dípò iṣẹ́ ológun.

English: He was told that this option was not available and that his case would be sent to the Barda District prosecutor’s office.
Yoruba: Wọ́n sọ fún un pé kò sírú iṣẹ́ yẹn, wọ́n sì sọ pé àwọn máa gbé ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀ lọ sí ọ́fíìsì olùpẹ̀jọ́ ìjọba ní Àgbègbè Barda.

English: After numerous hearings and adjournments, the Barda District Court convicted him and ordered the conditional arrangement.
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn ọ̀pọ̀ atótónu nílé ẹjọ́ àti àìmọye sísún ẹjọ́ náà síwájú, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Barda dá a lẹ́bi, wọ́n sì fòfin dè é láwọn ọ̀nà kan.

English: Although the court did not sentence Emil to prison, he has no other recourse but to be viewed as a criminal because the government of Azerbaijan has still not instituted an alternative civilian service program, as it has long promised to do.
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ilé ẹjọ́ ò rán Emil lọ sẹ́wọ̀n, ojú ọ̀daràn làwọn èèyàn á máa fi wò ó, kò sì rọ́gbọ́n dá sí i, torí pé ìjọba Azerbaijan ò tíì ṣètò iṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú títí di báyìí, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé tipẹ́tipẹ́ ni wọ́n ti ṣèlérí pé àwọn máa ṣe é.

English: We are happy that Brother Mehdiyev is maintaining his neutral stand in the face of this difficult situation.—1 Peter 2:19.
Yoruba: Inú wa dùn pé Arákùnrin Mehdiyev ò yẹhùn lórí ìpinnu rẹ̀ láìka bí nǹkan ṣe nira fún un báyìí tó.—1 Pétérù 2:19.

English: On November 8, 2018, Azerbaijan’s State Committee for Work with Religious Associations granted Jehovah’s Witnesses full legal registration in Baku, the capital city of Azerbaijan.
Yoruba: Ní November 8, 2018, Àjọ Tó Ń Rí sí Ọ̀rọ̀ Iṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú Àwọn Ẹlẹ́sìn ní orílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan fọwọ́ sí i káwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wọn sílẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin délẹ̀délẹ̀ nílùú Baku, tó jẹ́ olú-ìlú Azerbaijan.

English: Our brothers now enjoy a stronger legal basis to openly worship and preach in the city.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará wa ti wá ní ẹ̀rí tó lẹ́sẹ̀ nílẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin láti máa jọ́sìn ní gbangba, kí wọ́n sì máa wàásù fàlàlà ní ìlú náà.

English: We hope that this positive development will provide a precedent for our fellow worshippers in other parts of the country to receive legal registration.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé àṣeyọrí tá a ṣe lábẹ́ òfin yìí máa jẹ́ káwọn aláṣẹ gbà káwọn ará wa tó wà láwọn ibòmíì lórílẹ̀-èdè náà forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wọn sílẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin.

English: We are thankful to Jehovah that favorable government officials have legally established our worship in Baku.—Philippians 1:7.
Yoruba: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà pé àwọn aláṣẹ fojúure hàn sí wa, wọ́n sì fọwọ́ sí i kí òfin gbà wá láyè láti máa ṣe ìjọsìn wa nílùú Baku.​—Fílípì 1:7.

English: From July 26 to 28, 2019, Jehovah’s Witnesses in Azerbaijan held their annual convention at the Darnagul Ceremony House in the capital city of Baku.
Yoruba: Ní July 26 sí 28 2019, àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní orílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan ṣe àpéjọ tí wọ́n máa ń ṣe lọ́dọọdún ní Darnagul Ceremony House ní olú ìlú orílẹ̀-èdè náà tí wọ́n ń pé ní Baku.

English: In this year of memorable international conventions, the regional convention in Baku was historic.
Yoruba: Lọ́dún yìí tí ọ̀wọ́ àpéjọ àgbáyé mánigbàgbé wáyé, àpéjọ agbègbè tó wáyé ní Baku pẹ̀lú jẹ́ mánigbàgbé ní ti pé òun ni àpéjọ tó tóbi jù lọ tá a ṣe ní Azerbaijan.

English: It was the largest public convention ever held in Azerbaijan and the first time Azerbaijani and Russian congregations from the entire country attended a convention at the same time.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́, àwọn ìjọ tó ń sọ èdè Azerbaijan àti ti Rọ́ṣíà ní orílẹ̀ èdè yẹn pàdé pọ̀ fún àpéjọ kan ṣoṣo.

English: Although Azerbaijan only has about 1,500 publishers, the peak attendance for the convention was 1,938.
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé gbogbo akéde tó wà ni Azerbaijan kò ju ẹgbẹ̀rún kan àtààbọ̀ (1,500) lọ, síbẹ̀ ẹgbẹ̀rún kan, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́sàn àti méjìdínlógójì (1,938) ló wá sí àpéjọ yìí.

English: A total of 33 were baptized.
Yoruba: Èèyàn mẹ́tàlélọ́gbọ́n (33) ló sì ṣe ìrìbọmi.

English: Brother Mark Sanderson was allowed special entry into the country to deliver talks at the convention.
Yoruba: Wọ́n fún Arákùnrin Mark Sanderson ní àǹfààní àrà ọ̀tọ̀ láti wọlé sí orílẹ̀-èdè yìí kó lè sọ àsọyé ní àpéjọ náà.

English: It was the first time a member of the Governing Body served a convention in Azerbaijan.
Yoruba: Èyí ni ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tí ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí máa ṣe àpéjọ pẹ̀lú àwọn ará ní Azerbaijan.

English: We are grateful to the authorities for granting this permission.
Yoruba: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn aláṣẹ fún ànfààní yìí.

English: The unity of the brothers and sisters gave an excellent witness.
Yoruba: Ìṣọ̀kan tó wà láàárín àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa ń jẹ́rìí lọ́nà tó wúni lórí.

English: The administrator of the venue observed that during this convention he saw peace, love, and kindness among the Witnesses and that they really do practice what they preach.
Yoruba: Olùdarí ibi tá a lò fún àpéjọ náà kíyè sí i pé àlàáfìà, ìfẹ́ àti inú rere jọba láàárin àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà nígbà àpéjọ náà àti pé wọ́n ń fi ohun tí wọn ń wàásù ṣèwà hù.

English: Although Jehovah’s Witnesses still experience violations of religious freedom in Azerbaijan, authorities have progressively granted our brothers greater freedom to practice their faith.
Yoruba: Bó tìẹ̀ jẹ́ pé, wọ́n ṣì ń fojú òmìnira ìsìn àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà gbolẹ̀ ní Azerbaijan, látìgbàdégbà làwọn aláṣẹ ń fún àwọn ará wa lómìnira tó pọ̀ sí i láti jọ́sìn.

English: In November 2018, Azerbaijan gave Jehovah’s Witnesses full legal registration in Baku.
Yoruba: Ní November 2018, ìjọba Azerbaijan fún àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà láàyè láti forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wọn sílẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin ní Baku.

English: This registration gives our brothers a stronger legal basis to openly worship in the city.
Yoruba: Èyí ló sì fún àwọn ará wa ní òmìnira tó pọ̀ sí i lábẹ́ òfin láti jọ́sin ní gbangba ní ìlú náà.

English: We rejoice with our brothers and sisters in Azerbaijan for these positive developments, including this recent milestone in their theocratic history.
Yoruba: A bá àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa ní Azerbaijan yọ̀ fún àwọn ohun rere àti ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ mánigbàgbé tó wáyé nínú ìtàn wọn.

English: We pray for Jehovah’s continued blessing on the efforts to ‘legally establish the good news’ throughout Azerbaijan and worldwide.—Philippians 1:7.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà bù kún ìsapá wa “bí a ṣe ń gbèjà ìhìn rere, tí a sì ń fìdí rẹ̀ múlẹ̀ lọ́nà òfin” ní ibi gbogbo lórílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan àti kárí ayé.​—Fílípì 1:7.

English: On October 31, 2018, the Ganja Court of Appeal in Azerbaijan upheld a lower court ruling to convict Brother Vahid Abilov, 19, for conscientious objection.
Yoruba: Ní October 31, 2018, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Kòtẹ́milọ́rùn nílùú Ganja lórílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan fọwọ́ sí ẹjọ́ tí ilé ẹjọ́ kan ti dá tẹ́lẹ̀ pé Arákùnrin Vahid Abilov, tó jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún mọ́kàndínlógún (19) jẹ̀bi torí pé ẹ̀rí ọkàn ò jẹ́ kó wọṣẹ́ ológun.

English: Although Vahid is not imprisoned, his one-year conditional sentence places several restrictions on him.
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé wọn ò rán Vahid lọ sẹ́wọ̀n, wọ́n fi àwọn òfin máṣu-mátọ̀ kan dè é fún ọdún kan gbáko, tó túmọ̀ sí pé oríṣiríṣi nǹkan ni ò ní lè ṣe.

English: For example, he must report to a probation officer each week, and he is not allowed to leave Azerbaijan.
Yoruba: Bí àpẹẹrẹ, ọ̀sọ̀ọ̀sẹ̀ ló gbọ́dọ̀ máa yọjú sí agbófinró kan, wọn ò sì gbà á láyè kó kúrò ní Azerbaijan.

English: Vahid will now appeal to the Supreme Court, his last opportunity for justice in Azerbaijan’s judicial system. The challenge to our brother’s neutrality began in May 2017.
Yoruba: Vahid máa kọ̀wé pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn sí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ báyìí, ìpele tó gbẹ̀yìn nìyẹn tó lè gbé ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀ dé lábẹ́ òfin ní Azerbaijan. May 2017 ni ìṣòro arákùnrin wa yìí ti bẹ̀rẹ̀.

English: He had recently turned 18 and was required to report to the Aghdam District Department of the State Service for Mobilization and Conscription.
Yoruba: Kò pẹ́ tó pé ẹni ọdún méjìdínlógún (18) ni wọ́n ní kó lọ sí iléeṣẹ́ ìjọba ní Aghdam tó ń rí sí bí àwọn èèyàn ṣe ń wọṣẹ́ ológun, tí wọ́n sì ń múra sílẹ̀ fún ogun.

English: There he presented a written statement explaining that he could not serve in the military.
Yoruba: Nígbà tó débẹ̀, ó fún wọn níwèé tó kọ, tó fi ṣàlàyé pé òun ò ní lè wọṣẹ́ ológun.

English: He wrote: “My Bible-trained conscience prevents me from taking up military service.
Yoruba: Ohun tó kọ rèé: “Ẹ̀rí ọkàn mi tí mo ti fi Bíbélì kọ́ ò ní jẹ́ kí n lè wọṣẹ́ ológun.

English: I do not evade, or even think of evading, the fulfillment of my civic duty.
Yoruba: Kì í ṣe pé mò ń sá, tàbí pé mò ń ronú àtisá fún ojúṣe tó yẹ kí n ṣe fún ìlú.

English: I just kindly ask you to provide me with alternative civilian service instead of military service.” The authorities rebuffed Vahid’s wishes, and on July 9, 2018, indicted him under the charge of evading military service.
Yoruba: Ohun tí mo kàn fẹ́ kẹ́ ẹ jọ̀ọ́ ṣe fún mi ni pé kẹ́ ẹ jẹ́ kí n ṣiṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú dípò iṣẹ́ ológun.” Àmọ́ àwọn aláṣẹ ò gbà fún Vahid, nígbà tó di July 9, 2018, wọ́n fẹ̀sùn kàn án pé ó ń sá fún iṣẹ́ ológun.

English: During the hearing in the Ganja Court of Appeal, Brother Abilov further explained his motives for objecting to military service.
Yoruba: Nígbà tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Kòtẹ́milọ́rùn nílùú Ganja ń gbọ́ ẹjọ́ náà, Arákùnrin Abilov tún ṣàlàyé ohun tó fà á tí òun ò fi fẹ́ wọṣẹ́ ológun.

English: He read Isaiah 2:4 to the court and explained that his personal examination of the Bible convinced him that he “should not even learn to fight.” Nonetheless, the court upheld his conviction.
Yoruba: Ó ka ìwé Àìsáyà 2:4 fún ilé ẹjọ́, ó sì ṣàlàyé pé àyẹ̀wò tí òun fúnra òun ṣe nínú Bíbélì jẹ́ kó dá òun lójú pé “kò tiẹ̀ yẹ kóun kọ́ bí wọ́n ṣe ń jà.” Láìka gbogbo àlàyé tó ṣe sí, ilé ẹjọ́ sọ pé ó jẹ̀bi.

English: It is yet to be seen if the Supreme Court will respect his wishes.
Yoruba: A ò tíì mọ̀ bóyá Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ máa fọwọ́ sí i kó ṣe ohun tó fẹ́.

English: When Azerbaijan became a member of the Council of Europe in 2001, it committed itself to adopt legislation providing for alternative civilian service. The government has yet to do so.
Yoruba: Nígbà tí orílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan dara pọ̀ mọ́ Ìgbìmọ̀ Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù lọ́dún 2001, wọ́n ṣàdéhùn pé àwọn máa ṣòfin tó máa fọwọ́ sí iṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú. Àmọ́ wọn ò tíì mú àdéhùn náà ṣẹ.

English: As a result, our brothers regularly face the neutrality issue for their conscientious objection to military service.
Yoruba: Èyí ń mú kí àwọn ará wa máa kojú ìṣòro léraléra lórí ọ̀rọ̀ pé ẹ̀rí ọkàn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.

English: Earlier in the year, an Azerbaijan district court found another one of our brothers, Emil Mehdiyev, guilty of evasion of military service and sentenced him to one year of probation.
Yoruba: Lọ́wọ́ ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọdún yìí, ilé ẹjọ́ kan ní Azerbaijan tún dá Emil Mehdiyev tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn ará wa lẹ́bi torí pé ó kọ̀ láti wọṣẹ́ ológun, wọ́n sì sọ pé kó wà lábẹ́ àyẹ̀wò fún ọdún kan.

English: He has also appealed his case to the Supreme Court.
Yoruba: Òun náà ti pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn sí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ.

English: Additionally, there are four cases pending before the European Court of Human Rights against Azerbaijan concerning our brothers who are conscientious objectors.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ẹjọ́ mẹ́rin ló ṣì wà ní Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù lórí ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn ará wa tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.

English: Despite these challenges, our brothers are continuing to rely on Jehovah to maintain their neutrality.—John 15:19.
Yoruba: Láìka àwọn ìṣòro yìí sí, àwọn ará wa ò yéé gbára lé Jèhófà kó lè ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́ láti má se dá sí ọ̀rọ̀ ogun.—Jòhánù 15:19.

English: In March 2019, the Supreme Court of Cassation of Bulgaria, the highest court of the land, issued favorable rulings in three cases involving our brothers.
Yoruba: Lóṣù March 2019, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ní Bọ̀géríà dá àwọn ará wa láre nínú ẹjọ́ mẹ́ta ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.

English: These victories set vital legal precedents to protect our brothers’ freedom of worship throughout the country.
Yoruba: Àwọn ẹjọ́ tó lápẹẹrẹ yìí máa wúlò gan-an láti dáàbò bo ẹ̀tọ́ táwọn ará wa ní láti ṣe ẹ̀sìn wọn káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè náà.

English: Two of the cases involved slander from media outlets.
Yoruba: Nínú méjì lára àwọn ẹjọ́ náà, ńṣe làwọn ilé iṣẹ́ tó ń gbéròyìn jáde parọ́ mọ́ àwọn ará wa.

English: In 2012, the newspaper Vseki Den published a libelous article about our beliefs.
Yoruba: Lọ́dún 2012, ìwé ìròyìn Vseki Den gbé àpilẹ̀kọ kan jáde tó fi sọ̀rọ̀ tí kò dáa nípa ohun tá a gbà gbọ́.

English: Similarly, in 2014, station SKAT TV televised false reports about our organization.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, lọ́dún 2014, ilé iṣẹ́ tẹlifíṣọ̀n SKAT TV gbé ìròyìn èké jáde nípa ètò wa.

English: In both instances, the media outlets denied our brothers’ requests to retract the negative statements.
Yoruba: Nígbà táwọn ará wa sọ fún wọn pé kí wọ́n ṣàtúnṣe sí irọ́ tí wọ́n pa mọ́ wa, ńṣe ni ilé iṣẹ́ méjèèjì kọ̀ jálẹ̀.

English: After a series of court cases and appeals, the issues reached the Supreme Court.
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn ọ̀pọ̀ ẹjọ́ tá a pè, títí dé àwọn ilé ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́miọ́rùn, a gbé àwọn ẹjọ́ náà lọ sí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ.

English: On March 18, 2019, the Supreme Court ruled against SKAT TV.
Yoruba: Ní March 18, 2019 Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ dá ilé iṣẹ́ tẹlifíṣọ̀n SKAT TV lẹ́bi.

English: On March 26, the Court used the ruling as a precedent to penalize Vseki Den, condemning what the Court characterized as the “language of hatred.” The third case involved the cruel persecution of our brothers by a political group called the VMRO-Bulgarian National Movement.
Yoruba: Ní March 26, Ilé Ẹjọ́ yìí tẹ̀ lé ìpinnu rẹ̀ nínú ẹjọ́ àkọ́kọ́, ó sì dẹ́bi fún ìwé ìròyìn Vseki Den pé ó lo “ọ̀rọ̀ tó fi hàn pé ó kórìíra.” Ẹjọ́ kẹta dá lé ìwà ìkà táwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú VMRO-Bulgarian National Movement hù sáwọn ará wa.

English: On April 17, 2011, our brothers gathered to commemorate the Memorial of Jesus’ death.
Yoruba: Ní April 17, 2011, àwọn ará wa pé jọ láti ṣe Ìrántí ikú Jésù.

English: An aggressive mob of 60 people, organized by political leader Georgi Drakaliev of the VMRO, brutally attacked our brothers, inflicting injuries.
Yoruba: Àmọ́, ńṣe ni Georgi Drakaliev tó jẹ́ olórí nínú ẹgbẹ́ VMRO kó ọgọ́ta (60) jàǹdùkú jọ, wọ́n wá ṣe àwọn ará lésẹ, wọ́n sì dọ́gbẹ́ sí wọn lára.

English: The brothers took the matter to the courts.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará gbé ọ̀rọ̀ náà lọ sílé ẹjọ́.

English: The case eventually came before the Supreme Court.
Yoruba: Nígbà tó yá, ọ̀rọ̀ náà dé Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ.

English: On March 20, 2019, the Court ruled against Mr. Drakaliev, who now must compensate the brothers.
Yoruba: Ní March 20, 2019, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ dá Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Drakaliev lẹ́bi, wọ́n sì ní kó sanwó ìtanràn fáwọn ará wa.

English: We rejoice because of these three favorable rulings.
Yoruba: Inú wa dùn gan-an torí bá a ṣe jàre nínú ẹjọ́ mẹ́tẹ̀ẹ̀ta yìí.

English: These decisions can now be used as a basis to protect our brothers’ freedom to “go on leading a calm and quiet life with complete godly devotion.”—1 Timothy 2:2.
Yoruba: Àwọn ilé ẹjọ́ lè lo àwọn ìdájọ́ tó lápẹẹrẹ yìí láti dáàbò bo ẹ̀tọ́ táwọn ará wa ní láti “máa gbé ìgbé ayé tó pa rọ́rọ́ nìṣó pẹ̀lú ìbàlẹ̀ ọkàn, bí wọ́n ti ń fi gbogbo ọkàn wọn sin Ọlọ́run.”​—1 Tímótì 2:2.

English: The revised New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures was released in the Czech and Slovak languages on September 7, 2019.
Yoruba: Ní September 7, 2019, a mú Bíbélì Mímọ́ ti Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a tún ṣe jáde lédè Czech àti Slovak.

English: The Bibles were released by Brother Stephen Lett, a member of the Governing Body, at a special meeting held in Ostrava, Czech Republic.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Stephen Lett tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí ló mú Bíbélì méjèèjì náà jáde níbi àkànṣe ìpàdé kan tá a ṣe nílùú Ostrava lórílẹ̀-èdè Czech Republic.

English: The special meeting included over 200 locations in the Czech Republic and Slovakia, with a total attendance of 25,284.
Yoruba: Ibi tó ju igba (200) ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ lọ ni wọ́n ti gbé àkànṣe ìpàdé náà sáfẹ́fẹ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè Czech Republic àti Slovakia, ẹgbẹ̀rún-ún márùndínlọ́gbọ̀n àti igba ó lé mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́rin (25,284) èèyàn ló sì pésẹ̀ síbẹ̀.

English: These releases are the result of over four years of work by each team of translators.
Yoruba: Ó ju ọdún mẹ́rin tí àwùjọ àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè kọ̀ọ̀kan fi ṣiṣẹ́ kí wọ́n tó lè mú àwọn ìtẹ̀jáde náà jáde.

English: A primary benefit of the revised translations is that they are easy to read.
Yoruba: Àǹfààní pàtàkì tó wà nínú àwọn ìtúmọ̀ Bíbélì tá a tún ṣe yìí ni pé, wọ́n rọrùn láti kà.

English: One member of the Slovak translation team states: “Many will find themselves immersed in the reading of Bible accounts.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè Slovak sọ pé: “Àwọn èèyàn máa gbádùn Bíbélì yìí gan an, ó sì máa dùn-ún kà.

English: The text is much more fluent and natural, so the reader will want to know how the story continues and will find it difficult to stop reading.” There are over 15,000 Jehovah’s Witnesses in the Czech Republic and over 11,000 in Slovakia who will benefit from the releases.
Yoruba: Torí pé àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ inú ẹ̀ ò le, ó sì rọrùn láti lóye, ẹni tó ń kà á kò ní fẹ́ fi í sílẹ̀ kó lè mọ ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ tẹ̀ lé e.” Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè Czech Republic ju ẹgbẹ̀rún márùndínlógún (15,000) lọ, àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí tó wà ní Slovakia sì ju ẹgbẹ̀rún mọ́kànlá (11,000) lọ, gbogbo wọn ló sì máa gbádùn Bíbélì tuntun yìí.

English: A member of the Czech translation team explains: “The revised New World Translation puts emphasis on conveying the thoughts of the original-language text, using shorter sentences and modern language.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè lórílẹ̀-èdè Czech sọ pé: “Ohun kan tó ṣe pàtàkì nínú Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a tún ṣe yìí ni bá a ṣe lo àwọn gbólóhùn tí kò gùn jù tá a sì lo èdè tó bóde mu ká lè túmọ̀ èdè tí wọ́n fi kọ Bíbélì ní ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ lọ́nà tó ṣe kedere.

English: It will be more understandable not only for long-time Witnesses but also for young people and those who are new in the truth.” The New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures has been translated, in whole or in part, into 184 languages, including 29 complete revisions based on the 2013 edition.
Yoruba: Kì í ṣe àwọn tó ti di Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà fún ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún nìkan ló máa lóye Bíbélì yìí, àmọ́ àwọn ọ̀dọ̀ àtàwọn tó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ń kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ òtítọ́ náà máa lóye rẹ̀.” Ní báyìí, a ti túmọ̀ Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun lódindi tàbí lápá kan sí èdè mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́sàn-an (184), èyí tá a tún ṣe lọ́dún 2013 la fi túmọ̀ mọ́kàndínlọ́gbọ̀n (29) lára ẹ̀.

English: It is our prayer that these releases will help Bible truth touch the hearts of readers to an even greater degree.—Luke 24:32.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Bíbélì tuntun yìí mú káwọn tó ń kà á túbọ̀ nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí òtítọ́ tó wà nínú Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run.​—Lúùkù 24:32.

English: On July 19, 2019, Brother Stephen Lett of the Governing Body enthusiastically announced the release of the New World Translation of the Christian Greek Scriptures in Icelandic at the international convention in Copenhagen, Denmark.
Yoruba: Ní July 19, 2019, Arákùnrin Stephen Lett tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí fi tayọ̀tayọ̀ mú Ìwé Mímọ́ Kristian Lédè Griki ní Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Titun jáde lèdè Icelandic ní àpéjọ àgbáyé tá a ṣe ní Copenhagen lórílẹ̀ èdè Denmark.

English: On Friday morning of the convention, the chairman invited all in the Icelandic-language field to meet in a small lounge within the stadium complex during the noon break.
Yoruba: Lówùúrọ̀ Friday àpéjọ náà, alága sọ pé kí gbogbo àwọn tó wà làwọn ìjọ tó ń sọ èdè Icelandic wá sí yàrá kékeré kan tó wà nínú pápá ìṣeré náà ní àkókò ìsinmi ọ̀sán.

English: During this special meeting, Brother Lett presented the Bible to the 341 grateful brothers and sisters who were in attendance.
Yoruba: Níbi àkànṣe ìpàdé yìí ni Arákùnrin Lett ti fún àwọn ọgọ́rùn mẹ́ta àti mọ́kànlélógójì 341) arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tó wà níbẹ̀, tí wọn sì gbà á pẹ̀lú ẹ̀mí ìmoore.

English: For centuries, Bible translation has been an important part of Iceland’s literary heritage.
Yoruba: Fún ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún ni àwọn ọmọ ìlú Iceland ti ṣiṣẹ́ láti tú Bíbélì sí èdè wọn.

English: In 1540, Oddur Gottskálksson published the first translation of the Christian Greek Scriptures into Icelandic.
Yoruba: Ní ọdún 1540, Oddur Gottskálksson tẹ̀ Ìwé Mímọ́ Kristẹni lédè Gíríìkì jáde ní èdè Iceland fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́.

English: Since 2010, our Icelandic fellow worshippers have been using the Bible of the 21st Century, published by the Icelandic Bible Company.
Yoruba: Láti ọdún 2010 ni àwọn ará wa tó ń sọ èdè Icelandic ti ń lo Bíbélì tó ń jẹ́ Bible of the 21st Century èyí tí àjọ Icelandic Bible Company tẹ̀ jáde.

English: Now, the brothers and sisters in the Icelandic field are eager to use the newly released translation to share the good news with the more than 300,000 people who speak the language.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, ara àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó ń lágbègbè tí wọ́n ti ń sọ èdè Icelandic ti wà lọ́nà láti lo Bíbélì tí a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ mú jáde yìí láti sọ ìròyìn ayọ̀ náà fún àwọn tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta (300,000) tó ń sọ èdè yìí.

English: A brother on the translation team states: “The translation of the Christian Greek Scriptures into Icelandic took almost four years.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin kan tó jẹ́ ọkàn lára àwọn tó ṣe iṣẹ́ ìtumọ̀ náà sọ pé: “Ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ gbà tó ọdún mẹ́rin láti túmọ̀ Ìwé Mímọ́ Kristẹni lédè Gíríìkì sí èdè Icelandic.

English: What makes this translation unique is that it fully restores Jehovah’s name to its rightful place in the Scriptures.
Yoruba: Ohun tó mú kí ìtumọ̀ yìí ṣàrà ọ̀tọ̀ ni pé, ó dá orúkọ Jèhófà padà sí gbogbo ibi tó yẹ kó wà nínú Ìwé Mímọ́.

English: This is in harmony with Jesus’ prayer recorded at John 17:26: ‘I have made your name known to them and will make it known.’” We are grateful for Jehovah’s continued blessing on our commission to preach the good news to the entire inhabited earth, which is largely made possible due to our translation work.
Yoruba: Èyí wà ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú àdúrà Jésù tó wà ní Jòhánù 17:26 tó sọ pé: ‘Mo ti jẹ́ kí wọ́n mọ orúkọ rẹ, màá sì jẹ́ kí wọ́n mọ̀ ọ́n.’ ” A dúpẹ́ pé Jèhófà ń bá a lọ láti bù kún iṣẹ́ tó gbé fún wa láti wàásù ìhìn rere dé gbogbo ilẹ̀ ayé tí à ń gbé pátá. Bá a ṣe ń túmọ̀ Bíbélì ti ràn wá lọ́wọ́ láti ṣe iṣẹ́ yìí yanjú.

English: It is our prayer that many more will want to learn about “the magnificent things of God” as they read from his Word in the language of their heart.—Acts 2:11.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí àwọn èèyàn púpọ̀ sí i fẹ́ láti kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nípa “àwọn ohun àgbàyanu Ọlọ́run” bí wọ́n ṣe ń ka ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ ní èdè ìbílẹ̀ wọn.​—Ìṣe 2:11.

English: In July 2019, a new Bible museum opened at the Scandinavia branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses, located in the town of Holbæk, Denmark, which is approximately 65 kilometers (40 mi) from Copenhagen.
Yoruba: Ní July 2019, a ṣí ibi tuntun tí wọ́n kó onírúurú Bíbélì sí ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Scandinavia, nílùú Holbæk lórílẹ̀-èdè Denmark, ibẹ̀ ò jú nǹkan bi kìlómítà márùndínláàádọ́rin (65) sí ìlú Copenhagen.

English: The museum theme is “The Bible and the Divine Name in Scandinavia.” The museum brings together a unique collection of rare and significant Bibles in the Danish, Faeroese, Greenlandic, Icelandic, Norwegian, Saami, and Swedish languages.
Yoruba: Àkòrí tí wọ́n kọ síbi tí wọ́n kó àwọn Bíbélì náà sí ni “The Bible and the Divine Name in Scandinavia” tó túmọ̀ sí Bíbélì àti Orúkọ Àtọ̀runwá Náà ní Scandinavia.

English: More than 50 Bibles make up this display.
Yoruba: Níbẹ̀, wàá rí àtẹ kan tí wọ́n kó ọ̀pọ̀ Bíbélì tó ṣàrà ọ̀tọ̀ sí lédè Danish, Faeroese, Greenlandic, Icelandic, Norwegian, Saami àti Swedish.

English: One of the most significant items is an original 1541 Gustav Vasa Bible.
Yoruba: Bíbélì tó wà nínú àtẹ yìí ju àádọ́ta (50) lọ.

English: It was the first complete Bible produced in any Scandinavian language.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára ohun tó ṣe pàtàkì jù nínú àtẹ náà ni Bíbélì ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ Gustav Vasa ti ọdún 1541.

English: The Gustav Vasa Bible became the standard for the Swedish language, establishing grammar and vocabulary.
Yoruba: Òun ni odindi Bíbélì àkọ́kọ́ tí wọ́n ṣe lédè Scandinavia.

English: It also became the model text for the Swedish Bible for the next 300 years.
Yoruba: Inú Bíbélì Gustav Vasa ni wọ́n ti mú èyí tó pọ̀ jù nínú gírámà àti ọ̀rọ̀ èdè àwọn ará Sweden.

English: An original 1541 Gustav Vasa Bible on display at the museum The 1550 Christian III Bible is another rare original on display.
Yoruba: Wọ́n tún lò ó láti fi túmọ̀ àwọn Bíbélì míì lédè Sweden fún ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta (300) ọdún tó tẹ̀ lé e. Wọ́n pàtẹ Bíbélì ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ Gustav Vasa ti ọdún 1541 síbi tí wọ́n ń kó nǹkan ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé sí Ohun tó tún ṣàrà ọ̀tọ̀ nínú àtẹ náà ni Bíbélì ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ 1550 Christian III ti ọdún 1550.

English: This was the first complete Bible in Danish.
Yoruba: Òun ni odindi Bíbélì àkọ́kọ́ tí wọ́n ṣe lédè Danish.

English: The Christian III Bible helped to standardize the Danish language, and it had a significant impact on a large part of Northern Europe.
Yoruba: Ìlànà tí wọ́n fi kọ Bíbélì Christian III ni wọ́n lò nínú èdè Danish, kódà ọ̀rọ̀ inú ẹ̀ ti di ara èdè tí ọ̀pọ̀ lára àwọn ará Àríwá Yúróòpù ń lò báyìí.

English: An original copy of the 1550 Christian III Bible Erik Jørgensen from the Scandinavia branch office comments: “This new Bible museum demonstrates the deep respect that has existed for centuries in Scandinavia for both God’s Word and his majestic name, Jehovah.”
Yoruba: Ẹ̀dà Bíbélì ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ Christian III ti ọdún 1550 Erik Jørgensen tó wà ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Scandinavia sọ pé: “Ibi tuntun tí wọ́n ń kó onírúurú Bíbélì sí yìí ti jẹ́ ka rí i pé láti ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún sẹ́yìn làwọn ará Scandinavia ti ní ìfẹ́ tó jinlẹ̀ fún Ọrọ̀ Ọlọ́run àti orúkọ rẹ̀ tí kò lẹ́gbẹ́, ìyẹn Jèhófà.”

English: Dates: July 19-21, 2019
Yoruba: Déètì: July 19-21, 2019

English: Location: Brøndby Stadium and Brøndby Hallen, Copenhagen, Denmark
Yoruba: Ibi Tí A Ti Ṣeé: Pápá Ìṣeré Brøndby àti Gbàgede Brøndby Hallen, ní Copenhagen, Denmark

English: Program Languages: Danish, Danish Sign Language, English, Icelandic, Norwegian Sign Language, Swedish Sign Language
Yoruba: Èdè: Danish, Èdè Adití ti Danish, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Icelandic, Èdè Adití ti Norway, Èdè Adití ti Sweden

English: Peak Attendance: 26,409
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá: 26,409

English: Total Number Baptized: 141
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Ṣèrìbọmi: 141

English: Number of International Delegates: 7,000
Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá Láti Ilẹ̀ Òkèèrè: 7,000

English: Invited Branches: Australasia, Brazil, Central America, Central Europe, Colombia, Dominican Republic, Finland, Georgia, India, Japan, Poland, United States
Yoruba: Àwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíísì Tá A Pè: Amẹ́ríkà, Australasia, Brazil, Central America, Central Europe, Colombia, Dominican Republic, Finland, Georgia, India, Japan, Poland

English: Local Experiences: Christian Tidemand Andersen, event coordinator for Brøndby Stadium, stated: “One and a half years ago we first began planning the Jehovah’s Witnesses International Convention, and from day one there has been an amazing dialogue between both organizations.
