English: Local Experiences: Mr. Kamil Kaźmierkiewicz, general manager of Four Points by Sheraton Warsaw Mokotów (one of the hotels that accommodated delegates), wrote the following: “Cooperation with you is exemplary—I wish I would have more guests who are so kind and positive.
Yoruba: Ìrírí: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni KamilKaźmierkiewicz tó jẹ́ ọ̀gá àgbà òtẹ́ẹ̀lì tí wọ́n ń pè ní Four Points by Sheraton ní ìlú Warsaw Mokotów (ó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára òtẹ́ẹ̀lì tí wọ́n fi àwọn àlejò wọ̀ sí), kọ̀wé pé: “Ó rọrùn láti bá a yín ṣiṣẹ́, ó wù mí kí n tún láwọn àlejò tó jẹ́ onínúure tí wọ́n sì lẹ́mìí tó dáa bíi tiyín.

English: The strong connection and unity between the participants is visible.
Yoruba: Mo kíye síi pé ẹ nífẹ̀ẹ́ ara yín gan an, ẹ sì wà níṣọ̀kan.

English: I take my hat off to the perfect logistics of this event.” Mr. Kamil Lubański, owner of KL Team, the company contracted to provide bus transportation, also related: “Right from the start of our working together, I could sense a very good atmosphere and working relationship from Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: Bẹ́ ẹ ṣe ṣètò gbogbo nǹkan ní àpéjọ yìi wú mi lórí gan-an.” Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Kamil Lubański tó ni ilé iṣẹ́ KL Team tó bá wa ṣètò ọkọ̀ tó kó àwọn èèyàn sọ pé: “Látọjọ́ tí mo ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí bá àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ṣiṣẹ́ ni mo ti mọ̀ pé màá gbádùn àkókò tá a máa fi ṣiṣẹ́.

English: They are very involved and professional.
Yoruba: Wọ́n wà létòletò, wọ́n sì mọ́ nǹkan ṣe.

English: This very large event was well planned and prepared.
Yoruba: Wọ́n ti ṣètò tó nítumọ̀ fún àpéjọ ńlá yìí, wọ́n sì ti múra sílẹ̀ dáadáa.

English: Our company has had the privilege of supporting many prestigious and government events that were organized on a national and European level.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn olókìkí èèyàn la ti bá ṣiṣẹ́ nílé iṣẹ́ wa, títí kan àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba, a sì ti ṣètò ìkórajọ káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè yìí àti láwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tó wà ní Yúróòpù.

English: However, it is rare to find a client that is so logistically and methodically prepared.
Yoruba: Àmọ́, mi ò tíì ráwọn èèyàn tó múra sílẹ̀ tó sì ṣe nǹkan létòletò bíi tiyín rí.

English: To summarize, our drivers and coordinators only have positive things to say about working with Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: Kókó ibẹ̀ ni pé, gbogbo àwọn awakọ̀ wa àtàwọn òṣìṣẹ́ wa míì ló ń sọ ohun tó dáa nípa àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà nígbà tí wọ́n jọ ṣiṣẹ́.

English: We hope that in the future we will be able to work together again.”
Yoruba: Lọ́jọ́ iwájú, ó wù wá ká tún jọ ṣiṣẹ́.”

English: "Extreme temperatures combined with severe drought have contributed to the deadliest fire season on record in Portugal.
Yoruba: "Ojú ọjọ́ tó ń gbóná kọjá sísọ àti ọ̀gbẹlẹ̀ tó lágbára ti yọrí sí iná lórílẹ̀-èdè Portugal, tọ̀tẹ̀ yìí ló sì tíì pààyàn jù lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.

English: A total of 64 people were killed in June and another 45 in October, with a peak of 523 fires being reported in mid-October.
Yoruba: Lóṣù June, èèyàn mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́ta [64] ló kú, èèyàn márùndínláàádọ́ta [45] ló sì kú lóṣù October, ní àárín oṣù October, ìgbà ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún ó lé mẹ́tàlélógún [523] ni iná ṣẹ́ yọ.

English: According to the European Union’s Emergency Management Service, this year wildfires have already burned nearly 520,000 hectares (1.3 million acres)—more than six times the country’s annual average of just over 83,000 hectares (205,000 acres).
Yoruba: Àjọ Tó Ń Bójú Tó Ọ̀rọ̀ Pàjáwìrì lábẹ́ ìdarí Ìgbìmọ̀ Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù sọ pé, lọ́dún yìí, ó ti fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó mílíọ̀nù kan ààbọ̀ eékà ilẹ̀ tí iná ti jó, ó fi ìlọ́po mẹ́fà ju iye ilẹ̀ tó sábà máa ń jóná lórílẹ̀-èdè náà tẹ́lẹ̀, ìyẹn ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà igba ó lé márùn-ún [205,000] eékà ilẹ̀

English: According to the Portugal branch office, the fires claimed the lives of one of our brothers and his four-year-old nephew.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà lórílẹ̀-èdè Portugal ròyìn pé iná náà gbẹ̀mí ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ará wa àti ìbátan rẹ̀ ọlọ́dún mẹ́rin.

English: The fires damaged or destroyed some of our brothers’ homes, as well as farmland and equipment, and killed some of their livestock.
Yoruba: Iná ọ̀hún tún ba ilé àwọn ará wa kan jẹ́, ó tiẹ̀ ba àwọn kan jẹ́ kọjá àtúnṣe, títí kan ilẹ̀ oko wọn àtàwọn irinṣẹ́ wọn, kódà, ó pa lára ẹran ọ̀sìn wọn.

English: Local brothers and sisters have been busy helping one another to clean up the fire damage, removing burned trees and other debris.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ kára láti ran ara wọn lọ́wọ́ kí wọ́n lè palẹ̀ àwọn ohun tí iná jó mọ́, kí wọ́n sì gbé àwọn igi tó ti jóná àtàwọn ìdọ̀tí míì kúrò.

English: A local Disaster Relief Committee was mobilized to provide practical assistance.
Yoruba: A ṣètò Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù sí àgbègbè náà kí wọ́n lè ṣèrànwọ́ fún àwọn tí àjálù ṣẹlẹ̀ sí.

English: Additionally, two members of the Portugal Branch Committee joined local circuit overseers and congregation elders as they visited our brothers and sisters to encourage them.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, méjì lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka lórílẹ̀-èdè Portugal dara pọ̀ mọ́ àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àtàwọn alàgbà ìjọ láti máa bẹ àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin wò kí wọ́n lè fún wọn níṣìírí.

English: We pray that Jehovah continues to surround our brothers in Portugal with the loving support and comfort they need to recover from the extensive fire damage.—Psalm 71:21.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà túbọ̀ jẹ́ ká máa fìfẹ́ ti àwọn ará wa ní Portugal lẹ́yìn, kó sì máa tù wọ́n nínú kí wọ́n lè bọ́ nínú ìṣòro tí iná ọ̀gbálẹ̀-gbáràwé yìí dá sílẹ̀.—Sáàmù 71:21.

English: Local Experience: Mr. Santos was one of the tour bus drivers for the delegates. When the bus captain invited him to the convention, Mr. Santos stated: “I want to go.

English: Ever since I’ve started working with you, I feel such a peace that I can’t describe.

English: He is from a village outside of Lisbon.
Yoruba: Abúlé kan níta ìlú Lisbon ló ti wá.

English: "On Thursday, September 19, 2019, six brothers from the Russian city of Saratov were convicted and sentenced to prison simply for being Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: "Ní Thursday, September 19, 2019, ilé ẹjọ́ dá àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́fà láti ìlú Saratov, ní Rọ́ṣíà lẹ́bi wọ́n sì jù sẹ́wọ̀n, kìkì nítorí pé wọ́n jẹ́ Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.

English: Judge Dmitry Larin of the Leninsky District Court of Saratov sentenced Brother Konstantin Bazhenov and Brother Aleksey Budenchuk to three years and six months in prison; Brother Feliks Makhammadiyev to three years; Brother Roman Gridasov, Brother Gennadiy German, and Brother Aleksey Miretskiy to two years.
Yoruba: Adájọ́ Dmitry Larin ti ilé ẹjọ́ Leninsky District Court of Saratov dájọ́ ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́ta àtààbọ̀ fún Arákùnrin Konstantin Bazhenov àti Arákùnrin Aleksey Budenchuk; ó dá ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́ta fún Arákùnrin Feliks Makhammadiyev; ó sì dá ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún méjì fún Arákùnrin Roman Gridasov, Arákùnrin  Gennadiy German, àti Arákùnrin Aleksey Miretskiy.

English: Additionally, the ruling states that after serving their time in prison, all of the brothers will be banned from holding leadership positions in public organizations for a period of five years.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ilé ẹjọ́ sọ pé lẹ́yìn tí gbogbo wọn bá ṣẹ̀wọ̀n tán, wọn ò ní lé mú ipò iwájú lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ ìjọba èyíkéyìí fún odindi ọdún márùn-ún.

English: The defense intends to appeal the verdict.
Yoruba: Àwọn arákùnrin náà máa pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn lórí ìdájọ́ yìí.

English: Criminal charges were first initiated against the six brothers after Russian authorities raided seven homes of Witnesses in Saratov on June 12, 2018.
Yoruba: Ìgbà táwọn aláṣẹ ya wọ ilé méje táwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí ń gbé nílùú Saratov ní June 12, 2018 ni ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tí wọ́n fi ẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn kan àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́fà yìí.

English: All of the brothers have families, but Brother Budenchuk has two children who are still in school.
Yoruba: Gbogbo àwọn arákùnrin wọ̀nyí ló ní ìdílé, àmọ́ Arákùnrin Budenchuk ní tiẹ̀ ní ọmọ méjì tí wọ́n ṣì wà ní ilé ìwé.

English: Brother Budenchuk, along with Brother Bazhenov and Brother Makhammadiyev, spent almost a year in pretrial detention after their arrest.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Budenchuk, Arákùnrin Bazhenov àti Arákùnrin Makhammadiyev ti lo ohun tó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ọdún kan látìmọ́lé lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n mú wọn kó tó wá di pé wọ́n gbọ́ ẹjọ́ wọn.

English: In their final words to the court, the six brothers quoted several inspiring verses from the Bible and said that they did not harbor animosity toward the prosecution.
Yoruba: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ tí wọ́n sọ gbẹ̀yìn nílé ẹjọ́, àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́fà wọ̀nyí tọ́ka sí ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ẹsẹ Bíbélì amóríyá tó sún wọn láti jẹ́ adúróṣinṣin, wọ́n sì fi kún un pé àwọn ò ní ẹ̀tanú èyíkéyìí sí ẹnikẹ́ni lára àwọn tó fẹ̀sùn kan àwọn.

English: Russia has now convicted and sentenced seven men to prison. Over 250 brothers and sisters in Russia are facing criminal charges, with 41 in detention (pretrial or prison) and 23 under house arrest.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, ìjọba Rọ́ṣíà, ti dá àwọn arákùnrin wa méje lẹ́bi tí wọ́n sì ti jù wọ́n sẹ́wọ̀n. Ó ju igba ó lé àádọ́ta (250) àwọn arákùnrin àti àwọn arábìnrin wa ní Rọ́ṣíà tí wọ́n ti fẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn kàn. Àwọn mọ́kànlélógójì (41) wà ní àtìmọ́lé (ìyẹn àwọn tí wọ́n tì mọ́lé láì tíì gbọ́ ẹjọ́ wọn tàbí àwọn tí wọ́n ti dá lẹ́bi tí wọ́n sì ti jù sẹ́wọ̀n), wọ́n ò sì gbá àwọn mẹ́tàlélógún (23) láyè láti jáde kúrò ní ilé wọn.

English: We pray for all of our faithful and courageous brothers and sisters in Russia that they ‘may be strengthened with all power according to [Jehovah’s] glorious might so that [they] may endure fully with patience and joy.’—Colossians 1:11."
Yoruba: A gbàdúrà fún gbogbo àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa olóòótọ́ àti onígboyà ní Rọ́ṣíà pé ‘kí agbára [Jèhófà] ológo fún [wọn] ní gbogbo agbára tí [wọn] nílò, kí [wọn] lè fara dà á ní kíkún pẹ̀lú sùúrù àti ìdùnnú.’​—Kólósè 1:11."

English: "As was announced on February 6, 2019, the Zheleznodorozhniy District Court of Oryol sentenced Dennis Christensen to six years in prison for engaging in peaceful worship.
Yoruba: "Bá a ṣe sọ nínú ìròyìn tó jáde ní February 6, 2019, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Agbègbè Zheleznodorozhniy nílùú Oryol ti rán Arákùnrin Dennis Christensen lọ sí ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́fà torí pé ó ń jọ́sìn pẹ̀lú àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.

English: The verdict is in the process of being appealed to a higher court.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin náà ti pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn sí ilé ẹjọ́ gíga.

English: The news of Christensen’s six-year sentence immediately provoked an international response.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn kárí ayé ló kọminú sí ẹjọ́ tí wọ́n dá fún arákùnrin wa yìí. Bí àpẹẹrẹ, Ìgbìmọ̀ Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù.

English: Bodies within the Council of Europe, the European Union, the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom, the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, and other organizations have decried Russia’s unjust and unwarranted prosecution of Dennis Christensen.
Yoruba: Àwùjọ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù, Àjọ Orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà Tó Ń Rí sí Òmìnira Ẹ̀sìn Kárí Ayé, Ọ́fíìsì Ọ̀gá Àgbà Àjọ Ìparapọ̀ Orílẹ̀-Èdè Tó Ń Rí sí Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn àti onírúurú àwọn àjọ míì ló ti kéde pé ohun tí ìjọba Rọ́ṣíà ṣe fún Christensen kò bẹ́tọ̀ọ́ mu rárá àti pé wọ́n kàn ń fìyà jẹ aláìṣẹ̀ ni.

English: The U.N. High Commissioner for Human Rights, Michelle Bachelet, issued a statement that said, in part: “The harsh sentence imposed on Christensen creates a dangerous precedent, and effectively criminalizes the right to freedom of religion or belief for Jehovah’s Witnesses in Russia.”
Yoruba: Ọ̀gá Àgbà Àjọ Ìparapọ̀ Orílẹ̀-Èdè Tó Ń Rí sí Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ìyẹn Michelle Bachelet sọ pé: “Ẹjọ́ tí wọ́n dá fún Christensen lè dá wàhálà sílẹ̀ torí pé láti ìsinsìnyí lọ, ilé ẹjọ́ lè fẹ̀sùn ọ̀daràn kan àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ìjọba sọ pé gbogbo èèyàn lómìnira láti ṣe ẹ̀sìn tó wù wọ́n.”

English: She urged the Russian government “to revise the Federal Law on Combating Extremist Activity with a view to clarifying the vague and open-ended definition of ‘extremist activity,’ and ensuring that the definition requires an element of violence or hatred.”
Yoruba: Ó wá gba ìjọba Rọ́ṣíà níyànjú pé kí wọ́n “ṣàyẹ̀wò òfin tó dá lórí Bí Wọ́n Ṣe Lè Gbéjà Ko Àwọn Agbawèrèmẹ́sìn kí wọ́n lè ṣàtúnṣe sí ìtumọ̀ tí wọ́n fún ọ̀rọ̀ náà ‘agbawèrèmẹ́sìn,’ kí wọ́n sì rí i dájú pé àwọn alákatakítí tó ń hùwà jàgídíjàgan ni wọ́n kà sí agbawèrèmẹ́sìn.”

English: Ms. Bachelet concluded by calling on the authorities “to drop charges against and to release all those detained for exercising their rights to freedom of religion or belief, the freedom of opinion and expression, and the right to freedom of peaceful assembly and association.”
Yoruba: Bachelet wá sọ ní ìparí ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ pé kí àwọn aláṣẹ “wọ́gi lé ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kan àwọn tó ń lo òmìnira tí wọ́n ní láti ṣe ẹ̀sìn tó wù wọ́n, àwọn tó lómìnira láti gba ohun tó wù wọ́n gbọ́ àti láti pé jọ ní àlàáfíà, kí wọ́n sì dá àwọn tí wọ́n fi sẹ́wọ̀n sílẹ̀ lómìnira.”

English: Two days after the sentencing of Brother Christensen, four well-known Russian human rights experts organized a press conference in Moscow.
Yoruba: Ọjọ́ méjì lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n dájọ́ Arákùnrin Christensen, àwọn gbajúgbajà mẹ́rin tí wọ́n jẹ́ ajàfẹ́tọ̀ọ́-ọmọnìyàn ní Rọ́ṣíà ṣètò ìpàdé kan pẹ̀lú àwọn oníròyìn nílùú Moscow.

English: The venue was filled to capacity, and over 6,000 people followed the hour-long program that was streamed online.
Yoruba: Èrò kún fọ́fọ́ níbi tí wọ́n ti ṣèpàdé náà, àwọn tó sì lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́fà ló ń wo ètò náà bí wọ́n ṣe ń ṣe é látorí íńtánẹ́ẹ̀tì.

English: All on the panel defended Jehovah’s Witnesses as a peaceful people who pose no threat to society.
Yoruba: Gbogbo àwọn tó sọ̀rọ̀ níbi ìpàdé náà ló gbèjà àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, wọ́n sọ pé èèyàn àlàáfíà ni wọ́n, wọn kì í sì í dá wàhálà sílẹ̀ nílùú.

English: Press conference held in Moscow on February 8, 2019.
Yoruba: Ìpàdé àwọn oníròyìn nílùú Moscow ní February 8, 2019.

English: Also participating in the press conference were Brother Christensen’s wife, Irina; his lawyer, Mr. Anton Bogdanov; and a representative from the European Association of Jehovah’s Witnesses, Yaroslav Sivulskiy.
Yoruba: Lára àwọn tó wà níbi ìpàdé náà ni ìyàwó Arákùnrin Christensen, ìyẹn Irina; agbẹjọ́rò rẹ̀, Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Anton Bogdanov; àti aṣojú Àjọ Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà nílẹ̀ Yúróòpù, ìyẹn Yaroslav Sivulskiy.

English: They made statements regarding the unjust verdict and responded to questions from the press.
Yoruba: Gbogbo wọn ló sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ẹjọ́ àìtọ́ tí wọ́n dá fún Arákùnrin Christensen, wọ́n sì dáhùn ìbéèrè àwọn oníròyìn.

English: Despite being in prison for almost two years, Brother Christensen continues to maintain his joy and his resolve to trust in Jehovah.
Yoruba: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé Arákùnrin Christensen ti fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ lo ọdún méjì lẹ́wọ̀n, ó gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Jèhófà, ó sì ń láyọ̀.

English: Just days before the final verdict, while delivering his final statement to the court, Brother Christensen noted: “The truth sooner or later becomes obvious, and it will be the case in this matter.”
Yoruba: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ àsọkẹ́yìn tó sọ nílé ẹjọ́ ní ọjọ́ díẹ̀ ṣáájú ọjọ́ tí wọ́n dájọ́ rẹ̀, Arákùnrin Christensen sọ pé: “Bópẹ́ bóyá, ohun tó jẹ́ òótọ́ máa hàn kedere, bó sì ṣe máa rí nínú ẹjọ́ yìí náà nìyẹn.”

English: After reading Revelation 21:3-5, he concluded with full conviction: “These words . . . describe the time when God will take care of justice and true freedom for all people.
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn tó ka Ìfihàn 21:3-5, ó fi ìdánilójú sọ pé: “Àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ yìí . . . sọ nípa ìgbà tí Ọlọ́run máa ṣèdájọ́ òdodo, tá a sì fún gbogbo èèyàn ní òmìnira tòótọ́.

English: Freedom and justice are closely related to each other.
Yoruba: Ìdájọ́ òdodo ló ń mú kéèyàn ní òmìnira tòótọ́.

English: God will make sure that all of this will be fulfilled.”
Yoruba: Ọlọ́run á sì rí i dájú pé gbogbo èèyàn rí ìdájọ́ òdodo gbà.”

English: Brother Christensen must await the appeal ruling while in Detention Facility No. 1 in the Oryol Region—where he has been imprisoned for the past 20 months.
Yoruba: Títí dìgbà tí wọ́n máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn, Arákùnrin Christensen ṣì máa wà ní àtìmọ́lé nínú ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n kan ní ìpínlẹ̀ Oryol, níbi tó ti wà láti nǹkan bí ọdún kan àti oṣù mẹ́jọ.

English: We will continue to pray that Jehovah give his unfailing support to Dennis Christensen, his wife, and all of our fellow worshippers throughout Russia.—1 Peter 3:12.
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà wà pẹ̀lú Arákùnrin Dennis Christensen àti ìyàwó rẹ̀. Kó sì tún dúró ti gbogbo àwọn ará wa lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà.—1 Pétérù 3:12.

Yoruba: Máà bínú, ètò tó o fi ń wo fídíò kò ṣiṣẹ́.

Yoruba: Wa Fídíò Yìí Jáde

English: The video Russian Trial Called ‘A Litmus Test For Religious Freedom’ was produced by the international media outlet RFE/RL just days before the verdict was announced."
Yoruba: Nígbà tó ku ọjọ́ díẹ̀ tí wọ́n máa dájọ́ arákùnrin náà, ilé iṣẹ́ agbéròyìnjáde kan, ìyẹn RFE/RL ṣe fídíò kan tí wọ́n pè ní Russian Trial Called ‘A Litmus Test For Religious Freedom’ (ìyẹn, Ìgbẹ́jọ́ Kan ní Rọ́ṣíà Tó Máa Jẹ́ ‘Ìlànà Fáwọn Ẹjọ́ Míì Nípa Òmìnira Ẹ̀sìn’)."

English: "Since April 20, 2017, when the Russian Supreme Court effectively banned the worship of Jehovah’s Witnesses in the country, our brothers and sisters have faced relentless persecution and imprisonment.
Yoruba: "Látìgbà tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ní Rọ́ṣíà ti fòfin de àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ní April 20, 2017, ni wọ́n ti ń ṣenúnibíni sáwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa, tí wọ́n sì ń fi wọ́n sẹ́wọ̀n.

English: Authorities have also progressively seized 131 of the properties owned by Jehovah’s Witnesses, with an additional 60 properties subject to confiscation.
Yoruba: Àtìgbà náà làwọn aláṣẹ ti gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé dúkìá àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tí iye rẹ̀ tó mọ́kànléláàádóje (131).

English: The total value of the properties is estimated to be over $57 million.
Yoruba: Wọ́n sì tún ń sapá láti gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé ọgọ́ta (60) dúkìá míì. Àròpọ̀ gbogbo dúkìá náà ju mílíọ̀nù mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́ta (57) owó dọ́là lọ.

English: One of the seized properties was the former Russia branch complex in Solnechnoye—a property that was owned by the Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society of Pennsylvania.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára ohun ìní tí wọ́n gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé ni ilé Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society of Pennsylvania tó wà ní Solnechnoye, ìyẹn ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Rọ́ṣíà tẹ́lẹ̀.

English: (See picture above on left.)
Yoruba: (wo àwòrán tó wà lókè lápá òsì.)

English: This property alone is valued at about $30 million. An additional 43 of the properties that were seized belong to foreign legal entities existing in Austria, Denmark, Finland, the Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, and the United States.
Yoruba: Tá a bá ṣírò iye tí ilé yìí nìkan jẹ́, ó tó ọgbọ̀n (30) mílíọ̀nù owó dọ́là. Dúkìá mẹ́tàlélógójì (43) míì tí wọ́n gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé jẹ́ ti àjọ ilẹ̀ òkèèrè tá a gbé kalẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin tó wà ní Austria, Denmark, Finland, Netherlands, Nọ́wè, Pọ́túgà, Sípéènì, Sweden, àti Amẹ́ríkà.

English: The seizures are illegal, since the Supreme Court decision banning Jehovah’s Witnesses did not give the government a legal basis for taking foreign-owned properties.
Yoruba: Òótọ́ ni pé Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga ti fòfin dé àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, àmọ́ ìyẹn ò fún ìjọba láṣẹ láti gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé àwọn ohun ìní wa tó jẹ́ ti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè, torí náà bí wọ́n ṣe gba àwọn dúkìá náà kò bófin mu.

English: Jehovah’s Witnesses have filed a claim with the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR) concerning the illegal seizure of the former Russia branch property.
Yoruba: Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ti kọ̀wé sí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù (ECHR) lórí bí ìjọba ṣe gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tá à ń lò ní Rọ́ṣíà tẹ́lẹ̀.

English: Regardless of how the ECHR rules, our trust and confidence are in Jehovah.
Yoruba: Ìpinnu yòówù kí ECHR ṣe, Jèhófà la fọkàn tán, òun la sì gbára lé.

English: We pray that our brothers and sisters in Russia continue to be courageous as they refuse to let raids, arrests, or confiscation of meeting places stop them from worshipping Jehovah “with spirit and truth.”—John 4:23."
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà fún àwọn ará wa ní Rọ́ṣíà lókun kí wọ́n lè máa fìgboyà sin Jèhófà “ní ẹ̀mí àti òtítọ́” láìka bí ìjọba ṣe ń dà wọ́n láàmù, tí wọ́n ń mú wọ́n, tí wọ́n sì ń gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé àwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba wa.​—Jòhánù 4:23."

English: "On November 5, 2019, the Oktyabrsky District Court of Tomsk sentenced Brother Sergey Klimov to six years in prison.
Yoruba: "Ní November 5, 2019, ilé ẹjọ́ àgbègbè Oktyabrsky nílùú Tomsk ju Arákùnrin Sergy Klimov sẹ́wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́fà.

English: Dennis Christensen is the only other brother in Russia to have received a sentence of this length.
Yoruba: Dennis Christensen ni arákùnrin tí wọ́n kọ́kọ́ dá ẹ̀wọ̀n ọlọ́jọ́ gbọọrọ bẹ́ẹ̀ fún.

English: However, in Brother Klimov’s case, the court imposed several additional restrictions, making his the harshest sentence imposed on one of our brothers since the 2017 Supreme Court ban.
Yoruba: Àmọ́, ọ̀rọ̀ arákùnrin Klimov tún wá burú sí i torí pé ọ̀pọ̀ nǹkan ni ilé ẹjọ́ ká a lọ́wọ́ kò pé kò ní lè ṣe, èyí ló mú kí ìdájọ́ tiẹ̀ jẹ́ èyí tó le jù lọ tó tíì wáyé látìgbà tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ti fòfin de iṣẹ́ wa lọ́dún 2017.

English: Brother Klimov was arrested on June 3, 2018, after law enforcement, including special forces, invaded two homes of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: Wọ́n mú arákùnrin Klimov ní June 3, 2018, nígbà táwọn agbófinró àtàwọn ẹ̀ṣọ́ aláàbò ya wọ ilé àwọn Elẹ́rìí Jèhófà méjì.

English: Some 30 brothers and sisters, including an 83-year-old sister, were taken away for questioning.
Yoruba: Nǹkan bí ọgbọ̀n (30) àwọn ará wa ni wọ́n mú kí wọ́n lè fọ̀rọ̀ wá wọn lẹ́nu wò. Kódà wọ́n mú arábìnrin kan tó jẹ́ ẹni ọdún mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́rin (83).

English: All but Brother Klimov were released. Criminal charges were brought against him, and a court ordered that he be placed in pretrial detention for two months.
Yoruba: Wọ́n dá àwọn tó kù sílẹ̀, àfi arákùnrin Klimov. Wọ́n fẹ̀sùn ọ̀daràn kàn án, ilé ẹjọ́ sì pàṣẹ pé kó ṣì wà látìmọ́lé fún oṣú méjì kí wọ́n tó dá ẹjọ́ rẹ̀.

English: His term was extended seven times, meaning that even before beginning his six-year prison sentence, he has been incarcerated—separated from his wife and family—for a year and five months.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀ẹ̀méje ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ ni wọ́n sún ẹjọ́ rẹ̀ síwájú, tó túmọ̀ sí pé kó tó bẹ̀rẹ̀ ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́fà tí wọ́n dá fún un, ó ti lo ọdún kan àti oṣù márùn-ún ní àtìmọ́lé láìfojú kan ìyàwó àti ìdílé rẹ̀.

English: Lawyers for Brother Klimov will appeal his conviction.
Yoruba: Àwọn agbẹjọ́rò tó ń ṣojú fún arákùnrin Klimov máa pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn lórí ẹjọ́ náà.

English: Additionally, on August 20, 2018, the complaint Klimov v. Russia was filed with the European Court of Human Rights regarding his pretrial detention.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ní August 20, 2018, wọ́n gbé ẹjọ́ nípa Klimov àti ilẹ̀ Rọ́ṣíà lọ síwájú Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù lórí bí wọ́n ṣe ń sún àsìkò tí wọ́n fẹ́ fi gbọ́ ẹjọ́ rẹ̀ síwájú.

English: Throughout 2019, we have seen an increase in raids, arrests, and detentions in Russia.
Yoruba: Jálẹ̀ ọdún 2019, iye ilé àwọn ará wa táwọn aláṣẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà lọ fọ́ túbọ̀ pọ̀ sí i, tó fi mọ́ iye àwọn tí wọ́n mú àtàwọn tí wọ́n ń fi sí àtìmọ́lé. Síbẹ̀, ìgbàgbọ́ àwọn ará wa ò mì rárá.

English: Yet, our brothers remain undeterred. We are encouraged by the evidence that Jehovah is blessing our brothers’ full confidence in him.—Psalm 56:1-5, 9."
Yoruba: A ń rí ẹ̀rí tó fi hàn pé Jèhófà ń bù kún àwọn ará wa bí wọ́n ṣe gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé e, ìyẹn sì túbọ̀ ń fún wa níṣìírí.—Sáàmù 56:1-5, 9."

English: "On Thursday, May 16, 2019, the appeal hearing for Dennis Christensen resumed as scheduled.
Yoruba: "Ní Thursday, May 16, 2019, ìgbẹ́jọ́ Dennis Christensen tẹ̀ síwájú gẹ́gẹ́ bí ilé ẹjọ ṣe sọ tẹ́lẹ̀.

English: The prosecutors and defense attorneys delivered their closing arguments, and Dennis was able to speak in his defense for nearly an hour.
Yoruba: Àwọn agbẹjọ́rò ìjọba àtàwọn tó ń gbèjà Dennis fẹnu ọ̀rọ̀ wọn jóná lọ́kọ̀ọ̀kan, wọ́n sì gba Dennis láyè pé kóun náà fi nǹkan bíi wákàtí kan gbèjà ara rẹ̀.

English: Foreign diplomats and journalists were again present—an encouraging indication that, even though it has been two years since Dennis’ arrest made international news, the world remains keenly interested in his case.
Yoruba: Àwọn aṣojú láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè àtàwọn akọ̀ròyìn lóríṣiríṣi wà níbẹ̀, èyí fi hàn pé bó tiẹ̀ ti pọ́dún méjì báyìí tórọ̀ Dennis ti jáde nínú ìròyìn kárí ayé pé wọ́n tì í mọ́lé, àwọn èèyàn káàkiri ayé ṣì fẹ́ mọbi tọ́rọ̀ ẹjọ́ ẹ̀ máa já sí.

English: Originally, the hearing was scheduled to last through Friday, May 17. However, the judges announced they would adjourn until Thursday, May 23 at 10 a.m.
Yoruba: Ètò tí wọ́n kọ́kọ́ ṣe ni pé kí wọ́n parí ìgbẹ́jọ́ náà ní Friday, May 17. Àmọ́, àwọn adájọ́ sún ẹjọ́ náà sí aago mẹ́wàá àárọ̀ Thursday, May 23.

English: Dennis will then be granted his last opportunity to appeal to the court before the judges break to deliberate.
Yoruba: Wọ́n á fún Dennis láyè láti gbèjà ara rẹ̀ níwájú àwọn adájọ́, lẹ́yìn ìyẹn, àwọn adájọ́ náà á foríkorí kí wọ́n lè ṣèpinnu.

English: It is difficult to project whether a decision will be announced by the end of the day on May 23, or if the court will schedule a future date to do so.
Yoruba: A ò tíì lè sọ bóyá May 23 yẹn náà ni ilé ẹjọ́ máa sọ ìpinnu rẹ̀ lórí ọ̀rọ̀ yìí àbí wọ́n máa mú ọjọ́ míì tí wọ́n á sọ ìpinnu tí ilé ẹjọ́ bá ṣe.

English: We take courage when we see our brothers, such as Dennis Christensen and Sergey Skrynnikov, maintain a positive disposition and express their sincere desire to remain faithful.
Yoruba: Bá a ṣe ń rí àwọn ará bíi Dennis Christensen àti Sergey Skrynnikov, tí wọn ò bọkàn jẹ́, tí wọ́n sì ń fi hàn pé àwọn ò ní yẹhùn, àpẹẹrẹ wọn ń fún wa nígboyà.

English: We feel the same way about our fellow Witnesses in Russia as the apostle Paul felt about the Thessalonians when he was inspired to write: “We ourselves take pride in you among the congregations of God because of your endurance and faith in all your persecutions and the hardships that you are suffering.”—2 Thessalonians 1:4."
Yoruba: Ńṣe lohun tá à ń rò nípa àwọn ará wa ní Rọ́síà ṣọ̀kan pẹ̀lú ohun tí àpọ́síltélì Pọ́ọ̀lù sọ nipa àwọn ará Tẹsalóníkà, ó ní: “À ń fi yín yangàn láàárín ìjọ Ọlọ́run nítorí ìfaradà àti ìgbàgbọ́ yín nínú gbogbo inúnibíni àti àwọn ìṣòro tí ẹ̀ ń dojú kọ.”—2 Tẹsalóníkà 1:4."

English: "On March 1, 2019, the Supreme Court of the Republic of Kabardino-Balkaria overturned a lower court’s conviction of Brother Arkadya Akopyan.
Yoruba: "Ní March 1, 2019, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ti Republic of Kabardino-Balkaria wọ́gi lé ìdájọ́ tí ilé ẹjọ́ kan fi dẹ́bi fún Arákùnrin Arkadya Akopyan.

English: He had been on trial for over a year, wrongfully accused of distributing “extremist” literature and ‘inciting religious hatred.’
Yoruba: Ó ti lé lọ́dún kan tí wọ́n ti ń gbọ́ ẹjọ́ rẹ̀, wọ́n fẹ̀sùn èké kàn án pé ó ń pín ìwé “àwọn agbawèrèmẹ́sìn,” ó sì ń ‘rúná sí ìkórìíra ẹ̀sìn.’

English: Previously, a lower court sentenced 70-year-old Brother Akopyan to perform community service. This recent Supreme Court ruling dismissed the lower court’s sentence.
Yoruba: Ilé ẹjọ́ kan ti kọ́kọ́ sọ pé kí Arákùnrin Akopyan, ẹni àádọ́rin (70) ọdún lọ ṣe iṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú. Àmọ́ ìdájọ́ tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ṣe yìí wọ́gi lé ìdájọ́ ti tẹ́lẹ̀.

English: We thank Jehovah for this victory as we rejoice with Brother Akopyan. We continue to pray that our brothers will faithfully endure.—2 Thessalonians 1:4."
Yoruba: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà tó mú ká borí nínú ẹjọ́ yìí, a sì bá Arákùnrin Akopyan yọ̀. Àdúrà wa ni pé kí àwọn ará wa máa fi ìṣòtítọ́ fara dà á nìṣó.—2 Tẹsalóníkà 1:4."

English: On December 13, 2019, Brother Vladimir Alushkin was convicted and sentenced to six years in prison.
Yoruba: Ní December 13, 2019, ilé ẹjọ́ dá ẹjọ́ Arákùnrin Vladimir Alushkin, wọ́n sì rán an lọ sí ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́fà.

English: He was immediately handcuffed and taken into custody.
Yoruba: Ojú ẹsẹ̀ níbẹ̀ ni wọ́n ti fí ṣẹkẹ́ṣẹkẹ̀ sí i lọ́wọ́ tí wọ́n sì mú un lọ.

English: Brother Alushkin will appeal the conviction.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Alushkin máa pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn lórí ìdájọ́ yìí.

English: "As of today, Brother Dennis Christensen has endured three years of unjust imprisonment in Russia.
Yoruba: "Bá a se ń sọ̀rọ̀ yìí, ó ti tó ọdún mẹ́ta tí wọ́n ti fi Arákùnrin Dennis Christensen sẹ́wọ̀n lọ́nà àìtọ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà.

English: Since his arrest on May 25, 2017, some friends have asked Brother Christensen how this tribulation has affected his faith.
Yoruba: Láti May 25, 2017 ni wọ́n ti mú Arákùnrin Christensen, àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ rẹ̀ kan béèrè lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ nípa bí gbogbo wàhálà tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ sí i yìí ṣe ń nípa lórí ìgbàgbọ́ rẹ̀.

English: His answer has remained the same: “My faith has become only stronger.”
Yoruba: Ohun kan náà ló ṣì fi ń dáhùn látìgbà yẹn: “Ṣe ni ìgbàgbọ́ mi ń lágbára sí i.”

English: Brother Christensen relates: “I have experienced what is written in the Bible book of James chapter 1, verses 2 to 3: ‘Consider it all joy, my brothers, when you meet with various trials, knowing as you do that this tested quality of your faith produces endurance.’”
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Christensen sọ pé: “Ohun tó wà nínú ìwé Jémíìsì orí kìíní ẹsẹ kejì sí ìkẹta ti ṣẹ sí mi lára, èyí tó sọ pé: ‘Ẹ̀yin ará mi, tí oríṣiríṣi àdánwò bá dé bá yín, ẹ ka gbogbo rẹ̀ sí ayọ̀, kí ẹ mọ̀ pé ìgbàgbọ́ yín tí a dán wò ní ti bó ṣe jẹ́ ojúlówó tó máa mú kí ẹ ní ìfaradà.’ ”

English: Remarkably, Brother Christensen’s faith, and even his joy, has grown amidst increasing hardships and disappointments.
Yoruba: Ó wú wa lórí láti mọ̀ pé láìka gbogbo ìṣòro àti ìjákulẹ̀ tí Arákùnrin Christensen ti kojú sí, ńṣe ni ìgbàgbọ́ rẹ̀ ń lágbára sí i, tí inú rẹ̀ sì ń dùn.

English: Immediately after his arrest, Brother Christensen was placed in a pretrial detention facility not far from his home in Oryol.
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn tí ìjọba mú Arákùnrin Christensen, kó tó di pé wọ́n mú un lọ sílé ẹjọ́, wọ́n fi sí àtìmọ́lé níbì kan tí kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ jìnnà sí ilé rẹ̀ ní ìlú Oryol.

English: In time, his wife, Irina, was granted permission to visit.
Yoruba: Kò pẹ́ sígbà yẹn, wọ́n gbà Irina ìyàwó rẹ̀ láyè láti máa wá bẹ̀ ẹ́ wò.

English: Brother Christensen remained in pretrial detention for just over two years.
Yoruba: Ó lé ní ọdún méjì tí wọ́n fi ti Arákùnrin Christensen mọ́lé láì tíì gbọ́ ẹjọ́ rẹ̀.

English: In February 2019, Brother Christensen was sentenced to six years in prison. Three months later, his appeal was denied.
Yoruba: Ní February 2019, wọ́n dájọ́ ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́fà fún Arákùnrin Christensen. Oṣù mẹ́ta lẹ́yìn náà, ó pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn, àmọ́ wọn ò gbà á láyè.

English: He was subsequently transferred to a prison some 200 kilometers (124 mi) away from Oryol, further distancing him from Irina.
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn náà wọ́n gbé e lọ sí ẹ̀wọ̀n míì tó jìnnà tó máìlì mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́fà [124] (200km) sí ìlú Oryol tí ìyàwó rẹ̀ wà, èyí sì mú kí ibi táwọn méjèèjì wà túbọ̀ jìnnà síra.

English: For almost a year now, Brother Christensen has qualified to apply for early release, three of his four applications have been denied.
Yoruba: Ó ti fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ọdún kan báyìí tí Arákùnrin Christensen ti lẹ́tọ̀ọ́ láti béèrè pé kí wọ́n dá òun sílẹ̀ lẹ́wọ̀n, ó sì ti ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ lẹ́ẹ̀mẹrin ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀, àmọ́ ẹ̀ẹ̀mẹta ni ìjọba ti dá a lóhùn pé kò ṣeé ṣe.

English: Despite these reasons for disappointment, Brother Christensen remains steadfast.
Yoruba: Láìka gbogbo ìjákulẹ̀ yìí sí, Arákùnrin Christensen kò jẹ́ kí ìgbàgbọ́ rẹ̀ nínú Ọlọ́run dín kù.

English: Brother Christensen humbly admits: “Irina and I are far from perfect, but we have learned to endure and to stay joyful under trial.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Christensen sọ pé: “Èmi àti Irina ìyàwó mi kì í ṣe eni pípé, àmọ́ a ti kọ́ bá a ṣe lè ní ìfaradà, ká má sì jẹ́ kí ayọ̀ wa dín kù nínú ìṣòro.

English: And what is most important is that we have drawn even closer to our God and Father, Jehovah.”
Yoruba: Ohun tó wá ṣe pàtàkì jù ni pé, a ti túbọ̀ sún mọ́ Bàbá wa àti Ọlọ́run wa, Jèhófà.”

English: We pray in full confidence that Jehovah will continue to help all of our dear brothers and sisters in Russia to keep enduring persecution with joy.—Matthew 5:11, 12."
Yoruba: A ò dáwọ́ àdúrà dúró, a sì gbà pé Jèhófà á máa báa lọ láti ṣèrànwọ́ fáwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa ní Rọ́ṣíà, kí wọ́n lè máa láyọ̀ bí wọ́n ṣe ń fara da inúnibíni.​—Mátíù 5:​11, 12."

English: On Thursday, May 3, 2018, at 11:30 a.m., the Saint Petersburg City Court will hear our appeal against the December 2017 ruling that would allow authorities to confiscate our former branch facilities in Russia.
Yoruba: Ní Thursday, May 3, 2018, ní aago mọ́kànlá ààbọ̀ àárọ̀, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Saint Petersburg máa gbọ́ ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn tá a pè lórí ẹjọ́ tí ilé ẹjọ́ dá fún wa ní December 2017 pé kí àwọn aláṣẹ gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé àwọn ilé tá à ń lò fún ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa tẹ́lẹ̀ ní Rọ́ṣíà.

English: If the appeal is denied, the 14-building complex can be immediately confiscated by the State.
Yoruba: Tí wọn ò bá gba ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn tá a pè wọlé, ìjọba lè gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé gbogbo ilé ńlá mẹ́rìnlá (14) tó wà ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì náà lójú ẹsẹ̀.

English: "NEW YORK—The Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses arranged for a delegation of brothers from three continents to travel to Moscow to demonstrate the global support for the brothers and sisters in Russia.
Yoruba: "NEW YORK—Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ṣètò pé káwọn arákùnrin láti ilẹ̀ mẹ́ta ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ lágbàáyé rìnrìn àjò lọ sílùú Moscow láti ṣojú ẹgbẹ́ ará, kí wọ́n lè jẹ́ káwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa ní Rọ́ṣíà mọ̀ pé gbogbo àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kárí ayé la wà lẹ́yìn wọn.

English: When the delegation arrived, they were met by the happy faces of their Russian brothers and sisters, some of whom traveled to Moscow from as far away as Siberia.
Yoruba: Nígbà táwọn aṣojú náà dé sí Rọ́ṣíà, tayọ̀tayọ̀ làwọn ará lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin lọ pàdé wọn, Sàìbéríà lọ́hùn-ún lọ́hùn-ún làwọn kan tiẹ̀ ti rìnrìn àjò wá sí Moscow.

English: The delegates assured the Russian brothers and sisters of their intense concern for them and the heartfelt prayers of the worldwide brotherhood.
Yoruba: Àwọn aṣojú náà fi dá àwọn ará ní Rọ́ṣíà lójú pé ọ̀rọ̀ wọn ń ká àwọn lára gan-an, àwọn ará kárí ayé ò sì dákẹ́ àdúrà lórí wọn.

English: One member of the delegation stated: “I was truly moved by the courageous attitude of my Russian brothers, especially as there was very little expectation of a reversal of the unjust decision to ban their activity.”
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn aṣojú náà sọ pé: “Ìgboyà táwọn ará mi ní Rọ́ṣíà ní wú mi lórí gan-an, torí wọn ò tiẹ̀ fi gbogbo ara retí pé ilé ẹjọ́ máa yí ẹjọ́ tí kò tọ́ tí wọ́n dá pa dà pé àwọn fòfin de iṣẹ́ wọn.”

English: Despite the negative decision by the three-judge panel, an atmosphere of genuine love and unity pervaded the courtroom.
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ibi pẹlẹbẹ lọ̀bẹ tún fi lélẹ̀ nígbà tí ìgbìmọ̀ ẹlẹ́ni mẹ́ta tún ẹjọ́ náà gbọ́, ṣe làwọn ará ṣera wọn lọ́kan nínú ilé ẹjọ́ náà, wọ́n sì ń fìfẹ́ tòótọ́ hàn síra wọn.

English: There was deep sadness at hearing Jehovah’s name reproached in such a public setting and a sober awareness that a time of testing lies ahead for the Witnesses in Russia.
Yoruba: Ìbànújẹ́ dorí wọn kodò nígbà tí wọ́n gbọ́ bí àwọn èèyàn ṣe pẹ̀gàn orúkọ Jèhófà ní gbangba bẹ́ẹ̀, tí wọ́n sì mọ̀ pé àdánwò ìgbàgbọ́ ló délẹ̀ fáwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ní Rọ́ṣíà yìí.

English: Yet, the dignity and affection displayed by the brothers and sisters in the courtroom was sufficient evidence to refute the erroneous charge of “extremism” upheld by the appeal judges.
Yoruba: Síbẹ̀, báwọn ará ṣe fìfẹ́ hàn nílé ẹjọ́ lọ́jọ́ yẹn, tí wọ́n sì hùwà tọ̀wọ̀tọ̀wọ̀ ti tó láti ṣe ẹ̀rí pé irọ́ gbuu ni ẹ̀sùn “agbawèrèmẹ́sìn” tí wọ́n fi kan àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, táwọn adájọ́ tó tún ẹjọ́ gbọ́ náà fọwọ́ sí.

English: Mark Sanderson, a member of the Governing Body, led the delegation.
Yoruba: Mark Sanderson, tó jẹ́ ara Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí, ló ṣáájú àwọn ará tó rìnrìn àjò wá sí Rọ́ṣíà.

English: He warmly encouraged the brothers to “be strong and courageous” in the days ahead.
Yoruba: Ó fìfẹ́ gbé àwọn ará ró, ó ní kí wọ́n “jẹ́ alágbára àti onígboyà” bí wọ́n ṣe ń retí àwọn ohun tó máa ṣẹlẹ̀.

English: As the visiting brothers left the courtroom, the local Witnesses embraced them and expressed appreciation for their support on this historic occasion.
Yoruba: Nígbà táwọn aṣojú yìí ń kúrò nílé ẹjọ́, ṣe làwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó ń gbé ní Rọ́ṣíà ń dì mọ́ wọn, tí wọ́n sì ń sọ pé àwọn mọyì bí wọ́n ṣe wá ti àwọn lẹ́yìn lórí ọ̀rọ̀ pàtàkì tó wà nílẹ̀ yìí.

English: The delegation also visited 21 embassies in Moscow to provide accurate information about the negative effects of Russia’s attack on Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: Àwọn aṣojú náà tún dé àwọn ọ́fíìsì aṣojú ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè mọ́kànlélógún [21] tó wà nílùú Moscow kí wọ́n lè ṣe ẹ̀kúnrẹ́rẹ́ àlàyé fún wọn nípa bí inúnibíni tí àwọn aláṣẹ Rọ́ṣíà ń ṣe yìí ṣe ń nípa lórí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.

English: These include cases of arson on homes of Witnesses, jobs lost, harassment of children at schools, and criminal charges for organizing Christian meetings against several elders, including Brother Dennis Christensen, who remains in pre-trial detention.
Yoruba: Bí àpẹẹrẹ, àwọn èèyàn ń dáná sun ilé wọn, iṣẹ́ ń bọ́ lọ́wọ́ wọn, wọ́n ń halẹ̀ mọ́ àwọn ọmọ Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà níléèwé, wọ́n sì ń fẹ̀sùn kan àwọn alàgbà ìjọ pé wọ́n ń ṣètò ìpàdé pẹ̀lú àwọn ará wọn, arákùnrin Dennis Christensen wà lára àwọn alàgbà yìí, ó ṣì wà látìmọ́lé di báyìí.

English: A number of ambassadors were visibly moved by a two-minute video that summarized these events.
Yoruba: Àwọn aṣojú náà fi fídíò oníṣẹ̀ẹ́jú méjì kan tó ṣàlàyé ọ̀rọ̀ yìí ní ṣókí han àwọn aṣojú ìjọba.

English: The most common question asked by officials was, ‘Why Jehovah’s Witnesses?’
Yoruba: Ìbéèrè tí ọ̀pọ̀ nínú àwọn aláṣẹ náà ń béèrè ni pé, ‘Ó ṣe wá jẹ́ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà?’

English: In answer, our brothers gave a powerful witness by explaining that individuals of our organization are politically neutral and our preaching activity has positively changed the lives of many Russians.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará wa wá fìyẹn jẹ́rìí lọ́nà tó wọni lọ́kàn, wọ́n ṣàlàyé pé àwọn ará wa kì í dá sí òṣèlú, iṣẹ́ ìwàásù tá à ń ṣe sì ti yí ìgbésí ayé ọ̀pọ̀ nínú àwọn ọmọ ilẹ́ Rọ́ṣíà pa dà sí rere.

English: One ambassador responded: “The Orthodox Church does not like you fishing in their waters.”
Yoruba: Aṣojú kan sọ pé: “Ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì Ọ́tọ́dọ́ọ̀sì fẹ́ kẹ́ ẹ wá ọmọlẹ́yìn tiyín síwájú ni, wọn ò fẹ́ kẹ́ ẹ gba àwọn ọmọ ìjọ wọn.”

English: More than ten embassies sent representatives to the court hearing and stayed for the entire 8-hour duration.
Yoruba: Ó lé ní mẹ́wàá nínú àwọn aṣojú ìjọba náà tó rán aṣojú lọ sílé ẹjọ́ kí wọ́n lè wà níbi ìgbẹ́jọ́ náà, wọn ò sì kúrò níbẹ̀ jálẹ̀ wákàtí mẹ́jọ tí ilé ẹjọ́ fi gbọ́ ẹjọ́ náà.

English: The international delegation of brothers left Russia with their faith strengthened, heartened by their Russian brothers’ determination to remain loyal and the opportunity to give an effective witness to officials.
Yoruba: Nígbà tí àwọn arákùnrin káàkiri ayé tó wá sí Rọ́ṣíà fi máa kúrò níbẹ̀, ìgbàgbọ́ wọn ti lágbára sí i, bí àwọn ará wọn ní Rọ́ṣíà ṣe pinnu pé àwọn ò ní fi Jèhófà sílẹ̀ gbé wọn ró gan-an, inú wọn sì dùn pé àwọn láǹfààní láti jẹ́rìí fáwọn aláṣẹ lọ́nà tó gbéṣẹ́.

English: Media Contact:
Yoruba: Agbẹnusọ fún Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà:

English: Office of Public Information
Yoruba: Ọ́fíìsì Agbéròyìnjáde

English: "Two of the brothers recently placed under house arrest with their attorneys. Pictured from left to right: attorney Vitaly Svintsov, Vladimir Kochnev, Aleksandr Suvorov, and attorney Egiazar Chernikov.
Yoruba: "Méjì lára àwọn arákùnrin tí wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n jáde nílé rèé pẹ̀lú àwọn agbẹjọ́rò wọn. Láti ọwọ́ òsì sí ọ̀tún: agbẹjọ́rò Vitaly Svintsov, Vladimir Kochnev, Aleksandr Suvorov àti agbẹjọ́rò Egiazar Chernikov.

English: On August 3, 2018, Judge Inna Yangubayeva of the Leninsky District Court of Orenburg, Russia, ruled to place Brothers Vladimir Kochnev and Aleksandr Suvorov under house arrest after they had each been imprisoned for 78 days.
Yoruba: Ní August 3, 2018, Adájọ́ Inna Yangubayeva tó wà ní Ilé Ẹjọ́ Agbègbè Leninsky ti ìlú Orenburg, lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́síà, dájọ́ pé kí wọ́n má jẹ́ kí Arákùnrin Vladimir Kochnev àti Arákùnrin Aleksandr Suvorov jáde nílé wọn mọ́, bẹ́ẹ̀ ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan àwọn arákùnrin yìí ti lo ọjọ́ méjìdínlọ́gọ́rin (78) lẹ́wọ̀n.

English: On that same day at the Magadan Regional Court, Brother Konstantin Petrov was also placed under house arrest after being imprisoned for 64 days.
Yoruba: Lọ́jọ́ kan náà, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Agbègbè Magadan ní kí wọ́n má jẹ́ kí Arákùnrin Konstantin Petrov jáde nílé mọ́, bẹ́ẹ̀ òun náà ti lo ọjọ́ mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́ta (64) látìmọ́lé.

English: While we are thankful that our three brothers are no longer imprisoned, their trials are still pending, and if convicted, they could be sentenced for up to ten years in prison.
Yoruba: A dúpẹ́ pé àwọn ará wa mẹ́tẹ̀ẹ̀ta yìí ò sí lẹ́wọ̀n mọ́, àmọ́ ẹjọ́ wọn ò tíì parí, tí wọ́n bá sì dá wọn lẹ́bi, wọ́n lè rán wọn lọ́ sẹ́wọ̀n nǹkan bí ọdún mẹ́wàá.

English: As of August 16, there are 9 Witnesses under house arrest and 25 imprisoned throughout Russia.
Yoruba: Títi di August 16, àwọn ará wa mẹ́sàn-án ni wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n jáde nílé mọ́, àwọn mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n (25) sì wà lẹ́wọ̀n káàkiri ilẹ̀ Rọ́ṣíà.

English: Another 30 brothers and sisters have been made to sign a document preventing them from leaving their hometowns without obtaining permission from local authorities.
Yoruba: Àwọn ọgbọ̀n (30) míì tún wà lára àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin tí wọ́n ti mú kí wọ́n tọwọ́ bọ̀wé pé wọn ò gbọ́dọ̀ jáde nílé wọn láìgba àyè lọ́dọ̀ àwọn aláṣẹ ìlú.

English: We continue to pray for our brothers and sisters who are facing formidable circumstances in Russia.—2 Corinthians 1:11."
Yoruba: Ẹ jẹ́ ká máa gbàdúrà fún àwọn ará wa tó ń kojú wàhálà tó bani lẹ́rù yìí nílẹ̀ Rọ́ṣíà.​—2 Kọ́ríńtì 1:11."

English: "On May 23, 2019, a three-judge panel of the Oryol Regional Court denied Dennis Christensen’s appeal and upheld the six-year prison sentence he previously received.
Yoruba: "Ní May 23, 2019, àwọn adájọ́ mẹ́ta ní Ilé Ẹjọ́ Agbègbè Oryol dá Dennis Christensen lẹ́bi nínú ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn tó pè torí bí ilé ẹjọ́ kan ṣe rán an lẹ́wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́fà. Nǹkan bí ọgọ́rin (80) àwọn ará ló wá síbi ìgbẹ́jọ́ náà.

English: About 80 of our brothers and sisters attended the court proceedings.
Yoruba: Àwọn aṣojú láti orílẹ̀-èdè Ọsirélíà àti Denmark náà wà níbẹ̀.

English: Officials from Australia and Denmark were also present.
Yoruba: Àwọn ilé iṣé tó ń gbéròyìn jáde kárí ayé sì ti ń sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ìdájọ́ tí ilé ẹjọ́ ṣe yìí.

English: The results of this case are already being reported on by international media outlets.
Yoruba: Oṣù February ni ilé ẹjọ́ rán Arákùnrin Christensen lẹ́wọ̀n.

English: Over the past three months since Brother Christensen’s original sentencing in February, there have been 115 home raids and three times as many criminal cases initiated against Jehovah’s Witnesses compared to the previous three months.
Yoruba: Lááàrín oṣù mẹ́ta tó kọjá yìí, ìgbà márùndínlọ́gọ́fà (115) làwọn aláṣẹ ya wọ ilé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, kódà iye ìgbà tí wọ́n fẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn kàn wọ́n ti fi ìlọ́po mẹ́ta pọ̀ sí i tá a bá fi wé ti oṣù mẹ́ta tó ṣáájú.

English: Our prayers are with Brother Christensen and all of our fellow believers in Russia.
Yoruba: À ń rántí Arákùnrin Christensen àtàwọn ará wa ní Rọ́ṣíà nínú àdúrà.

English: We are confident that Jehovah “is near to all those calling on him” and will continue to help our brothers remain resolute in the face of persecution—Psalm 145:18."
Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà “wà nítòsí gbogbo àwọn tó ń ké pè é,” kò sì ní yéé ran àwọn ará wa lọ́wọ́ kí wọ́n lè dúró láìyẹhùn lójú inúnibíní—Sáàmù 145:18."

English: "Brother Boris Burylov, aged 78, faces “extremism” charges in the city of Perm’
Yoruba: "Arákùnrin Boris Burylov, ẹni ọdún méjìdínlọ́gọ́rin (78) tí wọ́n fẹ̀sùn kàn pé ó jẹ́ agbawèrèmẹ́sìn ní ìlú Perm’

English: In May 2019, authorities from the Arkhangel’sk and Volgograd regions of Russia opened criminal cases against two of our elderly sisters.
Yoruba: Ní May 2019, àwọn aláṣẹ agbègbè Arkhangel’sk àti Volgograd lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà fẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn kan arábìnrin wa méjì tó jẹ́ àgbàlagbà.

English: Sister Kaleriya Mamykina, shown above, and Sister Valentina Makhmadgaeva, 78 and 71 years old respectively, are being investigated for “extremist” activity simply for being Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Yoruba: Ìwádìí ń lọ lọ́wọ́ lórí Arábìnrin Kaleriya Mamykina, ẹni ọdún méjìdínlọ́gọ́rin (78) tí àwòrán rẹ̀ wà lókè àti Arábìnrin Valentina Makhmadgaeva, ẹni ọdún mọ́kànléláàádọ́rin (71), wọ́n fẹ̀sùn kàn wọ́n pé wọ́n jẹ́ agbawèrèmẹ́sìn torí pé Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ni wọ́n.

English: In April 2018, authorities in the city of Vladivostok brought criminal charges against 84-year-old Sister Yelena Zayshchuk, along with four other Witnesses.
Yoruba: Ní April 2018, àwọn aláṣẹ ìlú Vladivostok fẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn kan Arábìnrin Yelena Zayshchukbrought, ẹni ọdún mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́rin (84) pẹ̀lú àwọn mẹ́rin míì tó jẹ́ Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.

English: There are now a total of ten brothers and sisters over the age of 70 facing criminal prosecution in Russia for their peaceful worship.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí mẹ́wàá nínú àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin tí wọ́n ti lé lẹ́ni àádọ́rin (70) ọdún ló ń jẹ́jọ́ lórí ẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn torí pé wọ́n ń jọ́sìn Ọlọ́run láìda ẹnikẹ́ni láàmú lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́síà.

English: Although none of these older ones are in detention, the situation is no doubt extremely stressful for them.
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kò sí ìkankan nínú wọn látìmọ́lé, kò rọrùn fún wọn rárá torí ara tó ti ń dara àgbà.

English: If the investigations continue and the courts find them guilty, they could face heavy fines or imprisonment.
Yoruba: Tí ìwádìí náà bá ṣì ń bá a lọ, tí ilé ẹjọ́ sì dá wọn lẹ́bi, wọ́n lè bu owó ìtánràn lù wọ́n tàbí kí wọ́n rán wọn lẹ́wọ̀n.

English: As of June 17, 2019, the number of our brothers facing unjustified criminal charges has reached 215.
Yoruba: Títí di June 17, 2019, iye àwọn ará wa tí wọ́n ń jẹ́jọ́ lórí ẹ̀sùn èké ìwà ọdaràn tí wọ́n fi kàn wọ́n jẹ́ igba ó lé mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún (215).

English: That figure is still increasing.
Yoruba: Ńṣe ni iye wọn sì ń pọ̀ sí i.

English: May we keep all of our brothers and sisters in Russia in our prayers, at times specifically mentioning them by name.
Yoruba: Ẹ jẹ́ ká máa rántí gbogbo àwọn ará wa ní Rọ́síà nínú àdúrà wa, ká sì máa dárúkọ wọn ní pàtó.

English: We are confident that Jehovah will continue to strengthen them “with all power according to his glorious might” so that they “may endure fully with patience and joy.”—Colossians 1:11."
Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà á máa mú kí ‘agbára rẹ̀ ológo fún wọn ní gbogbo agbára tí wọ́n nílò, kí wọ́n lè fara dà á ní kíkún pẹ̀lú sùúrù àti ìdùnnú.’​—Kólósè 1:11."

English: "On March 25, 2020, the Penza Regional Court overturned the conviction of Brothers Vladimir Alushkin, Vladimir Kulyasov, Andrey Magliv, and Denis Timoshin, as well as Sisters Tatyana Alushkina and Galiya Olkhova.
Yoruba: "Ní March 25, 2020, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Kòtẹ́milọ́rùn tó wà nílùú Penza fagi lé ìpinnu tí ilé ẹjọ́ kan ṣe níbi ìgbẹ́jọ́ Arákùnrin Vladimir Alushkin, Vladimir Kulyasov, Andrey Magliv àti Arákùnrin Denis Timoshin pa pọ̀ pẹ̀lú Arábìnrin Tatyana Alushkina àti Galiya Olkhova.

English: Their cases will be sent for retrial.
Yoruba: Torí náà, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Kòtẹ́milọ́rùn dá ẹjọ́ náà pa dà sí ilé ẹjọ́ àkọ́kọ́ pé kí wọ́n tún ẹjọ́ náà gbọ́.

English: As a result of winning the appeal, Brother Alushkin will be released from prison in the coming days.
Yoruba: Bọ́rọ̀ ṣe rí yìí, ó ṣe kedere pé lọ́jọ́ mélòó kan sí i, wọ́n máa dá Arákùnrin Alushkin sílẹ̀ lẹ́wọ̀n.

English: He and the others will remain under travel and other restrictions as they await retrial."
Yoruba: Àmọ́ títí dìgbà tí wọ́n máa tún ẹjọ́ náà gbọ́, òun àtàwọn yòókù rẹ̀ kò ní lè rìnrìn-àjò, wọ́n sì tún máa fi àwọn ẹ̀tọ́ kan dù wọ́n."

English: "The case against Dennis Christensen, held at the Zheleznodorozhniy District Court of Oryol, has concluded, and the judge has scheduled the verdict to be issued on Wednesday, February 6, 2019.
Yoruba: "Ilé Ẹjọ́ Agbègbè Zheleznodorozhniy tó wà ní ìlú Oryol ti parí gbígbọ́ ẹjọ́ Dennis Christensen, adájọ́ sì máa sọ ìdájọ́ rẹ̀ ní Wednesday, February 6, 2019.

English: Brother Christensen has been detained since his arrest on May 25, 2017. His criminal trial began on February 19, 2018.
Yoruba: Àtìgbà tí wọ́n ti mú Arákùnrin Christensen ní May 25, 2017 ló ti wà látìmọ́lé. Wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í gbọ́ ẹjọ́ ẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn tí wọ́n fi kàn án ní February 19, 2018.

English: If convicted, the prosecution has requested that Brother Christensen be imprisoned for six and a half years.
Yoruba: Tí ilé ẹjọ́ bá dá Arákùnrin Christensen lẹ́bi, àwọn tó fẹ̀sùn kàn án ti sọ pé kí wọ́n rán an lẹ́wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́fà àtààbọ̀.

English: Despite being imprisoned for over 20 months, Brother Christensen has remained in good spirits, fully trusting in Jehovah and grateful for the prayers of the worldwide brotherhood.—2 Thessalonians 3:1, 2."
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ó ti lé ní ogún (20) oṣù tí Arákùnrin Christensen ti wà lẹ́wọ̀n, kò bọkàn jẹ́, ó gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Jèhófà ó sì mọyì àdúrà táwọn ará kárí ayé ń gbà fún òun.—2 Tẹsalóníkà 3:1, 2."

English: "On February 6, 2019, a Russian court announced that Dennis Christensen is guilty of “organizing the activity of an extremist organization.”
Yoruba: "Ní February 6, 2019, ilé ẹjọ́ kan lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà dá Dennis Christensen lẹ́bi pé ó “ń ṣètò iṣẹ́ àjọ àwọn agbawèrèmẹ́sìn.”

English: He has been sentenced to six years in prison.
Yoruba: Wọ́n sì rán an lẹ́wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́fà.

English: The unjust verdict, which has already received international attention, will be appealed.
Yoruba: Àwọn oníròyìn láwọn ilẹ̀ míì ti sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ẹjọ́ tí kò tọ́ yìí, a sì máa pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn.

English: We will pray for Dennis Christensen and his wife, Irina, and our many brothers and sisters in Russia as they continue to ‘keep calm and show trust’ in Jehovah.—Isaiah 30:15."
Yoruba: A ò ní dákẹ́ àdúrà fún Dennis Christensen àti ìyàwó rẹ̀, Irina pẹ̀lú ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ará wa ní Rọ́ṣíà bí wọ́n ṣe ‘fara balẹ̀, tí wọ́n sì gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé’ Jèhófà.—Àìsáyà 30:15."

English: On June 23, 2020, the Lgovskiy District Court in the Kursk Region granted Brother Dennis Christensen early release.
Yoruba: Ní June 23, 2020, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Agbègbè Lgovskiy tó wà ní Kursk dá Arákùnrin Dennis Christensen sílẹ̀ kí ọdún tí wọ́n ní kó lò lẹ́wọ̀n tó pé.

English: At the prosecution’s request, the judge mitigated the remainder of Brother Christensen’s sentence to a fine of 400,000 rubles ($5,759 U.S.).
Yoruba: Àwọn tó pe ẹjọ́ náà ní kí adájọ́ gba owó ìtanràn lọ́wọ́ Arákùnrin Christensen dípò ọdún tó kù tó yẹ kó lò lẹ́wọ̀n, adájọ́ wá ní kó san nǹkan bíi mílíọ̀nù méjì ààbọ̀ náírà (ìyẹn $5,759 owó Dọ́là).

English: The decision will take effect in ten days, after which he will be able to go home to his wife, family, and fellow worshippers.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀yìn ọjọ́ mẹ́wàá tí wọ́n kéde ìdájọ́ yìí ni Arákùnrin Christensen tó máa làǹfààní láti lọ bá ìyàwó rẹ̀, àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí àtàwọn míì tí wọ́n jọ ń sin Jèhófà.

English: All praise goes to Jehovah!
Yoruba: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà fún àṣeyọrí yìí!

English: On February 18, 2020, the Zheleznodorozhniy District Court in Khabarovsk, Russia, convicted Brother Yevgeniy Aksenov and gave him a two-year suspended prison sentence.
Yoruba: Ní February 18, 2020, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Zheleznodorozhniy District Court tó wà ní ìlú Khabarovsk lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà kéde pé Arákùnrin Yevgeniy Aksenov jẹ̀bi, wọ́n sì dájọ́ ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún méjì fún un.

English: If during those two years, Brother Aksenov changes his place of residence or is found guilty of any criminal activity, he will be sent to prison.
Yoruba: Lóòótọ́ kò ní lọ sẹ́wọ̀n báyìí, àmọ́ ṣe ni wọ́n á máa ṣọ́ ọ lọ́wọ́-lẹ́sẹ̀. Tí Arákùnrin Aksenov bá kó kúrò níbi tó ń gbé, tàbí tó jẹ̀bi ẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn èyíkéyìí míì láàárín ọdún méjì náà, wọ́n máa fi sẹ́wọ̀n.

English: For the first six months of his term, he is on probation and must register with the local authorities monthly.
Yoruba: Fún oṣù mẹ́fà àkọ́kọ́, wọ́n á máa ṣọ́ ọ bóyá ó ń tẹ̀ lé ìtọ́ni ilé-ẹjọ́, á sì máa fara han àwọn aláṣẹ agbègbè náà lóṣooṣù.

English: Additionally, for the duration of his probation, he cannot travel outside of his home city of Khabarovsk and he is not allowed to leave his home in the evenings. Brother Aksenov will appeal his conviction.
Yoruba: Ní àfikún, ní àkókò tó fi wà lábẹ́ ìkálọ́wọ́kò náà, kò gbọdọ̀ jáde kúrò ní Khabarovsk tó jẹ́ ìlú ẹ̀, kò sì gbọdọ̀ jáde kúrò nínú ilé ẹ̀ lálẹ́. Arákùnrin Aksenov máa pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn lórí ìdájọ́ yìí.

English: "Just nine days after Dennis Christensen was unjustly convicted in a Russian court, at least seven of Jehovah’s Witnesses were subjected to physical abuse—electric shocks, suffocation, and beatings—by Russian investigators in the western Siberian city of Surgut.
Yoruba: "Ọjọ́ mẹ́sàn-án péré lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n dá Arákùnrin Dennis Christensen lẹ́bi nílé ẹjọ́ kan ní Rọ́ṣíà, ó kéré tán àwọn méje míì lára àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ni àwọn agbófinró nílùú Surgut lágbègbè Siberia ti mú, tí wọ́n sì dá lóró.

English: While torturing our brothers, the officers demanded to know the locations of their meetings and the identity of other Witnesses.
Yoruba: Bí wọ́n ṣe ń dá àwọn ará wa yìí lóró, bẹ́ẹ̀ làwọn agbófinró yẹn ń halẹ̀ mọ́ wọn pé kí wọ́n sọ ibi tí wọ́n ti ń pàdé pọ̀ àti orúkọ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí míì.

English: The incident began when authorities in Surgut carried out raids in the early morning hours of February 15, 2019.
Yoruba: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí wáyé ní àárọ̀ February 15, 2019 nígbà táwọn agbófinró fọ́n sígboro, tí wọ́n sì ń mú àwọn ará wa nílé wọn.

English: After arresting some Witnesses and taking them to the Investigative Committee offices.
Yoruba: Wọ́n kó wọn lọ sí ọ́fíìsì Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣèwádìí, wọ́n sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í fọ̀rọ̀ wá wọn lẹ́nu wò.

English: The authorities began interrogating our brothers, who refused to disclose details about their fellow worshippers.
Yoruba: Nígbà táwọn agbófinró náà rí i pé amòfin kan ṣoṣo tó wà níbẹ̀ ti lọ, ṣe ni wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí dá àwọn ará wa lóró, tí wọ́n sì ṣe wọ́n bí ọṣẹ ṣe ń ṣojú.

English: After the only legal representative present left, the victims report that the following occurred: agents put a bag over their head and sealed it with tape, tied their hands behind their back, and beat them.
Yoruba: Àwọn ará sọ ohun tí wọ́n ṣe fún wọn, wọ́n ní: àwọn agbófinró fi ọ̀rá bo ojú àwọn, wọ́n sì fi téèpù so ó pa, lẹ́yìn náà wọ́n so ọwọ́ wọn sẹ́yìn, wọ́n sì lù wọ́n nílùkulù.

English: After stripping the Witnesses naked and dousing them with water, the agents shocked them with stun guns.
Yoruba: Nígbà tó yá, wọ́n bọ́ wọn sí ìhòòhò, wọ́n yí omi dà sí wọn lára, wọ́n wá fi iná mànàmáná gbé wọn.

English: This sadistic torture lasted for about two hours.
Yoruba: Ó dunni gan-an pé nǹkan bíi wákàtí méjì gbáko ni wọ́n fi hùwà ìkà burúkú yìí sáwọn ará wa.

English: At least three Witnesses are still imprisoned.
Yoruba: Ó kéré tán, mẹ́ta nínú àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí yìí ṣì wà lẹ́wọ̀n.

English: Those who have been released sought medical attention for their injuries and filed complaints with supervisory agencies.
Yoruba: Àwọn tí wọ́n dá sílẹ̀ ti lọ sílé ìwòsàn torí pé wọ́n ṣèṣe gan-an. Wọ́n sì ti gbé ọ̀rọ̀ náà lọ sọ́dọ̀ àwọn àjọ tó ń jà fún ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn.

English: Additionally, after the mass searches were completed, the Russian authorities initiated criminal cases against a total of 19 Witnesses for so-called “participating in extremist activity” and “organizing an extremist organization.”
Yoruba: Ó yani lẹ́nu pé lẹ́yìn táwọn agbófinró ti fojú àwọn ará wa rí màbo, wọ́n tún wá fẹ̀sùn ọ̀daràn kan àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí mọ́kàndínlógún (19), wọ́n sọ pé wọ́n ń “dara pọ̀ mọ́ àwọn agbawèrèmẹ́sìn,” àti pé wọ́n ń “ṣagbátẹrù àjọ tó ń ṣètìlẹ́yìn fáwọn agbawèrèmẹ́sìn.”

English: Such an egregious abuse of authority is punishable under the Russian Criminal Code.
Yoruba: Lábẹ́ òfin ìjọba Rọ́ṣíà, wọ́n máa ń fìyà jẹ ẹni tó bá lo àṣẹ tó ní láti dá ẹlòmíì lóró.

English: Additionally, the Russian Federation is subject to several international bodies that protect individuals from torture.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ó yẹ kí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà tẹ̀ lé òfin tí àwọn àjọ àgbáyé gbé kalẹ̀ tó sọ pé kò yẹ kí ẹnikẹ́ni máa fi àṣẹ ìjọba dáni lóró.

English: Therefore, we will pursue all available legal remedies, both domestic and international, for this crime.
Yoruba: Torí náà, a máa lo gbogbo ẹ̀tọ́ tá a ní láti gbé ọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ sí ilé ẹjọ́ ní Rọ́ṣíà, àá sì gbé e lọ sáwọn àjọ àgbáyé míì ká lè rí i dájú pé wọ́n dá ẹjọ́ àwọn ará wa bó ṣe tọ́.

English: Ultimately, we know that Jehovah has seen the persecution of our brothers in Russia and will act as their ‘helper and rescuer.’—Psalm 70:5."
Yoruba: Lékè gbogbo ẹ̀, a mọ̀ pé Jèhófà ń rí bí wọ́n ṣe ń fojú pọ́n àwọn ará wa ní Rọ́ṣíà, ó sì máa gbé ìgbésẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ‘olùrànlọ́wọ́ àti olùgbàlà wọn.’​—Sáàmù 70:5."

English: "On Thursday, May 3, 2018, the Saint Petersburg City Court upheld the original December 2017 decision, allowing the Russian government to immediately confiscate our former Russia branch facilities in Solnechnoye.
Yoruba: "Ní Thursday, May 3, 2018, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Saint Petersburg fọwọ́ sí ìpinnu tí ilé ẹjọ́ ti kọ́kọ́ ṣe ní December 2017, wọ́n ní ẹsẹ̀kẹsẹ̀ ni kí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa àtijọ́ tó wà ní Solnechnoye lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà.

English: Although we cannot stop Russia from seizing the property, today’s ruling is part of an application that is already being considered by the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR).
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé a ò lè dá ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà dúró kí wọ́n má gba ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù ti gbọ́ sí ẹjọ́ tí ilé ẹjọ́ dá fún wa lónìí, wọ́n sì ti ń gbé e yẹ̀ wò.

English: The ECHR has communicated to the Russian government that our application is being considered as a matter of priority.
Yoruba: Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti kàn sí ìjọba Rọ́ṣíà pé ẹjọ́ wa wà lára ẹjọ́ táwọn kọ́kọ́ ń fún láfiyèsí.

English: We keep in expectation of Jehovah, the God of all justice, to correct matters in his own due time.—Isaiah 30:18."
Yoruba: Ojú Jèhófà, Ọlọ́run tó máa ń dá gbogbo ẹjọ́ bó ṣe tọ́ là ń wò báyìí. A retí pé tó bá tó àkókò lójú ẹ̀, ó máa yanjú ọ̀rọ̀ náà.​—Aísáyà 30:18."

English: "A United Nations (UN) panel of human rights experts has issued a 15-page opinion concluding that Russia violated international law by arresting and detaining 18 Jehovah’s Witnesses in different cities from May 2018 to July 2019. Ultimately, the panel demands the immediate and unconditional release of those Witnesses who are still detained.
Yoruba: "Àwùjọ àwọn onímọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ kan tó ń rí sí ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn lábẹ́ Àjọ Ìṣọ̀kan Àgbáyé kọ ìwé kan tó ní ojú ìwé mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún (15). Nínú ìwé náà, wọ́n sọ pé ìjọba Rọ́ṣíà ti tẹ òfin àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè lójú, bí wọ́n ṣe fi àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà méjìdínlógún (18) sátìmọ́lé láwọn ìlú ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀, láti May 2018 sí July 2019. Wọ́n ní kí àwọn aláṣẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́síà dá àwọn ará wa tó wà látìmọ́lé sílẹ̀ lẹ́sẹ̀kẹsẹ̀, kí wọ́n sì máa lọ lómìnira.

English: An advance copy of the panel’s opinion was released on May 15, 2020. The final version will be available on the UN’s website soon.
Yoruba: Àwọn onímọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ náà gbé ìpinnu tí wọ́n kọ́kọ́ ṣe jáde ní May 15, 2020. Wọ́n máa tó gbé ibi tí wọ́n parí ọ̀rọ̀ náà sí jáde lórí ìkànnì Àjọ Ìṣọ̀kan Àgbáyé.

English: This is the third time in the past year that the panel, the Working Group on Arbitrary Detention, has issued such a conclusion in favor of our fellow believers.
Yoruba: Ìgbà kẹta rèé lẹ́nu àìpẹ́ yìí, tí àwùjọ àwọn onímọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ tó ń rí sí ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn tí wọ́n fi sátìmọ́lé lọ́nà àìtọ́ máa gbèjà àwọn ará wa.

English: In its latest opinion, the Working Group condemns numerous aspects of Russia’s overt maltreatment of our brothers and sisters.
Yoruba: Nínú ìwé tí wọ́n kọ kẹ́yìn, wọ́n bẹnu àtẹ́ lu oríṣiríṣi ìwà ìkà tí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà ń hù sáwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin.

English: Addressing the authorities’ use of “extraordinary force” when arresting the Witnesses, the Working Group concludes that “there were no grounds justifying such action on behalf of the police”.
Yoruba: Àwùjọ náà sọ pé, kò sí ẹ̀rí tó lẹ́sẹ̀ nílẹ̀ tó fi yẹ káwọn ọlọ́pàá orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà fipá mú àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.

English: They emphasize that “none of [the Witnesses] should have been arrested and held in pretrial detention and no trial of any of them should take or should have taken place.”
Yoruba: Wọ́n tún sọ pé, “kò sí ìkankan nínú [àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà] tó yẹ kí wọ́n fi sátìmọ́lé, kò sì yẹ kí wọ́n gbé ìkankan nínú wọn lọ sí ilé ẹjọ́.”

English: The panel categorically refutes the charge of so-called extremist activity.
Yoruba: Àwùjọ náà bẹnu àtẹ́ lu ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi ń kan àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà pé wọ́n jẹ́ agbawèrèmẹ́sìn.

English: It explains that the brothers and sisters have done nothing more than observe “the peaceful exercise of their right to freedom of religion.”
Yoruba: Wọ́n ní ohun táwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin ń ṣe ò ju pé “wọ́n ń lo ẹ̀tọ́ tí wọ́n ní láti máa jọ́sìn láìdí ẹnikẹ́ni lọ́wọ́.”

English: In the opinion, the rights experts also denounce the courtroom tactics used to try our brothers.
Yoruba: Nínú ìwé tí wọ́n kọ, wọ́n tún jẹ́ kó ṣe kedere pé bí wọ́n ṣe ń gbọ́ ẹjọ́ àwọn ará wa nílé ẹjọ̀ kò tọ́ rárá.

English: For example, during their pretrial detention extension hearings, two of the sisters were kept in cages in the courtrooms.
Yoruba: Bí apẹẹrẹ, inú àhámọ́ ni wọ́n fi àwọn arábìnrin wa méjì sí nílé ẹjọ́ nígbà tí wọ́n ń gbọ́ ẹjọ́ wọn.

English: As the Working Group explains, international law recognizes the right of all persons “to be presumed innocent until proven guilty in accordance with the law.”
Yoruba: Nínú àlàyé táwọn onímọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ náà ṣe, wọ́n ní òfin àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè jẹ́ ká mọ̀ pé ẹ̀tọ́ ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ni “pé kí wọ́n fojú aláìmọwọ́mẹsẹ̀ wò ó, títí wọ́n á fi rí i dájú pé onítọ̀hún jẹ̀bi ẹsùn tí wọ́n fi kàn án.”

English: For that reason, our sisters should not have been “shackled or kept in cages during trials or otherwise presented to the court in a manner indicating that they may be dangerous criminals.”
Yoruba: Torí náà, kò yẹ kí wọ́n fi “ṣẹkẹ́ṣẹkẹ̀ sí àwọn arábìnrin wa lọ́wọ́ tàbí kí wọ́n fi wọ́n sínú àhámọ́ nígbà tí wọ́n ń gbọ́ ẹjọ́ wọn, torí ìyẹn á jẹ́ káwọn èèyàn máa fi ojú ọ̀daràn paraku wò wọ́n.”

English: The Working Group demands that Russia expunge the criminal records of all 18 Witnesses and compensate them in accordance with international law.
Yoruba: Àwùjọ náà tún sọ pé kí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà wọ́gi lé àkọ́sílẹ̀ ẹ̀sùn ọ̀daràn tí wọ́n fi kan àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà méjìdínlógún (18) náà.

English: Further, the country is called upon to “ensure a full and independent investigation of the circumstances surrounding the arbitrary deprivation of liberty” and “take appropriate measures against those responsible for the violation of [the Witnesses’] rights.”
Yoruba: Kí wọ́n sì tún san owó gbà-má-bínú fún wọn, bí òfin àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè ṣe sọ. Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, wọ́n ní kí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè náà “ṣèwádìí fínnífínní nípa ohun tó mú káwọn aláṣẹ hùwà àìtọ́ yìí,” kí wọ́n sì “gbé ìgbẹ́sẹ̀ lórí àwọn tó ń fi ẹ̀tọ́ [àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà] dù wọ́n.”

English: The opinion notes that the 18 Witnesses are “part of a now ever-growing number of Jehovah’s Witnesses in Russia who have been arrested, detained, and charged with criminal activity on the basis of mere exercise of freedom of religion.”
Yoruba: Wọ́n tún sọ nínú ìwé náà pé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà méjìdínlógún (18) tí wọ́n mú wulẹ̀ jẹ́ díẹ̀ “lára ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Rọ́ṣíà, tí wọ́n fi sátìmọ́lé, tí wọ́n sì fi ẹ̀sùn kàn pé wọ́n jẹ́ ọ̀daràn, torí pé wọ́n ń lo ẹ̀tọ́ tí wọ́n ní láti máa ṣe ìsìn wọn.”

English: A right protected by an international covenant to which Russia is a party.
Yoruba: Kẹ́ ẹ sì máa wò ó o, orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà wà lára àwọn tó fọwọ́ sí ẹ̀tọ́ yìí nínú àdéhùn táwọn orílẹ̀-èdè ṣe.

English: Therefore, although the present opinion focuses on the 18 named brothers and sisters, the Working Group was unequivocal that the findings “apply to all others in similar situations.”
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ẹjọ́ àwọn ará wa méjìdínlógún (18) ni ìwé tí àwùjọ náà kọ dá lé, wọ́n tún jẹ́ kó ṣe kedere pé ohun tí wọ́n sọ “kan gbogbo àwọn míì tó wà nírú ipò yẹn.”

English: The Working Group’s call to action does not guarantee that our brothers and sisters in Russia will be exonerated, but there is hope that it may improve the situation.
Yoruba: Kò sí ẹ̀rí tó dájú pé ìwé táwọn onímọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ yìí kọ máa mú kí àwọn aláṣẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà dá àwọn ará wa sílẹ̀, àmọ́ a gbà pé ó ṣeé ṣe kó mú kí ọ̀rọ̀ náà yanjú déwọ̀n àyè kan.

English: We await Russia’s response.
Yoruba: À ń retí ohun táwọn aláṣẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà máa ṣe sọ́rọ̀ yìí.

English: In the meantime, as our brothers and sisters in Russia courageously endure persecution, we know our loving Father, Jehovah, will continue to fill them with joy and peace for trusting in him.—Romans 15:13."
Yoruba: Ní báyìí ná, a mọ̀ pé àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó wà ní Rọ́ṣíà á máa fara da inúnibíni tí wọ́n ń ṣe sí wọn, a sì mọ̀ pé Jèhófà, Baba wa onífẹ̀ẹ́, á jẹ́ kí wọ́n máa láyọ̀, kí ọkàn wọn sì balẹ̀, torí pé òun ni wọ́n gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé.​—Róòmù 15:13."

English: On Tuesday, June 9, 2020, the Pskov City Court convicted 61-year-old Brother Gennady Shpakovskiy and sentenced him to six and a half years in prison.
Yoruba: Lọ́jọ́ Tuesday, June 9, 2020, ilé ẹjọ́ Pskov City Court dẹ́bi fún Arákùnrin Gennady Shpakovskiy tó jẹ́ ẹni ọdún mọ́kànlélọ́gọ́ta (61), wọ́n sì dájọ́ ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́fà àtààbọ̀ fún un.

English: He was immediately taken to prison from the courtroom.
Yoruba: Ẹsẹ̀kẹsẹ̀ tí wọ́n dájọ́ fún un tán ni wọ́n mú un lọ sínú ẹ̀wọ̀n.

English: This is the longest sentence handed down to one of our brothers since the 2017 Russian Supreme Court ruling that effectively criminalized our activity.
Yoruba: Iye ọdún tí wọ́n dá fún arákùnrin wa yìí ló ṣì pọ̀ jù láti ọdún 2017 tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ní Rọ́ṣíà ti ṣòfin pé ọ̀daràn ni ẹnikẹ́ni tí wọ́n bá rí tó ń ṣe ẹ̀sìn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.

English: Brother Shpakovskiy will appeal the conviction.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Shpakovskiy máa pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn lórí ẹjọ́ tí wọ́n dá fún un.

English: "Judge Oleg Golovashko of the Prohladniy District Court in Russia announced the verdict in the case against Brother Arkadya Akopyan on Thursday, December 27.
Yoruba: "Ní Thursday, December 27, Adájọ́ Oleg Golovashko ti Ilé Ẹjọ́ Agbègbè Prohladniy ní Rọ́ṣíà sọ ìpinnu ilé ẹjọ́ lórí ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kan Arákùnrin Arkadya Akopyan.

English: The court sentenced Brother Akopyan, a 70-year-old retired tailor, to 120 hours of community service based on the absurd accusation that he allegedly commissioned non-Witnesses to distribute extremist literature.
Yoruba: Ilé ẹjọ́ sọ pé Arákùnrin Akopyan, tó jẹ́ ẹni àádọ́rin (70) ọdún tó ti fẹ̀yìn tì nídìí iṣẹ́ télọ̀, máa fi ọgọ́fà (120) wákàtí ṣe iṣẹ́ ìlú torí ẹ̀sùn èké tí wọ́n fi kàn án pé ó rán àwọn tí kì í ṣe Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà pé kí wọ́n lọ máa pín ìwé àwọn agbawèrèmẹ́sìn kiri.

English: While Brother Akopyan was not sentenced to prison, this conviction is a gross violation of human rights.
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé wọn ò rán Arákùnrin Akopyan lẹ́wọ̀n, ẹjọ́ tí wọ́n dá fún un yìí ta ko ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn.

English: Therefore, the ruling will be appealed to a higher court.
Yoruba: Nítorí náà, a máa pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn sí ilé gíga.

English: In the coming weeks, we anticipate a judgment on the case involving Dennis Christensen.
Yoruba: Ní ọ̀sẹ̀ díẹ̀ sí i, à ń retí ìdájọ́ tí ilé ẹjọ́ máa ṣe lórí ẹjọ́ Arákùnrin Dennis Christensen.

English: We pray that Jehovah continues to support and comfort our brothers and sisters in Russia who are facing imprisonment for their faith.—2 Thessalonians 2:16, 17."
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà máa ti àwọn ará wa ní Rọ́ṣíà lẹ́yìn, kó sì máa tù wọ́n nínú torí bí wọ́n ṣe ń fi wọ́n sẹ́wọ̀n nítorí ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́.—2 Tẹsalóníkà 2:16, 17."

English: "The Vilyuchinsk City Court is expected to announce its verdict in the trial involving Brother Mikhail Popov and his wife, Sister Yelena Popova, on Thursday, February 13, 2020.
Yoruba: "A retí pé kí ilé ẹjọ́ Vilyuchinsk City Court sọ ìdájọ́ wọn lórí ọ̀rọ̀ Arákùnrin Mikhail Popov àti ìyàwó rẹ̀ Arábìnrin Yelena Popova lọ́jọ́ Thursday, February 13, 2020.

English: The couple was arrested on July 30, 2018, in Kamchatka and were released on August 9, 2018. They have been charged with engaging in “extremist activity.”
Yoruba: Wọ́n mú tọkọtaya yìí ní July 30, 2018 ní ìlú Kamchatka, àmọ́ wọ́n fi wọ́n sílẹ̀ ní August 9, 2018. Ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kàn wọ́n ni pé wọ́n ń lọ́wọ́ sí “iṣẹ́ agbawèrèmẹ́sìn.”

English: Mikhail and Yelena are relying on Jehovah as they face this distressing trial. We are confident that he will continue to be a “refuge and strength” for them.—Psalm 46:1."
Yoruba: Mikhail àti Yelena gbára lé Jèhófà pátápátá bí wọ́n ṣe ń fara da ipò tó le koko yìí. Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà á máa bá a lọ láti jẹ́ ‘ibi ààbò àti okun’fún wọn.—Sáàmù 46:1."

English: "Brother Vladimir Alushkin was released from prison and reunited with his wife on March 30, 2020.
Yoruba: "A láyọ̀ láti sọ fún yín pé wọ́n ti dá Arákùnrin Vladimir Alushkin sílẹ̀ lẹ́wọ̀n ní March 30, 2020, inú òun àti ìyàwó ẹ̀ sì dùn gan-an pé àwọn tún jọ wà pa pọ̀.

English: His release was the result of the previously reported March 25 decision by the Penza Regional Court.
Yoruba: Tẹ́ ò bá gbàgbé, a gbé ìròyìn kan jáde ní March 25 nípa bí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Kòtẹ́milọ́rùn tó wà nílùú Penza ṣe fagi lé ìpinnu tí ilé ẹjọ́ àkọ́kọ́ ṣe, tí wọ́n sì ní kí wọ́n tún ẹjọ́ náà gbọ́.

English: The ruling overturned the conviction of Brothers Vladimir Alushkin, Vladimir Kulyasov, Andrey Magliv, and Denis Timoshin, as well as Sisters Tatyana Alushkina and Galiya Olkhova.
Yoruba: Ìpinnu ilé ẹjọ́ kejì jẹ́ kó ṣe kedere pé Arákùnrin Vladimir Alushkin, Vladimir Kulyasov, Andrey Magliv àti Arákùnrin Denis Timoshin kò jẹ̀bi ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kàn wọ́n, bákan náà lọ̀rọ̀ sì rí pẹ̀lú Arábìnrin Tatyana Alushkina àti Galiya Olkhova.

English: The Penza Regional Court returned the case to the original court for consideration by a different judge.
Yoruba: Nípa bẹ́ẹ̀, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Kòtẹ́milọ́rùn tó wà nílùú Penza ní kí ilé ẹjọ́ àkọ́kọ́ yan adájọ́ míì láti tún ẹjọ́ náà gbọ́.

English: In the meantime, all six remain under travel and other restrictions.
Yoruba: Kó tó di pé wọ́n tún ẹjọ́ yẹn gbọ́, wọ́n fòfin de àwọn ará wa mẹ́fẹ̀ẹ̀fà yẹn pé wọn ò gbọ́dọ̀ rìnrìn-àjò, wọ́n sì tún fi àwọn ẹ̀tọ́ míì dù wọ́n.

English: Although we are pleased to hear Brother Alushkin was released, just two days later another one of our brothers was convicted for his faith in far northeastern Russia.
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé inú wa dùn gan-an pé wọ́n ti dá Arákùnrin Alushkin sílẹ̀ lẹ́wọ̀n, ó ká wa lára pé lọ́jọ́ méjì lẹ́yìn náà, wọ́n tún mú ọ̀kan lára àwọn arákùnrin wa lápá àríwá orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà nítorí ohun tó gbà gbọ́.

English: As long as these baseless legal attacks continue, we know that our brothers and sisters in Russia will keep close in mind the words at Nahum 1:7: “Jehovah is good, a stronghold in the day of distress. He is mindful of those seeking refuge in him.”"
Yoruba: Títí dìgbà táwọn èèyàn fi máa ṣíwọ́ àtimáa fẹ̀sùn tí kò lẹ́sẹ̀ nílẹ̀ kan àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin, ó dá wa lójú pé àwọn ará wa yìí á máa fi ọ̀rọ̀ tó wà nínú Náhúmù 1:7 sọ́kàn, èyí tó sọ pé: “Jèhófà jẹ́ ẹni rere, odi agbára ní ọjọ́ wàhálà. Ó sì mọ àwọn tó ń wá ibi ààbò lọ́dọ̀ rẹ̀.”"

English: "The Pskov City Court will announce its verdict on June 8, 2020, in the trial involving 61-year-old Brother Gennady Shpakovskiy.
Yoruba: "Ilé ẹjọ́ ìlú Pskov máa gbé ìdájọ́ ẹ̀ kalẹ̀ ní June 8, 2020, lórí ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kan Arákùnrin Gennady Shpakovskiy, ẹni ọdún mọ́kànlélọ́gọ́ta (61).

English: He is being accused of “extremist” activity simply for holding small Christian meetings in his home, the prosecution has asked the court to sentence Brother Shpakovskiy to seven and a half years in prison.
Yoruba: Wọ́n fẹ̀sùn agbawèrèmẹ́sìn kàn-án torí ìpàdé Kristẹni tí wọn ń ṣe nílé ẹ̀. Agbẹjọ́rò ìjọba ti sọ pé kí ilé ẹjọ́ rán Arákùnrin Shpakovskiy lọ sẹ́wọ̀n ọdún méje àtààbọ̀.

English: In early 2018, Federal State Security (FSB) agents wiretapped the Shpakovskiy’s apartment and monitored their activity for several months.
Yoruba: Ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ 2018, àwọn ọ̀lọ́pàá ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́ orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí yọ́ kẹ́lẹ́ fi ẹ̀rọ gbọ́ ohun tí wọ́n ń sọ nínú ilé Shpakovskiy, wọ́n sì ń ṣọ́ wọn lọ́wọ́ lẹ́sẹ̀ fún ọ̀pọ̀ oṣù.

English: On June 3, 2018, at 12:45 p.m., FSB agents supported by armed National Guard officers forced open the front door of their apartment, where people were gathered for a peaceful meeting, and searched the home for six hours.
Yoruba: Ní June 3, 2018, ní aago kan ku ìṣẹ́jú mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún lọ́sàn-án, àwọn ọlọ́pàá ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́, papọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹ̀ṣọ́ orílẹ̀-èdè náà, fi tipátipá ṣí ilẹ̀kùn iwájú ilé náà, níbi tí àwọn èèyàn péjọ sí láti ṣe ìpàdé ní wọ́ọ́rọ́wọ́, wọ́n sì wá gbogbo inú ilé náà fún wákàtí mẹ́fà.

English: The FSB agents confiscated tablets and cell phones and took the Witnesses away for interrogation.
Yoruba: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́ gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé tábílẹ́tì àti fóònù àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí náà, wọ́n sì kó wọn lọ fún ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò.

English: The interrogators insulted the Witnesses and threatened them with dismissal from work and criminal prosecution.
Yoruba: Àwọn tó ń fọ̀rọ̀ wá wọn lẹ́nu wò bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí bú wọn, wọ́n sì ń halẹ mọ́ wọn pé wọ́n máa pàdánù iṣẹ́ wọn, wọ́n á sì lọ sẹ́wọ̀n.

English: Brother Shpakovskiy’s interrogation lasted until 10 p.m.
Yoruba: Ó tó aago mẹ́wàá alẹ́ kí ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò Arákùnrin Shpakovskiy tó parí.

English: On March 19, 2019, Brother Shpakovskiy was charged with organizing the activities of an “extremist” organization.
Yoruba: Ní March 19, 2019, wọ́n fẹ̀sùn kan Arákùnrin Shpakovskiy pé ó ń ṣètò ìgbòkègbodò ẹgbẹ́ agbawèrèmẹ́sìn.

English: Five months later, the accusation of “financing extremist activities” was added to the criminal charge.
Yoruba: Oṣù márùn-ún lẹ́yìn náà, wọ́n fi ẹ̀sùn míì kàn-án pé ó ń fi owó ṣe ìtìlẹ́yìn fún ìgbòkègbodò ẹgbẹ́ àwọn agbawèrèmẹ́sìn.

English: As the verdict approaches, we pray in full confidence that Jehovah will help the Shpakovskiy family remain strong, knowing that their faithful endurance will be rewarded.—2 Chronicles 15:7."
Yoruba: Bí ìgbẹ́jọ́ náà ṣe ń sún mọ́lé, a gbàdúrà pẹ̀lú ìgbẹ́kẹ̀lé kíkún pé Jèhófà máa ran ìdílé Shpakovskiy lọ́wọ́ láti dúró gbọin, a sì mọ̀ pé èrè wà fún ìfaradà wọn.​—2 Kíróníkà 15:7."

English: "On September 2, 2019, the Zheleznodorozhniy District Court of Khabarovsk, Russia, sentenced Brother Valeriy Moskalenko to two years and two months of community service and another six months of probation.
Yoruba: "Ní September 2, 2019, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Àgbègbè Zheleznodorozhniy ní ìlú Khabarovsk lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà dájọ́ pé kí Arákùnrin Valeriy Moskalenko lọ ṣe iṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú fún ọdún méjì àti oṣù méjì.

English: He will not need to spend any additional time in prison.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀yìn ìyẹn ní wọ́n á wá máa ṣọ́ ọ lọ́wọ́ lẹ́sẹ̀ fún oṣù mẹ́fà. Ìyẹn túmọ̀ sí pé kò ní pa dà sẹ́wọ̀n mọ́.

English: After the verdict was announced, Brother Moskalenko was released from custody to the delight of his family and friends. He had been in jail since August 2, 2018.
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn tí ilé ẹjọ́ kéde ìdájọ́ yìí, wọ́n dá Arákùnrin Moskalenko sílẹ̀ lẹ́wọ̀n, inú ìdílé àtàwọn ọ̀rẹ́ rẹ̀ sì dùn gan-an.

English: Before his arrest, he worked as an assistant train conductor while caring for his sick mother.
Yoruba: Láti August 2, 2018 ló ti wà lẹ́wọ̀n. Kí wọ́n tó fi í sẹ́wọ̀n, iṣẹ́ tó ń ṣe ni pé ó máa ń ran ẹni tó ń wa ọkọ̀ ojú irin lọ́wọ́, ó sì tún ń tọ́jú ìyá rẹ̀ tó ń ṣàìsàn.

English: Under the terms of his probation, he cannot travel outside Khabarovsk and must report for a criminal-executive inspection every month.
Yoruba: Lára àwọn ìkálọ́wọ́kò tí wọ́n fún un lásìkò tí wọ́n fi ń ṣọ́ ọ lọ́wọ́ lẹ́sẹ̀ ni pé kò gbọdọ̀ jáde kúrò nílùú Khabarovsk, ó sì gbọ́dọ̀ máa lọ sí àgọ́ ọlọ́pàá lóṣooṣù kí wọ́n lè rí i pé kò ṣe ohunkóhun tí kò bófin mu.

English: In his closing statement to the court on August 30, Brother Moskalenko said in part: “It is completely unthinkable for me to go against the will of God that is clearly expressed in the Bible.
Yoruba: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ tí Arákùnrin Moskalenko sọ kẹ́yìn nílé ẹjọ́ ní August 30, ó sọ pé: “Mi ò ni ṣe ohun tó lòdì sí ìfẹ́ Ọlọ́run bó ṣe wà nínú Bíbélì láé.

English: And regardless of how I might be pressured or punished, even if I were sentenced to death, I declare that not even then would I abandon the almighty Creator of the universe, Jehovah God.”
Yoruba: Bó ti wù kí ilé ẹjọ́ yìí fìyà jẹ mí tó, kódà tí wọ́n bá dájọ́ ikú fún mi, mi ò ni fi Jèhófà, Ọlọ́run Olódùmarè àti Ẹlẹ́dàá ayé àtọ̀run sílẹ̀ láé.”

English: Yaroslav Sivulskiy, a representative from the European Association of Jehovah’s Witnesses, states: “While we do not agree with the guilty verdict, we are glad that Valeriy can return home.”
Yoruba: Yaroslav Sivulskiy, tó jẹ́ aṣojú Àjọ European Association of Jehovah’s Witnesses, sọ pé: “Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé a ò gbà pé a jẹ̀bi ẹ̀sùn náà, àmọ́ inú wa dùn pé Valeriy máa lè pa dà sílé.”

English: In addition to Brother Moskalenko, seven more of our brothers in the Khabarovsk Territory are awaiting verdicts in their criminal cases.
Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ sí Arákùnrin Moskalenko, àwọn arákùnrin wa méje míì wà ní ìlú Khabarovsk tó ń retí ìgbà tí wọ́n máa dá ẹjọ́ ẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn tí wọ́n fi kàn wọ́n.

English: We are thankful to Jehovah that Brother Moskalenko maintained his strong faith during his detention.
Yoruba: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà pé Arákùnrin Moskalenkodúró gbọin nígbà tó wà lẹ́wọ̀n.

English: We pray that He will continue to supply strength to all the brothers and sisters who are enduring persecution for their Bible-based convictions.—Isaiah 40:31."
Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà túbọ̀ máa fún àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa lókun bí wọ́n ṣe ń fara da inúnibíni nítorí ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́.​—Àìsáyà 40:31."

English: "On August 13, 2019, the appeals court in the city of Kirov ruled to release 26-year-old Brother Andrey Suvorkov from house arrest.
Yoruba: Ní August 13, 2019, ilé ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn tó wà ní ìlú Kirov dájọ́ pé kí wọn jẹ́ ki Arákùnrin Andrey Suvorkov tó jẹ́ ẹni ọdún mẹ́rìndínlọ́gbọ̀n (26) pé kò lómìnira láti jáde kúrò nílé.

English: Although Brother Suvorkov has been given greater freedom, the criminal case against him remains open.
Yoruba: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé wọ́n fún Arákùnrin Suvorkov lómìnira tó pọ̀ si i, síbẹ̀ ẹ̀sùn ọ̀daràn tí wọ́n fi kàn án ṣì wà síbẹ̀.

English: As previously reported, Brother Suvorkov was arrested, along with his stepfather and three other brothers, when local police and masked special forces raided 19 homes in Kirov on October 9, 2018.
Yoruba: Bó ṣe wà nínú ìròyìn tá a gbé jáde ṣáájú, ní October 9, 2018 àwọn ọlọ́pàá àtàwọn agbófinró tó fi nǹkan bojú ya wọ ilé mọ́kàndínlógún (19) lára ilé àwọn ará wa, ìgbà yẹn ni wọ́n mú Arákùnrin Suvorkov, ọkọ ìyá rẹ̀ àtàwọn arákùnrin mẹ́ta míì.

English: Thinking back to when his home was searched, Brother Suvorkov states: “Many of our valuable items were confiscated.
Yoruba: Arákùnrin Suvorkov sọ ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbà tí wọ́n wá tú ilé rẹ̀, ó ní: “Wọ́n kó púpọ̀ nínú àwọn ohun ìní wa.

English: But my wife and I didn’t worry about it, since we always tried to keep our life simple and not get too attached to material things.
Yoruba: Àmọ́, èmi àti ìyàwó mi ò ronú nípa ìyẹn torí a ti jẹ́ kí ohun díẹ̀ tẹ́ wa lọ́rùn, a ò sì kì í ṣàníyàn púpọ̀ nípa àwọn nǹkan tara.

English: The counsel from Matthew 6:21, ‘for where your treasure is, there your heart will be also,’ helped us remain calm.”
Yoruba: Ìmọ̀ràn tó wà ní Mátíù 6:21 ti ràn wá lọ́wọ́ gan-an, ó sọ pé, ‘ibi tí ìṣúra yín bá wà ibẹ̀ ni ọkàn yín náà máa wà,’ ìyẹn ni kò jẹ́ ká kọ́kàn sókè.”

English: Following the raids, criminal cases were opened against Brother Suvorkov, his stepfather, and the three other brothers for singing Kingdom songs, studying religious literature, and possessing a copy of the Russian New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures.
